subject: External Practical Exam Schedule (2nd Semester)
snippet: Dear Students, This is to inform you that the University Practical/Viva Examinations for 2nd Semester B.Tech. CSE is scheduled to commence from 26/05/2025 (Monday). Please find the detailed examination
content:
Dear Students,

This is to inform you that the University Practical/Viva Examinations for
2nd Semester B.Tech. CSE is scheduled to commence from 26/05/2025 (Monday).
Please find the detailed examination schedule attached to this email.

   -

   *Practical Examinations* will be conducted from *9:00 AM to 12:00 PM* for
   all students.
   -

   *Viva-Voce* will be conducted *in parallel during the practical
sessions* and
   will continue till completion.

You are all requested to *strictly adhere to the University Rules and
Regulations* throughout the examination process.

For any queries or clarifications, kindly *contact me directly* to avoid
any confusion or miscommunication.



*With regards,*
*Ankita Amaravat*
*Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR,*
*Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT)*- Changa,
Email: ankitaamaravat.cse@charusat.ac.in
Mo. +91 9727932229

--

subject: Regarding Counseling meeting
snippet: Dear Students, You have to attend an online counseling meeting scheduled today at 2:00 PM to support your academic and personal progress. The session aims to provide guidance, address any concerns, and
content:
Dear Students,

You have to attend an online counseling meeting scheduled *today at 2:00
P.M* to support your academic and personal progress. The session aims to
provide guidance, address any concerns, and help you make the most of your
educational journey. You have to join the meeting without fail.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <aictenoreply@aicte-india.org>
Date: Tue, May 13, 2025 at 4:49‚ÄØPM
Subject: Invitation to join the Launch of ‚ÄúAICTE Productization Fellowship
(APF) Scheme‚Äù & YUKTI Innovation Challenge 2025 on 14th May, 2025
(Wednesday) at 12 Noon by Hon‚Äôble Chairman, AICTE - reg
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/ Madam,

Greetings from AICTE, New Delhi!

AICTE is happy to invite all the faculty members, students of AICTE
Approved Institutions for the launch of  * ‚ÄúAICTE Productization Fellowship
(APF)  * * Scheme‚Äù & YUKTI Innovation Challenge 2025. *

* AICTE Productization Fellowship (APF) *  intends to support Student/Group
of Students working on innovative ideas to develop  * New Product /
Services *  which would address mainly the problems in the Society /
Introduce new innovative products or services to the market as per dynamic
needs of the Market/Society.

The main objective of the scheme is to support Innovative Ideas to convert
into a new Product/Service which can drive future economic growth and
contribute to the Nations Vision of  * ‚ÄúATMANIRBHAR BHARAT‚Äù. *

* For more details:  https://yukti.mic.gov.in/aicte-fellowship
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVBFpN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoaRghFUExbDVYfBF1FTA9cGlRcABcHFAdXWw4ORBVbWEA=&ext=>
*

* YUKTI Innovation Challenge 2025 (YIC 2025)  * in its 4th edition provides
a platform for eligible innovators with technology-based solutions at TRL 4
and above (as registered in the YUKTI Innovation Repository of IIC
institutions). Selected innovation teams will undergo a comprehensive
learning process involving experiential learning, mentoring, and evaluation
to achieve problem-solution fit, product-market fit, and business model
fit. The program also offers connections to investors, incubation support,
and financial assistance opportunities to transform innovations into
successful start-ups.

* For more details:  https://yukti.mic.gov.in/YIC2025
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVC1NN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoaRghFUExbDVYfBF1FTA9cGmx8IFFSC1Q=&ext=>
*

  * The details of the online meeting are as follows: *

* Title: *   Launch of ‚ÄúAICTE Productization Fellowship (APF) Scheme‚Äù &
YUKTI Innovation Challenge 2025

* Date and Time:  *  May 14, 2025 (Wednesday) 12:00 Noon

* Link: *   https://aicteindia.webex.com/aicteindia/j.php?MTID=m9e735c39bf92566ae0238e51c5f3733d
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVC1JN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoCWgBFXAtYAFxQTUVWAANKG1ZaDkwDUAJGUgsPVw9SHlpMSVhF&ext=TVRJRD1tOWU3MzVjMzliZjkyNTY2YWUwMjM4ZTUxYzVmMzczM2Q=>

* Password: *   * 1234 *

The Scheme Guidelines document is available on the AICTE website:  AICTE
Students Development Schemes
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVC1FN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoURBQfWAtVEFAcClxXCwccWkdSTBABUQRfUhFOQBJGVVUMTUMYUlRGA1RaQQwDWEUYRVMLU1xWEQ==&ext=>
.

* In view of the foregoing, you are kindly requested to make necessary
arrangements to join the Online Event from a Conference Hall/Auditorium, so
that maximum number of students can attend the launch event (mainly for the
Students). The APF Scheme is being introduced by the Council, which will
benefit the students irrespective of the Year, Branch / Program etc. can
attend the launch event. *

We look forward to your participation in this significant event.

PFA:- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cBsZrD8hwlK69twkBqJ1FX9AZYeuIQQX/view?usp=sharing
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CFQBBgkfAhlVC1BN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DInvitation%2Bto%2Bjoin%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoHQQpHXExRC1pWD1cdAQlfGlNcDwZNXU4DVCASaRR3CVgVVXsDD0VHDXpEe1Agbgh0bGkGQ3hiM2lOR19dFA==&ext=dXNwPXNoYXJpbmc=>


* With Regards, *

* Team AICTE Productization Fellowship (APF), SAG Bureau. *

--

subject: Fwd: Innovation Nexus : A Symposium on Multidisciplinary Research Collaboration
snippet: Dear All, Smt. Chandaben Mohanbhai Patel Institute of Computer Applications (CMPICA), Faculty of Computer Science and Applications (FCA), CHARUSAT, Changa, is organizing "Innovation Nexus: A
content:
Dear All,

Smt. Chandaben Mohanbhai Patel Institute of Computer Applications (CMPICA),
Faculty of Computer Science and Applications (FCA), CHARUSAT, Changa, is
organizing "*Innovation Nexus: A Symposium on
Multidisciplinary Research Collaboration*".

This symposium is designed to provide a dynamic platform for researchers,
faculty members, and students to collaborate across disciplines,
encouraging innovative research and fostering academic growth. A
distinguished expert in industrial AI/ML projects will deliver an
insightful session on the latest technological developments in Artificial
Intelligence and its applications in diverse research domains.

An exciting opportunity for research scholars, faculty members, and
students from various disciplines to showcase their research through *engaging
poster presentation sessions*. This competition aims to promote research
dissemination in emerging areas of knowledge.

   -

   *Date:* 7th June 2025 (Saturday)
   -

   *Time:* 10:00 AM to 04:00 PM
   -

   *Venue:* CMPICA, CHARUSAT, Off Nadiad-Petlad Highway, Changa, Dist.
   Anand, Gujarat, India.


All the researchers, faculty members, and students are invited to register
for the same.

*Expert Talk *


   - *Speaker:* Dr. Nidhi Arora
   - *Designation:* Co-Founder and Director - AI, Advic Tech, Sola,
   Ahmedabad
   - *Expertise:* Microsoft Certified Data Analyst Associate, AI/ML
   Practitioner, GenAI Consultant, MLOps Speaker, Automation Specialist
   - *Topic:* *AI for Interdisciplinary Applications*

We cordially invite all researchers, faculty members, and postgraduate
students to register and participate.

üîó *Register here:* https://bit.ly/Innovation-Nexus

For further details, kindly refer to the attached brochure.

Warm regards,
*Organizing Team*
CMPICA, CHARUSAT

--

subject: Fwd: Dissemination of Bilingual Questionnaire Survey on ‚ÄúSWAYAM and SWAYAM Plus‚Äù to get feedback from all Faculty, Learners & Students of AICTE approved Institutions - Regarding
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in> Date: Sun, May 11, 2025 at 6:38 AM Subject: Dissemination of Bilingual Questionnaire Survey on ‚ÄúSWAYAM and SWAYAM Plus
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Sun, May 11, 2025 at 6:38‚ÄØAM
Subject: Dissemination of Bilingual Questionnaire Survey on ‚ÄúSWAYAM and
SWAYAM Plus‚Äù to get feedback from all Faculty, Learners & Students of AICTE
approved Institutions - Regarding
To:


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/07-May/AICTE2/index.html>
------------------------------
Sir/Madam,

Greetings from AICTE!

As you aware that ‚ÄúStudy Webs of Active Learning for Young Aspiring Minds‚Äù
(SWAYAM) is an initiative under the Ministry of Education, Government of
India, designed to provide quality education to all, in line with the three
cardinal principles of the National Education Policy ‚Äìaccess, equity, and
quality. SWAYAM is a Massive Open Online Course (MOOC) platform aimed
at democratizing education, particularly for those unable to join the
mainstream knowledge  economy due to various barriers.

Mr. Suraj Kr. Maurya, Training Officer, NIOS, one of the ten National
Coordinators of SWAYAM across India, has conducted a research study on
‚ÄúSWAYAM & SWAYAM Plus: Catalysts for Inclusive Education in India‚Äù and
has formulated a bilingual Questionnaire along with a QR Code  as per  his
letter No. F-82-20/2025/NIOS/CBC/SWAYAM, dated 12.03.2025 (attached for
ready reference).

You are requested to please disseminate the above bilingual Questionnaire
among all faculty, students, learners and others concerned to scan the QR
Code of the bilingual questionnaire and send their feedback to email:
niossurajmaurya@gmail.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=809ffd01333ffa42ae97f63c14ffdbfcdc55239c&lat=2025&mid=d5c3395d16c67036eeda12b662bfe7a66094d118>
.


PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1REhlQtOQcA4HkzRwqoEljppEwSfvwc1M/view?usp=sharin
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=e4e036d1422e8e37de1045fb6208a3d3cd38c413&lat=2025&mid=d5c3395d16c67036eeda12b662bfe7a66094d118>g


*Regards,*
*Dr. Amit Dutta,*
*Director (P&AP)*
*AICTE,*
*New Delhi-110070*

subject: Fwd: IEEE Student Membership Half Yearly Offer
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: IEEE CHARUSAT SB <ieee.charusatsb@charusat.edu.in> Date: Fri, May 9, 2025 at 5:14 PM Subject: IEEE Student Membership Half Yearly Offer To: <
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IEEE CHARUSAT SB <ieee.charusatsb@charusat.edu.in>
Date: Fri, May 9, 2025 at 5:14‚ÄØPM
Subject: IEEE Student Membership Half Yearly Offer
To: <21cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <22cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <
23cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <24cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <
21depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <22depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <
23depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <24depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: upeshpatel.ec@charusat.ac.in <upeshpatel.ec@charusat.ac.in>,
amitthakkar.it@charusat.ac.in <amitthakkar.it@charusat.ac.in>,
harshulyagnik.cse@charusat.ac.in <harshulyagnik.cse@charusat.ac.in>,
arpitapatel.ec@charusat.ac.in <arpitapatel.ec@charusat.ac.in>,
trushitupadhyaya.ec@charusat.ac.in <trushitupadhyaya.ec@charusat.ac.in>


Dear CHARUSAT Students,

We‚Äôre excited to invite you to join the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch
2025-26*, a platform designed to help you grow both academically and
professionally. Whether you're looking to gain hands-on experience, build
your resume, or expand your network, IEEE has something for you!
What is IEEE?

IEEE is the world‚Äôs largest technical professional organization. Our
Student Branches are university-based groups that offer opportunities for
career development, technical learning, leadership experience, and
networking within fields of engineering and related disciplines.
Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Build Your Resume with Projects and Skills:* Participate in technical
   projects, workshops, and hackathons in areas like Robotics, Artificial
   Intelligence, Signal Processing, VLSI, and more.
   - *Exclusive Networking Opportunities:* Connect with industry
   professionals, mentors, and peers globally for internships, jobs, and
   guidance.
   - *Leadership Experience:* Take on roles within the branch to develop
   key professional skills.
   - *Access to Global Competitions and Events:* Join competitions like
   IEEE Xtreme and attend conferences that boost your professional exposure.
   - *Resources to Stay Ahead:* Get access to the IEEE Xplore Digital
   Library and other exclusive member tools.

Learn more about the benefits of IEEE membership:

   - Student Membership Benefits
   <https://students.ieee.org/membership-benefits/>
   - General IEEE Membership Benefits
   <https://www.ieee.org/membership/benefits/index.html>

*Avail the half-yearly offer now and join IEEE at a 50% discount!*

Please refer to the attached PDF for step-by-step instructions on how to
take up membership.

For any queries please reply to this mail.

Join IEEE Now <https://students.ieee.org/membership-benefits/>

subject: Fwd: PM Mentorship Scheme for Young Authors (Yuva) 3.0
snippet: Sir / Madam, Concerning the above, this is to bring to your kind attention that after the successful execution of the two editions of PM-YUVA Mentorship Scheme, PM-YUVA Mentorship Scheme 3.0 has been
content:
Sir / Madam,

Concerning the above, this is to bring to your kind attention that after
the successful execution of the two editions of PM-YUVA Mentorship Scheme,
PM-YUVA Mentorship Scheme 3.0 has been launched by the Ministry of
Education, Government of India  * to train young and budding authors  *
(below 30 years of age) for the year 2025-26 with the National Book Trust,
India as the Implementing Agency. The Themes of PM-YUVA 3.0 are:

a.Contribution of Indian Diaspora in Nation Building

b.Indian Knowledge System

c.Makers of Modern India (1950-2025)

The scheme will help to develop a stream of writers who can write on
various facets of India encompassing the past, present and future. Besides,
the scheme will also provide a window to the aspiring youth to articulate
themselves and present a comprehensive outlook of contribution of Indians
across fields in ancient and present times.

The scheme aims to cultivate a new generation of writers who can articulate
the contributions of the Indian diaspora in nation-building, highlighting
their peaceful integration and influence across political, economic, and
socio-cultural spheres. It will also emphasise on the role of the Indian
Knowledge System in preserving historical wisdom, generating new
opportunities, and synthesising indigenous knowledge for national
development.

Through this initiative, young authors will explore the impact of
visionaries in various fields like education, science, economy, social
empowerment, etc. thereby presenting a comprehensive narrative of India's
growth and resilience. Given India‚Äôs position as the third-largest book
publishing market, this initiative is a crucial step toward projecting its
intellectual and cultural wealth on the global stage.

An online National Contest is being organised from 11 March 2025 ‚Äì 10 June
2025 to select the authors under the Scheme. There is a provision for
payment of a Scholarship of Rs.50,000 per month for a period of six months
to be paid to each of the selected 50 authors. National Book Trust, India
will be publishing the books produced by the young authors as part of the
Mentorship Scheme.
* You are requested to disseminate the information pertaining to the Scheme
among the students and other stakeholders to encourage greater
participation in this prestigious scheme. *

The details can be accessed at  * https://www.mygov.in/
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CVkBBgkfAhlVB1ZN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3D%2BPM%2BMentorship%2BScheme%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoURBQfVBtRC0MfClwc&ext=>
*

The further enquiries related to the Scheme can be sent to the
director@nbtindia.gov.in
,  chiefeditor.nbtindia@gmail.com  and  nbtyuva3.0@gmail.com .

Please find below the link to the Contest and other details for ready
reference:  https:// innovateindia.mygov.in/yuva- 2025
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=CVkBBgkfAhlVB1VN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3D%2BPM%2BMentorship%2BScheme%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoKXQ1eTwNCAVxfB1tSTAtLUlpDTQoMFhhHQQNMAVYBBA==&ext=>

subject: Fwd: Deadline Extended: DMP 2025 by Code for GovTech x Apna | ‚Çπ1 Lakh Stipend | PPOs for Top Performers
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly go through the trailing email for good opportunities in tech projects. Feel free to contact TNP coordinators for any queries and clarifications. After receiving multiple requests,
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly go through the trailing email for good opportunities in tech
projects. Feel free to contact TNP coordinators for any queries
and clarifications.




After receiving multiple requests, the deadline for the Dedicated Mentoring
Program (DMP) 2025 by Code for GovTech (C4GT), in collaboration with Apna,
has been extended until Sunday, 11th May at 11:59 PM.

This national-level initiative empowers students and early professionals to
work on impactful, open-source tech projects that address large-scale
public challenges. Over a 3-month period, selected participants will
collaborate with expert mentors and receive a ‚Çπ1,00,000 stipend for their
contributions.

Application Link:
https://apna.co/contests/dmp_2025?utm_source=email&utm_medium=TPO&utm_campaign=TPO

Key Highlights:

   -

   Work on open-source projects with real-world, population-scale social
   impact
   -

   1:1 mentorship from domain experts in top organizations
   -

   ~‚Çπ1,00,000 stipend for selected mentees
   -

   Pre-placement offers (PPOs) and internship opportunities for top
   performers
   -

   No application fee ‚Äì it‚Äôs completely free to apply

We sincerely appreciate your support in sharing this opportunity with your
students and alumni, especially those who are passionate about open-source
technology, public service, and social impact.

Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions or need additional
information. We‚Äôre looking forward to seeing more participation from your
institution.

Warm regards,

Mehak

--

subject: Fwd: Register for NIDAR: India‚Äôs Largest National Drone Innovation Challenge-reg
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly go through the trailing mail. Read all the details and the eligibility criteria to register for NIDAR: India's Largest National Drone Innovation Challenge. The interested
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly go through the trailing mail. Read all the details and the
eligibility criteria to register for NIDAR: India‚Äôs Largest National Drone
Innovation Challenge. The interested students are hereby informed to inform
their willingness to participate via repl to this email by today 2:00 pm.



*Thanks and Regards,*
*RADHIKA H. PATEL*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Information Technology*
*DEPSTAR,*
*CHARUSAT, Changa*








Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/07-May/AICTE/index.html>
------------------------------

Respected Madam/Sir,

*Greetings from AICTE!*

The *National Innovation Challenge for Drone Application & Research (NIDAR)* is
India‚Äôs largest national drone innovation challenge hosted by the Ministry
of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) and Drone Federation
India (DFI) under the *SwaYaan* Initiative. SwaYaan is a National
Initiative by MeitY to develop and strengthen India‚Äôs UAS/Drone ecosystem,
aligning with the Government‚Äôs vision to make India a global drone hub by
2030. The Drone Federation India (DFI) is a non-government, non-profit,
industry-led body representing 550+ drone companies and 5500+ drone pilots
across the country.

With prizes, startup incubation, and industry mentorship, NIDAR inspires
students and researchers from academia to build collaborative
autonomous drones for solving real-world problems in disaster management
and precision agriculture. Through this initiative, participants gain
hands-on experience, industry-relevant skills, and access to career
opportunities in India‚Äôs rapidly growing drone sector. NIDAR aims to be a
transformative milestone in shaping India‚Äôs future of drone technology and
aerospace innovation.

*Institutions are encouraged to motivate their students & researchers to
register for NIDAR at *https://nidar.org.in
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=0168c1274cab9f602e8ea18433dbb23410d46f08&lat=2025&mid=c3e7e23f08df8773e65f77a02a86b806d290f913>*.
The last date for registration is 10th May 2025.*

We seek your active support for the initiative.

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hw23rOTXBul3MJle0bXJwYj413x3epkD/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=33b448332f5ea54072ba8e46e60ed9bace6cb7c8&lat=2025&mid=c3e7e23f08df8773e65f77a02a86b806d290f913>



*Warm regards,**Dr. A*
*mit Dutta, *
*Director,*
*Policy & Academic Planning Bureau*
*All India Council for Technical Education,*
*Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj,
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=a45522cfe60b1a79a9c9be6d565b33a93d365d9e&lat=2025&mid=c3e7e23f08df8773e65f77a02a86b806d290f913>*

subject: Fwd: Invitation for students to join the Google Cloud India Summit Livestream ‚Äì Free & Virtual
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly go through the trailing mail and attend the interesting summit for developers on Google Cloud. Hi Amit J Nayak, We hope this message finds you well. We're excited to invite
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly go through the trailing mail and attend the interesting summit for
developers on Google Cloud.





Hi Amit J Nayak,

We hope this message finds you well.

We‚Äôre excited to invite your students to the Google Cloud India Summit
livestream taking place on May 8th, 2025, from 10:30 AM. This summit is
designed to empower the next generation of developers and technologists
with the latest knowledge in cloud computing, Generative AI, and
intelligent applications ‚Äî straight from Google‚Äôs experts.

This is more than just another tech event. The livestream offers students
firsthand exposure to cutting-edge tools by Google along with live product
demos, and expert-led sessions. It‚Äôs a unique opportunity to gain practical
skills and insights into how cloud and AI are transforming industries.

Click here for the YouTube link
<http://9hdppg0c.r.ap-southeast-1.awstrack.me/L0/http:%2F%2Fsendy.hack2skill.com%2Fl%2FMiOSisQaO02xRqRynTTSvw%2FgmcnDBiYq2Sm76381WvuZfJQ%2F4Ed7RyYYWxbFnSxLs30AJw/1/010e0196aae1b19e-0e226a4b-bbe3-4899-8b5f-611cba1d8b49-000000/dGhd2wLPTw28990aaPhZPzZekgI=210>


Benefits for Students

The Summit is a great opportunity for students to get industry knowledge
straight from Google experts. Here are the things your students can take
away from the summit:

   - Learn directly from Google engineers and experts
   - Get a front-row seat to the future of cloud and Gen AI
   - Future-proof themselves by staying ahead of the curve
   - Explore how top companies are using these AI tools and technologies

The summit livestream is completely free and open to all students and
professionals, regardless of their technical background. Whether they‚Äôre in
engineering, computer science, or any tech-related stream, this is a chance
to stay ahead of the curve in an ever evolving digital world.

Keynote Address

Building the Intelligent Future: How Gemini 2.5 and the New Cloud Empower
Developers to Transform Work.

Add to Calendar
<http://9hdppg0c.r.ap-southeast-1.awstrack.me/L0/http:%2F%2Fsendy.hack2skill.com%2Fl%2FMiOSisQaO02xRqRynTTSvw%2FxTPIFvMJllT0sHgEAztCXQ%2F4Ed7RyYYWxbFnSxLs30AJw/1/010e0196aae1b19e-0e226a4b-bbe3-4899-8b5f-611cba1d8b49-000000/6lJp5NJLo9JdAShQ3_E7SFbNeJ8=210>

Customer Panel Discussion

This panel discussion will explore the profound ways in which Artificial
Intelligence is reshaping the daily workflows, skill sets, and overall
impact of developers within organizations.

Add to Calendar
<http://9hdppg0c.r.ap-southeast-1.awstrack.me/L0/http:%2F%2Fsendy.hack2skill.com%2Fl%2FMiOSisQaO02xRqRynTTSvw%2F4F892cCN33g5JEElPd8PaqOQ%2F4Ed7RyYYWxbFnSxLs30AJw/1/010e0196aae1b19e-0e226a4b-bbe3-4899-8b5f-611cba1d8b49-000000/NgAHfmCGV45XQQ_nUutJcxnBwqQ=210>

Your Support Matters

We kindly request you to encourage your students to attend this event. Your
guidance can help them unlock valuable industry exposure and connect with
future-ready technologies that will shape their careers.

Thank you for your continued support in enabling student growth and
industry engagement. Please feel free to share the registration link widely
across your student and faculty networks.

Regards,
Team Hack2skill

Click here
<http://9hdppg0c.r.ap-southeast-1.awstrack.me/L0/http:%2F%2Fsendy.hack2skill.com%2Funsubscribe%2F03F7GK892IrXh0n6gA892374Db5wt7pAkkBvaJN892BBf5JhQ%2FaaWZFRTELDaDBFe72763K7lA%2F4Ed7RyYYWxbFnSxLs30AJw/1/010e0196aae1b19e-0e226a4b-bbe3-4899-8b5f-611cba1d8b49-000000/NVM7RtkaTH_Xf5LpAm5sqMk9dwo=210>

subject: Fwd: National lnter-college crossword Expedition 2025 (NlCE-25) - Reg
snippet: Dear Students, Please go through the trailing mail. Interested students, please participate and let your counselors know about your participation and progress. National Inter-college Crossword
content:
Dear Students,

Please go through the trailing mail. Interested students, please
participate and let your counselors know about your participation and
progress.


National Inter-college Crossword Expedition NICE 25 is starting on the 4th
of May. AICTE circular, posters and promos attached.

<https://imsva91-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fnice.crypticsingh.com%2fregister&umid=D2B792A1-3447-3906-96E9-B6FDF2D461ED&auth=777990cd74cc620430ea9ccd0417e323e70695df-ccc8fc1db8563231b57fb21a9cc98baffda40542>
https://nice.crypticsingh.com/default?ReturnUrl=/
<https://imsva91-ctp.trendmicro.com:443/wis/clicktime/v1/query?url=https%3a%2f%2fnice.crypticsingh.com%2fdefault%3fReturnUrl%3d%2f&umid=D2B792A1-3447-3906-96E9-B6FDF2D461ED&auth=777990cd74cc620430ea9ccd0417e323e70695df-1b10b24e06c8af764eab337247a8215efe47113e>

A large participation from students of all institutes across the Gujarat
would be of immense value.

PFA for NA.

*Thanks & Regards*

*Dr. V. V. Prajapati*

*Jt. Director (Academic*)

Commissionerate of Technical Education

Block No. 2, 6th Floor,

Karmayogi Bhavan Sector-10-A,

Gandhinagar ‚Äì 382 010. GUJARAT

content:
Dear Students,

I have attached a copy of the Final Continuous Evaluation Sheet of MSUD102
(Engineering Mathematics II), which now* includes the assignment marks out
of 10* for your reference. Kindly note that the assignment marks are mapped
to the overall attendance of students in MSUD102.

If you have any queries about the components of evaluation, then contact me
on or before 06/05/2025 (Tuesday).

*After that, no queries will be answered.*

Thank you.

subject: Fwd: Important instructions for CLUV101 Environmental Sciences university practical examination_May 2025.
snippet: Thanks & Regards, Mr. Hardik Parmar Assistant Professor, Department of Computer Science & Engineering, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), ---------- Forwarded
content:
Thanks & Regards,

*Mr. Hardik Parmar*
Assistant Professor,
Department of Computer Science & Engineering,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Hemangi Oza <hemangioza.cv@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, May 5, 2025, 2:34‚ÄØPM
Subject: Important instructions for CLUV101 Environmental Sciences
university practical examination_May 2025.
To: <24aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <24cs@charusat.edu.in>, <24ce@charusat.edu.in>,
<24ec@charusat.edu.in>, <24dit@charusat.edu.in>, <24it@charusat.edu.in>, <
24dce@charusat.edu.in>, <24dcse@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head Civil CHARUSAT <hod.cv@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

The university practical examination of *CLUV101 Environmental Sciences* has
been scheduled. The timetable of CSPIT and DEPSTAR is attached below for
your reference. You are instructed to follow the below instructions for the
viva:

1. Viva will start sharp at 9:15 AM. So all are instructed to come at 9:00
AM sharp. Latecomers will not be allowed for the viva.
2. The venue for the viva will be room no. 513, environment engineering
lab, first floor, civil engineering department, CSPIT.
3. Carry your hall ticket and ID card; without that, anyone will not be
allowed to attend the viva.
4. Dress well and maintain discipline during the viva.
5. Those who have not completed any of the internal work have to submit
their compensatory work to their respective subject teachers well before
the viva. If you submit your work on the day of your viva, then your viva
will be conducted at last.

You are strictly instructed to adhere to the above-mentioned rules.

Thank You

With Regards
Ms. Hemangi Oza
M. Tech Environmental Engineering
Assistant Professor
Civil Engineering Department
CSPIT CHARUSAT
Changa, Anand.
Mo. No.: 8780473646

Determine the frequency bandwidth of the circuit? *
Captionless Image


31.8 Hz

142 Hz

In series LCR circuit, Capacitive reactance (XC) = Inductive reactance (XL)

is capacitive


is inductive


is at resonance


draws minimum current


In RLC series resonance circuit, on resonance the following condition will  
be fulfilled, *


V=VR


I = I(min)


Z=R


VL=VC

frequency oscillator was fixed to ____________. *


20Hz to 200Hz


200Hz to 2KHz


2KHz to 20KHz


20KHz to 200KHz


One resistor of 1000 ohm and a capacitor of 12 pF is connected in series.  
then what is the value of time constant. (pF is picoFarade) *


12 ns (n is nano)


1.2 s


12 fs (f is femto)


none

True


false


The time constant of RC ckt becomes __________ with larger value of  
resistor and capacitor *


Larger


shorter


won't change

The magnitude of energy stored in a capacitor is given by a formula; E =

True

Stationary charges


Moving charges

value of magnetic field. *


0.5 B

B


The magnetic field density along the axial line of a circular coil carrying  
current is/does *


Zero


Constant


Vary with distance from the center of the coil


not change

increasing the number of turns


increasing the cross-sectional area


increasing current supply


all above methods

A radio


A TV set

subject: Fwd: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Invitation to participate in "French For All" ‚Äì 2 Credit (30 Hours) offline Certificate Course (12th ‚Äì 30th May, 2025)
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, May 1, 2025 at 3:28 PM Subject: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Invitation to participate in "
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, May 1, 2025 at 3:28‚ÄØPM
Subject: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Invitation to participate in "French For
All" ‚Äì 2 Credit (30 Hours) offline Certificate Course (12th ‚Äì 30th May,
2025)
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear CHARUSAT family,


Greetings!


In the interconnected and competitive world today, language skills are not
just an added advantage - they are essential. Among the global languages,
*French* stands out as a key that opens doors to new cultures, careers, and
international opportunities. In the evolving job market, versatility is
valued, and proficiency in foreign languages serves as a significant
differentiator.


*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management (IIIM)* and *Faculty of
Humanities* (FoH), CHARUSAT are jointly organizing *30 hrs offline 2 Credit
Certificate Course* titled *"French For All"*, scheduled from 12th May to
30th May, 2025. This program is specially designed for *beginners and
language enthusiasts* who wish to experience the richness and utility of
the French language through engaging, hands-on sessions.


The detailed brochure is attached for your kind reference. We encourage you
to share this opportunity with interested students, colleagues, and anyone
eager to expand their linguistic and professional horizons.


For any further queries, please feel free to contact: *Dr. Vikas Raval* ‚Äì
+91 94293 56638 or 5135 (intercom).


We look forward to your active participation and support.


Thank you.


With regards,

*Dr. Atul Patel*

*Registrar*





Accredited Grade ‚ÄúA+‚Äù by NAAC


www.charusat.ac.in


-- 
regards
Ms. Krishna Patel (Ph.D.)
Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science And Technology

--

content:

Radhika H. Patel,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),
CHARUSAT,  Changa

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Hemangi Oza <hemangioza.cv@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, 2 May 2025, 4:05 pm
Subject: Pending internal work of B.Tech. 2nd Semester students in CLUV101
Environmental Sciences.
To: <24dit@charusat.edu.in>, <24dce@charusat.edu.in>, <
24dcse@charusat.edu.in>, <24it@charusat.edu.in>, <24cs@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head Civil CHARUSAT <hod.cv@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Here, I am sending you the list of those who have not done their
internal work. You are instructed to check the below-mentioned list and
complete the following compensatory work before *10th May, 2025. *

1. Those who have not submitted MCQ Test have to write 1 article from Down
to Earth magazine.
2. Those who have not given a presentation or video presentation have to
write 2 articles from Down to Earth magazine.
3. Those who have not completed two of the above-mentioned tasks have to
write 5 articles from Down to Earth magazine.

If you will not be able to complete your work before this date, you will
not be allowed to attend an external viva.

*Note: You are instructed to submit this offline and take my signature on
the assignment. Do not message me or call me for this task; just submit it
before the deadline. Write your name and permanent student ID on your
assignment, and one student can collect all assignments and submit that to
me. *

Thank You

Ms. Hemangi Oza
M. Tech Environment Engineer
Assistant Professor
Dept. of Civil Engineering
CSPIT CHARUSAT
Changa, Anand.
Mo. No.: 8780473646

subject: Fwd: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Invitation to participate in "French For All" ‚Äì 2 Credit (30 Hours) offline Certificate Course (12th ‚Äì 30th May, 2025)
snippet: Dear Students, Here's a great opportunity to learn French! CHARUSAT is offering a 30-hour, 2-credit certificate course titled "French For All" from 12th to 30th May, 2025. It's
content:
*Dear Students,*

Here‚Äôs a great opportunity to learn French! CHARUSAT is offering a *30-hour,
2-credit certificate course* titled *"French For All"* from *12th to 30th
May, 2025*. It‚Äôs perfect for beginners and language enthusiasts.

Check the attached brochure for details. Don‚Äôt miss out‚Äîregister early!


Regards,


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, May 1, 2025 at 3:28‚ÄØPM
Subject: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Invitation to participate in "French For
All" ‚Äì 2 Credit (30 Hours) offline Certificate Course (12th ‚Äì 30th May,
2025)
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear CHARUSAT family,


Greetings!


In the interconnected and competitive world today, language skills are not
just an added advantage - they are essential. Among the global languages,
*French* stands out as a key that opens doors to new cultures, careers, and
international opportunities. In the evolving job market, versatility is
valued, and proficiency in foreign languages serves as a significant
differentiator.


*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management (IIIM)* and *Faculty of
Humanities* (FoH), CHARUSAT are jointly organizing *30 hrs offline 2 Credit
Certificate Course* titled *"French For All"*, scheduled from 12th May to
30th May, 2025. This program is specially designed for *beginners and
language enthusiasts* who wish to experience the richness and utility of
the French language through engaging, hands-on sessions.


The detailed brochure is attached for your kind reference. We encourage you
to share this opportunity with interested students, colleagues, and anyone
eager to expand their linguistic and professional horizons.


For any further queries, please feel free to contact: *Dr. Vikas Raval* ‚Äì
+91 94293 56638 or 5135 (intercom).


We look forward to your active participation and support.


Thank you.


With regards,

*Dr. Atul Patel*

*Registrar*





Accredited Grade ‚ÄúA+‚Äù by NAAC


www.charusat.ac.in

--

subject: Join ‚ÄúFrench For All‚Äù ‚Äì 30-Hour Offline French Language Training at CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Students, Looking to add an exciting and valuable skill to your profile? The Faculty of Humanities (FoH), CHARUSAT is offering a 30-hour offline interactive training program titled ‚ÄúFrench For All
content:
Dear Students,

Looking to add an exciting and valuable skill to your profile?

The *Faculty of Humanities (FoH), CHARUSAT* is offering a *30-hour offline
interactive training program* titled *‚ÄúFrench For All‚Äù*, from *12th May to
30th May, 2025‚Äî* specially designed for *beginners and language enthusiasts*
.

In today‚Äôs global job market, just having technical or academic skills is
no longer enough. *Learning a foreign language like French can give you a
competitive edge*, opening up new career opportunities, international
exposure, and cultural insights.

This is your chance to:

‚úîÔ∏è ‚Å£Explore the beauty and power of the French language
‚úîÔ∏è Gain a strong foundation in Listening, Speaking, Reading, and Writing
(LSRW)
‚úîÔ∏è Learn in a fun, engaging classroom environment

 *The detailed brochure is attached for your reference.*
üìû For queries, contact *Dr. Vikas Raval* at +91 94293 56638

Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to enhance your future ‚Äî *enroll now and say
‚ÄúBonjour‚Äù to new possibilities!*


Best wishes,
Faculty of Humanities
CHARUSAT


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

subject: Fwd: A Unique Opportunity to Sharpen Your Students' Coding Mindset
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Wed, Apr 30, 2025 at 3:15 PM Subject: Fwd: A Unique Opportunity to Sharpen Your Students
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Apr 30, 2025 at 3:15‚ÄØPM
Subject: Fwd: A Unique Opportunity to Sharpen Your Students' Coding Mindset
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Sindhura P <sindhura.p@talentsprint.com>
Date: Wed, Apr 30, 2025 at 3:14‚ÄØPM
Subject: A Unique Opportunity to Sharpen Your Students' Coding Mindset
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Ma'am/Sir,

We are excited to offer your students an invaluable learning experience!

TalentSprint is hosting a free LIVE masterclass with *Asokan Pichai* (aka
Master Shifu) on * May 6, 2025, at 7:00 PM IST.* With 35+ years of
expertise in software development and AI, Asokan has mentored over 30,000
engineers. This masterclass goes beyond teaching code, it‚Äôs designed to
help your students develop the mindset of a top-tier developer.

*Here‚Äôs what your students will gain from this session:*

   - *Master key problem-solving strategies* that top developers rely on
   - *Go beyond syntax* to develop a problem-solving mindset that drives
   innovation
   - *Learn how to tackle coding challenges* effectively and with
   confidence

This is a rare opportunity for your students to learn directly from a
Grandmaster in the tech field and gain insights that will set them apart in
their careers. Plus, all participants will receive a * Certificate of
Participation* from TalentSprint.

We encourage you to share this opportunity with your students. This is the
perfect chance for them to build the mindset to tackle tasks with
confidence.

*Registration Link:*
https://zoom.us/webinar/register/9617459014949/WN_LVcIWpxASj2BSa97fxV5QQ

Looking forward to seeing your students join us!

Best regards,
TalentSprint, part of Accenture

If you wish to opt out of all type of emails, click Unsubscribe
<https://mc.talentsprint.com/un/kYdhaMKHuJFMBbjAFdxMcBXaSIfxiZMKKJaFDxPxgcAMVvjJKMSFkJwlBMkjzf>
.

-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

subject: Next Steps for Your Internship Program Shortlisting
snippet: . Dear Student, Charotar University of Science and Technology We would like to inform you that you have been shortlisted for the Accenture Verified Internship Certification Program 2025. This
content:
I've invited you to fill out the following form:
Your Future-Powered by Accenture: Apply for the 2k25 Internship Program

To fill it out, visit:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfOI5NpjTjq-Ovm8bkQOAsck67jKea5A4ZEm82__5iHwY0gHw/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1&flr=0&usp=mail_form_link

Dear Student,
Charotar University of Science and Technology

We would like to inform you that you have been shortlisted for the  
Accenture Verified Internship Certification Program 2025. This initiative  
is aimed at helping students enhance their placement readiness through  
resume guidance, interview preparation, and access to relevant career  
opportunities.

If you wish to participate, please complete your registration before the  
deadline. Seats are limited.

subject: Important Instructions for Practical Examination - Lab Cleanliness and Resource Care
snippet: Dear Students, As you prepare for your upcoming practical examinations, I would like to remind you of a few important instructions to ensure a smooth and organized environment for everyone Please
content:
Dear Students,

As you prepare for your upcoming practical examinations, I would like to
remind you of a few important instructions to ensure a smooth and organized
environment for everyone

   1.

   Please arrange the chairs properly after completing your exam.

   2.

   Turn off the PCs and place keyboards and mice neatly on the tables.

   3.

   Kindly throw any garbage (such as rough pages, scrap papers, etc.) into
   the dustbin provided.

   4.

   Make sure the lab and all resources are kept neat and clean for the next
   session.


Your cooperation in maintaining a clean and organized lab is highly
appreciated and reflects a respectful attitude toward shared resources.

Again!! All the very best for your practical examination!
-- 
*Regards,*

*Sachin Patel*



*Department of Information Technology,Devang Patel Institute of Advance
Technology and Research,Charotar University of Science and
Technology,ACCREDITED WITH "A+" GRADE BY NAAC, GOI*

content:
From: Sanni <sannikapatel.phys@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Apr 28, 2025 at 9:46‚ÄØAM

Dear Students,

You must certify your lab manual + Journal with the respective
lab-in-charge on/before 2nd May 2025. After this date, no journals will be
certified, and you will not be allowed to take the practical examinations.

Quiz 2 (of 15 Marks) will be arranged on the 3rd of May 2025, which covers
the questions of Experiments 2, 3, and 4. The timing of the quiz will be
4:30 PM to 5:00 PM, the link will be sent 5 minutes before the exam.

Regards
Sanni

Looking for a life-changing experience in EGYPT ?

Register Now! <https://www.aiesec.in/global-volunteer>



[image: image]
What are you doing this summer ?

Apply to become a Global Volunteer! A 45days of wonderful experience, a
Certificate from United Nations to boost your CV!
Know More! <https://aiesec.org/opportunity/global-volunteer/1304043>


Register Now! <https://www.aiesec.in/global-volunteer>



[image: image]
CAIRO

Step into Cairo, where the whispers of ancient pharaohs echo through the
pyramids, and the pulse of modern life beats along the Nile üåÖüê´. From
timeless treasures in bustling bazaars to sunset views over minarets, this
city is a vibrant tapestry of history and hustle‚Äîready to dive in? üïåüî•üá™üá¨
[image: image]
ALEXANDRIA

Dive into Alexandria, where the Mediterranean breeze carries tales of ancient
libraries, legendary queens, and timeless charm üåäüìú. Wander through
seaside forts, hidden cafes, and sun-kissed streets‚Äîthis coastal gem blends
history and chill like no other. Ready to get swept away? üèõÔ∏èüåÖüá™üá¨
[image: image]
GIZA

Uncover the magic of Giza, where colossal pyramids rise from golden sands
and the Sphinx guards secrets older than time üê™üî∫. From camel rides at
sunrise to stargazing over ancient wonders, this desert dream is a journey
through history and awe. Ready to step back in time? üååüå¥üá™üá¨


Register Now! <https://www.aiesec.in/global-volunteer>

Subject: MEUD101 Elements of Engineering - Submission guidelines
To: <24ce@charusat.edu.in>, <24it@charusat.edu.in>, <24cs@charusat.edu.in>,
<24aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <24ec@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Radhika Patel <radhikapatel.it@charusat.ac.in>, Satayu Travadi <
satayutravadi.me@charusat.ac.in>, Axat Patel <axatpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>,
Maulik Shah <maulikshah.me@charusat.ac.in>, Dr. Kawaljit Randhawa <
kawaljitrandhawa.me@charusat.ac.in>, Dr. Punit Patel <
punitpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>, Dr. Sagar Chokshi <
sagarchokshi.me@charusat.ac.in>, Viral Panara <viralpanara.me@charusat.ac.in>,
Mr. Madhav Oza <madhavoza.me@charusat.ac.in>, Kundan Patel <
kundanpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>, Mr. Bhargav Shobhana <
bhargavshobhana.cv@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

The submission process for the subject MEUD101 - Elements of Engineering is
as follows:

For Engineering Graphics Sheets:

1. Students must submit their A2-size drawing sheets and  binders on both
sides.
Sequence is as follows: Binder - Sheet - 1 - Sheet - 2 - Binder
All the sheets should be of A2 size.
[image: image.png]


2. Colour code of the binder is as follows:

Department Institute Colour Code
CE CSPIT & DEPSTAR YELLOW
CSE CSPIT & DEPSTAR BLUE
IT CSPIT & DEPSTAR GREEN
AIML CSPIT BLACK
EC CSPIT PINK

3. No need to stick the Certificate and Index on the binder.
(as the certificate and index are already available in your lab manual)

4. At the time of Practical Exam (Viva) students have to bring Lab
Sketchbook (signed by faculty), Sheets as mentioned above, Assignment
sketch book (signed by class teacher), Lab manual and assignment of
Mechanical & Civil.


You can contact your respective lab/lecture faculties for submission.

Radhika madam is requested to forward this email to DEPSTAR students.

Regards,


Vikas Panchal

Assistant Professor

Mechanical Engineering | CSPIT, CHARUSAT

subject: Seating Arrangement - FTE: B.Tech-II External Exam Starting from 17th May, 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Please find attached herewith the seating arrangement for the University Theory exam. Students need to follow the following guidelines during the Exam. Students are required to adhere to
content:
Dear Students,

Please find attached herewith the seating arrangement for the
University Theory exam.

Students need to follow the following guidelines during the Exam.


   - Students are required to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in
   the email attachment.
   - Students are required to uphold decorum in the examination hall.
   - Mobile phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic devices are
   strictly prohibited within the exam hall.
   - Bags must be left outside, and it is mandatory to wear an ID card.
   - Students have to take their seat in the exam hall at least 15
   minutes prior to the exam time.

*The exam will take place in Exam Hall 201 (1st floor)  and Exam Hall 301
(2nd floor) of Multi Utility Complex.*


*You can also scan the QR code (given in the hall ticket and near stairs in
our building) to check your seat in Exam hall.*


-- 
*With regards,*

*Disha Panchal*
*Assistant Professor,*
*Department of Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR,*
*Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT)*- Changa,
Accredited with "*Grade A+*" by NAAC,GOI
Accredited with *Centre of Excellence* by GOG

subject: Re: Regarding the Class test of MSUD102 (EM II) on 15-04-2025 (Tuesday)
snippet: Dear Students, Please find attached the continuous evaluation marksheet for MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics II), which now includes the class test marks out of 10. You are requested to verify your
content:
Dear Students,

Please find attached the continuous evaluation marksheet for MSUD102
(Engineering Mathematics II), which now* includes the class test marks *out
of 10. You are requested to verify your marks for all evaluation
components. In case of any discrepancy, kindly inform me at the earliest to
ensure timely correction.

Thank you.

On Mon, Apr 7, 2025 at 12:47‚ÄØPM Dr. Rajendra B. Chauhan <
rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear students,
>
> This email is to inform you about the *Class Test of MSUD102 (Engineering
> Mathematics II)*.
>
> *The class test will be conducted during the lecture of Mathematics on
> 15-04-2025 (Tuesday).*
>
> Marks of Class test: *10 Marks (2 questions of 2 marks & 2 questions of 3
> marks)*
>
> *Syllabus of Class Test:*
> *Unit-2:*
> General Solution of Higher Order Ordinary Linear Differential Equations
> with Constant coefficients, Methods for finding particular integrals viz.
> variation of parameters and undetermined coefficients, Linear Differential
> Equation of higher order with variable coefficients: Legendre‚Äôs Equations
> (Special case: Cauchy-Euler equation), System of simultaneous first order
> linear differential equations.
>
> *Unit-5:*
> Introduction to Improper integrals, Definitions and properties of Gamma,
> Beta and Error functions, Evaluation of double integrals, Change of order
> of double integration, Transformation to polar coordinates, Applications of
> double integrals: Area, Evaluation of triple integrals.
>
> Thank you.
>
> --
> * Dr. Rajendrakumar B. Chauhan*
>
> * M.Sc., M.Phil., Ph.D. (Mathematics)*
>
>
> * Assistant Professor Department of Mathematical Sciences, P. D. Patel
> Institute of Applied Sciences,*
>
> * Charotar University of Science & Technology, Changa, Gujarat, India.*
>
> *E-mail: rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in
> <rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in>*
>


-- 
* Dr. Rajendrakumar B. Chauhan*

* M.Sc., M.Phil., Ph.D. (Mathematics)*


* Assistant Professor Department of Mathematical Sciences, P. D. Patel
Institute of Applied Sciences,*

* Charotar University of Science & Technology, Changa, Gujarat, India.*

*E-mail: rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in
<rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in>*

subject: Regarding Faculty Feedback in E-governance for the EVEN Semester and institute-specific feedback for AY:2024-25
snippet: Dear Students, Hope you are doing well. As part of our continuous efforts to enhance the quality of teaching and learning, we request you to provide your valuable feedback for the faculty members for
content:
Dear Students,

Hope you are doing well.

As part of our continuous efforts to enhance the quality of teaching and
learning, we request you to provide your valuable feedback for the faculty
members for the academic year 2024-25.

The feedback will be collected through the *E-Governance System.*

Link: *https://charusat.edu.in:912/eGovernance/*
<https://charusat.edu.in:912/eGovernance/>
Along with the faculty-specific feedback, you are requested to submit
institute-specific feedback available in your account.

Kindly log in to the E-Governance portal and complete the faculty feedback form
by *25/04/2025*.

*Your honest and constructive feedback will help us improve academic
delivery and overall learning experience.*

Please note that the submissions will not be considered for any subject
unless you submit unbiased feedback in e-governance.

Your cooperation in this process is highly appreciated.

Thank you for your time and support.

-- 
*Dipak Ramoliya** /Assistant Professor,*
Department of Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR,
Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT)- Changa,
Email: dipakramoliya.ce@charusat.ac.in,
Mo. +91 99987 71587


*            Accredited Grade ‚ÄúA+‚Äù by NAAC, GOI*

subject: Fwd: The largest hackathons in India - 'Odoo Hackathon 2025'
snippet: Dear Students, Please go through the trailing mail. Students are encouraged to participate in the event. regards, ---------- Forwarded message --------- Greetings from Odoo India Headquarters! We are
content:
Dear Students,

Please go through the trailing mail. Students are encouraged to participate
in the event.

regards,




---------- Forwarded message ---------


Greetings from Odoo India Headquarters!

We are pleased to inform you that Odoo will be organising one of the
largest hackathons in India - 'Odoo Hackathon 2025' on 11 - 12 August 2025.
This hackathon is aimed at identifying and nurturing top talent from across
the country with transforming recruitment methods, and we would be honoured
to have your institution participate.

This hackathon presents a valuable opportunity for final and pre-final year
students to demonstrate their technical skills and potentially secure
internship and job opportunities at Odoo (subject to eligibility).



Hackathon Timeline:

06 July 2025 (11:30 PM): Last date for registration

12 July 2025: First Round (Conducted Virtually)

18 July 2025 (7:00 PM): Announcement of Top 250 Teams

11 - 12 August 2025: Final Round (Offline) at Gandhinagar, Gujarat



For further details and to register, please visit:
https://www.odoo.com/event/odoo-hackathon-2025-7644/register

--

subject: New Microsoft Teams Accounts for First-Year Students at DEPSTAR
snippet: Dear Students, We have decided to delete the existing Microsoft Teams accounts and generate new ones using the permanent student IDs. To ensure a smooth transition, we are providing a 10-day window for
content:
*Dear Students,*

We have decided to delete the existing Microsoft Teams accounts and
generate new ones using the permanent student IDs.

To ensure a smooth transition, we are providing a 10-day window for
students to back up any important data from their current accounts before
they are deleted. After this period, new accounts will be created and
shared with the students via the personal email IDs listed in their
e-governance profiles.

So, everyone is requested to back up the data from their Microsoft Teams
Account.

-- 
*Dipak Ramoliya** /Assistant Professor,*
Department of Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR,
Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT)- Changa,
Email: dipakramoliya.ce@charusat.ac.in,
Mo. +91 99987 71587

subject: Regarding the submission of assignment of unit-1 and unit-4
snippet: Dear students, The following students have yet not submitted the assignment for unit-1 and unit-4 of MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics II). ID Numbers: 24DCS002, 005, 007, 010, 012, 013, 015, 020, 021,
content:
Dear students,

The following students have yet not submitted the assignment for unit-1 and
unit-4 of MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics II).

*ID Numbers: *24DCS002, 005, 007, 010, 012, 013, 015, 020, 021, 029, 036,
047, 049, 056, 067, 068, 090, 092, 094, 101, 103, 104, 112, 138, 143.

Kindly submit an assignment for unit-2 by next Friday.

You can meet  me in the staff room number 309 (EC/EE building) or email me,
for any query.

Thank you.
-- 
* Dr. Rajendrakumar B. Chauhan*

* M.Sc., M.Phil., Ph.D. (Mathematics)*


* Assistant Professor Department of Mathematical Sciences, P. D. Patel
Institute of Applied Sciences,*

* Charotar University of Science & Technology, Changa, Gujarat, India.*

*E-mail: rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in
<rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in>*

--

subject: Online Lecture for MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics-2) ‚Äì Sunday, 13th April 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Due to a workshop for engineering students, the lecture will be rescheduled on Sunday, 13th April 2025, from 10:00 AM onwards. Kindly join it through the following Microsoft Teams link:
content:
Dear Students,

Due to a workshop for engineering students, the lecture will be rescheduled
on *Sunday, 13th April 2025, from 10:00 AM onwards.*

Kindly join it through the following Microsoft Teams link:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_NmM5NTQ2M2ItOGJiNS00NzU3LWFjZGMtMjU1NjRkNDdmOTFk%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%220b3cc029-f5b7-4e7c-9532-e90a421a1b18%22%7d

This lecture will cover the topics of *Unit-6 (Probability &
Statistics)*: *"Joint
and Conditional Probability, Bayes T <http:>heorem"*

Join the lecture *5 minutes before the scheduled time* and *use your ID
number as your display name* while joining.
Best regards

snippet: Dear Students, Kindly join the online lecture of MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics-2) on Saturday, 12th April 2025, from 10:00 AM onwards through the following Microsoft Teams link: https://teams.
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly join the *online lecture of MSUD102 (Engineering
Mathematics-2)* on *Saturday,
12th April 2025, from 10:00 AM onwards* through the following Microsoft
Teams link:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_ZDQ2YWM3ZTAtZjc1Yi00MjhmLWI3MWMtOTc1MTkzNmEwNDQ5%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%220b3cc029-f5b7-4e7c-9532-e90a421a1b18%22%7d

subject: Fwd: Announcement: One day Workshop on CAD Modeling & Drafting_12th April 2025
snippet: Regards, Radhika H. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT, Changa ---------- Forwarded message
content:
Regards,
Radhika H. Patel,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology,
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),
CHARUSAT,  Changa

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Sagar Chokshi <sagarchokshi.me@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, 10 Apr 2025, 5:18 pm
Subject: Announcement: One day Workshop on CAD Modeling & Drafting_12th
April 2025
To: <24ce@charusat.edu.in>, <24it@charusat.edu.in>, <24ec@charusat.edu.in>,
<24cs@charusat.edu.in>, <24aiml@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Radhika Patel <radhikapatel.it@charusat.ac.in>, Mr. Vikas Panchal <
vikaspanchal.me@charusat.ac.in>, Mr. Punit Patel <
punitpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>, Satayu Travadi <
satayutravadi.me@charusat.ac.in>, Dr. Vijay Chaudhary <
vijaychaudhary.me@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>,
Principal C.S.Patel Institute of Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>,
Dean FTE CHARUSAT <dean.fte@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Greetings of the Day!

I am glad to inform you that CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical
Engineering is organizing a *one-day workshop on* *"CAD Modeling &
Drafting"* on *12th April 2025 (10:00 am onwards)*. It will be
conducted online (mode) using Microsoft Teams.

Please find the workshop banner in the attachment.

Kindly do the registration by scanning QR code of the Registration Form
from the banner or by clicking the link below.
Link: https://forms.gle/AfqBePo6kHcAvW8n8

*E-Certificate* will be provided to students who will attend *a full
workshop (all sessions)* after registration.

*Note:* This is a part of MEUD101 Elements of Engineering Practical
Training (for Sheet 2 Computer Aided Drafting & Modeling).
---
Radhika madam is requested to forward it to DEPSTAR students
---

Regards,



*Dr. Sagar Chokshi,*

Associate Professor,
Department of Mechanical Engineering,

Faculty of Technology & Engineering,

Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology,
Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT),
ACCREDITED WITH ‚Äú*A+*‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC
Education Campus Changa -388421
At. & Post Changa-388421, Ta: Petlad, Dist: Anand, (Gujarat) India.
Ph.No. +91-2697-265329; Mob. No. +91-9726622007.

subject: New Event Alert: Hands-on Workshop on "Building Digital Logic Circuits using Verilog"
snippet: New Event Alert üöÄ Hello, A new Event has been created : Hands-on Workshop on "Building Digital Logic Circuits using Verilog". Date: Saturday, April 19, 2025 Time: 09:30 AM Location: 229
content:
[image: Logo]
New Event Alert üöÄ

Hello,

A new Event has been created : Hands-on Workshop on "Building Digital Logic
Circuits using Verilog".

   - Date: Saturday, April 19, 2025
   - Time: 09:30 AM
   - Location: 229 Seminar Hall, A5 Building, DEPSTAR, CHARUSAT

This workshop is designed for students and enthusiasts who wish to
strengthen their understanding of digital electronics and hardware design.
Participants will learn how to write, simulate, and implement Verilog code
to model fundamental digital circuits.

Don't miss out! Click the button below to learn more:
View Event Details

subject:
New announcement: "2CSE1 - B batch Students,

AIM:¬†Design‚Ä¶"
snippet: Notification settings CEUC102 - Programming with C++ New announcement 2CSE1 - B batch Students, AIM: Design an application for a vehicle rental service that manages different types of vehicles such as
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
CEUC102 - Programming with C++  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMzMzU1MTE1OTI4?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
New announcement

2CSE1 - B batch Students,

AIM: Design an application for a vehicle rental service that manages  
different types of vehicles such as cars, bikes, and trucks. Each vehicle  
type has a unique way of calculating rental charges based on factors like  
distance travelled, number of days, or load capacity. The system should  
provide a unified interface for displaying vehicle details and computing  
rental costs, allowing flexibility to handle multiple vehicle types through  
a common reference. The program should simulate real-world rental  
operations by allowing users to enter vehicle-specific data, calculate  
charges dynamically, and display a final bill, ensuring that the logic  
adapts correctly depending on the vehicle category chosen by the user.

For the Document Submission: https://forms.gle/YX1gGy2JLQ55sAmE6
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMzMzU1MTE1OTI4/p/NzY3MTQzMTc3MTY0?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
Posted on 2:26 PM, Apr 10 (GMT+05:30) by Hardik Parmar

Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043 USA

email notifications from Google Classroom. If you don't want to receive

subject:
New announcement: "Div-2; Batch-cAIM:
Develop a hospital‚Ä¶"
snippet: Notification settings CEUC102 - Programming with C++ New announcement Div-2; Batch-cAIM: Develop a hospital management system that efficiently handles information related to both patients and staff.
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
CEUC102 - Programming with C++  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMzMzU1MTE1OTI4?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
New announcement

Div-2; Batch-cAIM:
Develop a hospital management system that efficiently handles
information related to both patients and staff. The system should begin by
capturing basic personal information common to all individuals, then diverge
into two specialized branches: one for managing patient-specific data like  
illness
details and treatment charges, and another for handling staff-related
information such as role, department, and salary. A separate component  
should
also handle billing logic for patients and payroll logic for staff. The  
system
should allow entry of complete records, calculation of payment-related  
details,
and display of summaries, simulating real-world administrative operations  
in a
healthcare setting through a structured and logical class relationship.
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMzMzU1MTE1OTI4/p/NzY3MTQyNzc3MTMy?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>

snippet: Dear Students of Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) We are thrilled to announce that Deep Harishbhai Tandel etc. and many more students from CHARUSAT have already secured their
content:
*Dear Students of **Charotar University of Science and Technology
(CHARUSAT)*

We are thrilled to announce that *Deep Harishbhai Tandel* etc. and many
more students from *CHARUSAT* have already secured their spots in our
prestigious *National Skill Development Certified Internship Program*,
verified by *WIPRO DICE ID*! üåü

Now it‚Äôs your turn to take that leap towards a brighter career!
------------------------------

üî¥ *‚è≥ Registration Closes Tomorrow at 8:25 PM | 10th April 2025*

üîó *Apply Now:* *https://forms.gle/4ztjoYsdkezu32F5A*
<https://forms.gle/4ztjoYsdkezu32F5A>

üìå *Referral ID:* *CHS_25* (Exclusive for *CHARUSAT* Students)
------------------------------

üéì
*Program Highlights:*
‚úÖ Month 1: Live Training by Industry Experts
‚úÖ Month 2: Internship with Real-World Projects
‚úÖ 24/7 Support, Doubt-Clearing & Career Mentorship
‚úÖ No prerequisites ‚Äì open to all departments
‚úÖ Certification by *WIPRO DICE ID + NSDC*
------------------------------

üèÜ
*What You‚Äôll Receive:*
‚úîÔ∏è Certificate of Completion ‚Äì Recognized by WIPRO & Leading MNCs
‚úîÔ∏è Internship Certificate with real project validation
‚úîÔ∏è Letter of Recommendation for top performers
‚úîÔ∏è NSDC Certification ‚Äì Highly valuable for placement & college records
------------------------------

üíº
*Additional Benefits:*
‚ú® 6 Months LMS Access
‚ú® Resume Building & Mock Interviews
‚ú® Placement Assistance from Our Dedicated Career Network
------------------------------

üéØ
*This is your FINAL REMINDER!*
All registrations close *TOMORROW by 8:25 PM*. Details will be submitted to
the registration department EOD.

üöÄ Secure your place in this *2-Month Summer Internship Program* and step
into the world of real-world experience and corporate recognition.

‚ö†Ô∏è Already registered? Kindly ignore this email.

For queries or support, feel free to reply to this email directly.
------------------------------

*Best Regards,*
*Rutwik Gaikwad*
Senior Executive ‚Äì Registration & Onboarding
*LaunchEd Global*

It has come to our attention that some students are experiencing
difficulties accessing their answer sheets on ExamCloud. If you are unable

we can resolve the issue as quickly as possible.

(10/04/2025) 11:00 A.M.

respective counsellors.
Thanks & Regards,

*Mr. Hardik Parmar*

Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),

subject:
New announcement: "2CSE1 - C Batch Students,

AIM: Develop‚Ä¶"
snippet: Notification settings CEUC102 - Programming with C++ New announcement 2CSE1 - C Batch Students, AIM: Develop a university management system that handles student academic records across departments. The
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
CEUC102 - Programming with C++  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMzMzU1MTE1OTI4?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
New announcement

2CSE1 - C Batch Students,

AIM: Develop a university management system that handles student academic  
records across departments. The system should begin by storing general  
person-related information such as name and ID, then extend to  
student-specific attributes like roll number and enrolled course, and  
finally manage academic details including subject-wise marks, grade  
calculation, and result status. This layered structure should follow a  
logical hierarchy where each level of information builds upon the previous,  
ensuring systematic initialization and access to data. The application  
should include functionality to input complete details, compute overall  
performance, and display a summarized report card, thus simulating  
realistic academic record processing through a well-organized inheritance  
structure.
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMzMzU1MTE1OTI4/p/NzY1MzA2ODIyNzM0?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>

subject:
New announcement: "AIM:¬†Design
an application to manage an‚Ä¶"
snippet: Notification settings CEUC102 - Programming with C++ New announcement AIM: Design an application to manage an online bookstore where each book is categorized under a specific genre. The system should
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
CEUC102 - Programming with C++  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMzMzU1MTE1OTI4?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
New announcement

AIM: Design
an application to manage an online bookstore where each book is categorized
under a specific genre. The system should maintain basic book details like
title, author, price, and stock, while also supporting dynamic addition,
viewing, and removal of books. The categorization should follow a structure
where a derived category class inherits general attributes and behaviors  
from
a base book class. The system must ensure that whenever a book is added,
necessary details are properly initialized, and all records are managed
dynamically to allow real-time updates. Integrate a menu-driven approach to
simulate operations such as adding new books, viewing all books, deleting a
specific book by its title, and filtering books based on genre,  
demonstrating
logical flow and efficient resource handling.
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMzMzU1MTE1OTI4/p/NzY1MzAwNTI2NDY2?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>

snippet: Dear Students, This is to inform you that the second online quiz (5 Marks) is scheduled on 19th April at 11:00 AM sharp. Please note the following strict instructions: No further quiz will be conducted
content:
Dear Students,

This is to inform you that the *second online quiz (5 Marks)* is scheduled
on *19th April at 11:00 AM sharp*.

Please note the following *strict instructions*:

   1.

   *No further quiz* will be conducted *either online or offline* under any
   circumstances.
   2.

   Ensure you are in an area with *proper internet connectivity*.
   3.

   *Avoid travelling* during the quiz time.
   4.

   The *quiz duration is exactly 10 minutes*.
   5.

   In case of any *technical error or issue from your side*, the quiz *will
   not be reopened or resubmitted*.

Make sure to take this seriously and be fully prepared in advance.

a mini banking system that‚Ä¶"
snippet: Notification settings CEUC102 - Programming with C++ New announcement AIM: Design a mini banking system that manages individual customer accounts with proper initialization and clean-up of account data
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
CEUC102 - Programming with C++  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMzMzU1MTE1OTI4?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>
New announcement

AIM: Design
a mini banking system that manages individual customer accounts with proper  
initialization and clean-up of account data. The system should allow users  
to perform core banking operations such as depositing and withdrawing  
money, along with viewing account summaries and current balances. Sensitive  
details like balance and personal information must be securely handled,  
with specific functionalities given limited access for data retrieval.  
Ensure that when an account is created, relevant details are set up  
automatically, and when it is closed, a proper closure message is  
displayed. Implement a menu-driven approach to handle transactions,  
ensuring appropriate checks such as sufficient balance during withdrawals  
and accurate display of account information, emulating real-world banking  
behavior.
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzMzMzU1MTE1OTI4/p/NzY1MDEzNTk1NjEz?email%3D24dcs053@charusat.edu.in&Email=24dcs053@charusat.edu.in>

subject: üöÄ Final Call: Last Day to Register for Summer 2025 Internship with NSDC Certification
snippet: Dear Students of Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) Congratulations on being shortlisted for our National Skill Development Certified Internship Program, verified by Wipro Dice ID
content:
Dear Students of *Charotar University of Science and Technology* (*CHARUSAT*
)

Congratulations on being shortlisted for our *National Skill Development
Certified* Internship Program, verified by *Wipro Dice ID*!

üî¥ *‚è≥ Registration Closes Today at 7:45 PM | 8th April 2025*

üîó *Apply Now:* *https://forms.gle/4ztjoYsdkezu32F5A*
<https://forms.gle/4ztjoYsdkezu32F5A>

üìå *Referral ID:* *CHA_25* (Exclusive for* CHARUSAT *Students)

This opportunity is available for every department with fixed slots from
*CHARUSAT* to participate in a 2-Month Summer Training + Internship Program
with *WIPRO DICE ID* Certifications!
------------------------------
üí° *Program Overview:*

‚úÖ *Month 1:* Live training sessions led by industry experts

‚úÖ *Month 2:* Internship with real-world projects & expert mentorship

‚úÖ *24/7 Support:* Dedicated mentorship, doubt-clearing sessions, and career
guidance

üéØ This program is designed to help you build a strong foundation and gain
real-world experience to stand out in the competitive job market.

------------------------------
üéì *Certifications & Credentials:*

üèÜ *Certificate of Completion* (Recognized by WIPRO DICE ID & Leading MNCs)

üèÜ *Internship Certificate* validating hands-on experience

üèÜ *Letter of Recommendation* for top-performing students

üìå Boost your career profile with globally recognized certifications that
enhance your employability!
------------------------------
üìà *Additional Benefits:*

‚ú® *6-month LMS access* for continuous learning

‚ú® *Placement assistance* through our dedicated career network

‚ú® *Mock interviews & resume-building support* to boost your job prospects

üíº Get a step closer to your dream job with expert career guidance and
placement assistance!
------------------------------

üéØ *INTERNSHIP WITH NSDC CERTIFICATION!*

üëâ We are excited to announce that all students attending this exclusive
2-Month Summer *Training + Internship* Program will now receive an
*NSDC* (National
Skill Development Corporation)  and *WIPRO DICE ID* Certification ‚Äì a
valuable credential that can be used for placement and college purposes.

üèÜ *NSDC* *Certification* ‚Äì Students will now receive an *NSDC* (National
Skill Development Corporation) Certification upon completion, which can be
used for placement and college purposes.
------------------------------

üö® *Final Reminder:*

 This is your *last chance to secure your spot*! All student details will
be submitted to the registration department by *EOD Today*. *Don‚Äôt miss out
on this career-defining opportunity!*

‚ö†Ô∏è *If you have already registered, kindly ignore this email.*

For any queries, feel free to reply to this email.

*Best Regards,*
*Rutwik Gaikwad*
*Senior Executive*
*LaunchEd Global*

subject: Regarding the Class test of MSUD102 (EM II) on 15-04-2025 (Tuesday)
snippet: Dear students, This email is to inform you about the Class Test of MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics II). The class test will be conducted during the lecture of Mathematics on 15-04-2025 (Tuesday).
content:
Dear students,

This email is to inform you about the *Class Test of MSUD102 (Engineering
Mathematics II)*.

*The class test will be conducted during the lecture of Mathematics on
15-04-2025 (Tuesday).*

Marks of Class test: *10 Marks (2 questions of 2 marks & 2 questions of 3
marks)*

*Syllabus of Class Test:*
*Unit-2:*
General Solution of Higher Order Ordinary Linear Differential Equations
with Constant coefficients, Methods for finding particular integrals viz.
variation of parameters and undetermined coefficients, Linear Differential
Equation of higher order with variable coefficients: Legendre‚Äôs Equations
(Special case: Cauchy-Euler equation), System of simultaneous first order
linear differential equations.

*Unit-5:*
Introduction to Improper integrals, Definitions and properties of Gamma,
Beta and Error functions, Evaluation of double integrals, Change of order
of double integration, Transformation to polar coordinates, Applications of
double integrals: Area, Evaluation of triple integrals.

Thank you.

-- 
* Dr. Rajendrakumar B. Chauhan*

* M.Sc., M.Phil., Ph.D. (Mathematics)*


* Assistant Professor Department of Mathematical Sciences, P. D. Patel
Institute of Applied Sciences,*

* Charotar University of Science & Technology, Changa, Gujarat, India.*

*E-mail: rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in
<rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in>*

--
