subject: Online Lecture for MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics-2) ‚Äì Sunday, 6th April 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly join the online lecture of MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics-2) on Sunday, 6th April 2025, from 10:00 AM onwards through the following Microsoft Teams link: https://teams.microsoft
content:
Dear Students,

Kindly join the *online lecture of MSUD102 (Engineering
Mathematics-2)* on *Sunday,
6th April 2025, from 10:00 AM onwards* through the following Microsoft
Teams link:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_OGIxNzAyZmUtNmI1ZS00ZTVhLWFhOTctNWZhZGZmNDYyNGVl%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%220b3cc029-f5b7-4e7c-9532-e90a421a1b18%22%7d

This lecture will cover the last topic of *Unit-2 (Higher Order Ordinary
Linear Differential Equations)*: *"System of Simultaneous First-Order
Linear Differential Equations."*

Join the lecture *5 minutes before the scheduled time* and *use your ID
number as your display name* while joining.

Best regards,
-- 
*Dr. Pragneshkumar R. Makwana*

*M.Sc., M.Phil., Ph.D.*


*Assistant Professor,Department of Mathematical Sciences,P. D. Patel
Institute of Applied Sciences,*

*Charotar University of Science & Technology,Changa, Gujarat, India.*

subject: DEAR 24dcs053 : MANDATORY INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS
snippet: Dear Student ID 24dcs053, Congratulations on getting Shortlisted for the Internship! Launched Global organizing a 2-Month Training + Internship Program with certifications from MNCs in both technical
content:
*Dear Student ID *24dcs053*, Congratulations on getting Shortlisted for the
Internship! *

*Launched Global organizing a 2-Month Training + Internship Program with
certifications from MNCs in both technical and non-technical domains. *

 * We are thrilled to announce the Internship and Placement Assistance for
the students, all over India. *

*Students Kindly Go Through All The Information Which Is Mentioned In the
Description Of the  Google Form, **Before Filling the Form:*

*Application Form: *LINK TO APPLY <https://forms.gle/cSsc8eRkrW3XvDkTA>

*Certifications/Internships Reports can be submitted to the departments for
the Academic Credit Points.*
*Program Highlights*

*Immer**sive Training Sessions:*

   - Dive into an *exceptional learning experience*, curated by
   professionals from *MAANG companies*, each bringing over *10 years of
   industry expertise*.
   - The program offers *80+ hours of high-quality content*, spread
across *25-30
   dynamic modules*, designed to equip you with cutting-edge skills.

          *  (Login credentials will be provided to the students after
registration)*

* Hands-On Internship under MNCs:*

   - Get deployed directly with one of our partner *MNCs*, where you‚Äôll
   work on *10+ live projects*, solving real-world challenges.
   - Collaborate with industry professionals, gaining valuable practical
   experience and a deeper understanding of your field.
   - *All data, tools, and resources for the projects will be provided by
   the company, ensuring you're set up for success from day one.*

*Post-Program Benefits:*

   - Program completion certificate issued by* Launched Global*
   - Co-branded* Internship Certificate from Top MNCs*
   - Admittance to a *growing community*.
   - *Low-Code and No-Code Tools* training.
   - *100% Outcome-Driven Results*.
   - Curriculum includes *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering*.
   - *Exclusive Masterclasses* with Founders and CXOs of Top Global
   Companies.
   - *Personalized mentorship* for proper guidance.

*We look forward to your active participation in the Training and
Internship Program. This is an excellent chance for you to broaden your
horizons and take a step towards a successful career. For any inquiries or
assistance, feel free to contact us.*

*ANKITA THAKUR*
*KEY ACCOUNT MANAGER*

anamikajha.bt@charusat.ac.in>, Shivangi Gohil <
shivangigohil.as@charusat.ac.in>, Pankti Patel <
panktipatel.cips@charusat.ac.in>, Kriti Patel <
kritipatel.cips@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Dean CHARUSAT <dean@charusat.ac.in>, Principal <principal@charusat.ac.in>,
HOD Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>, CS <cs@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir /Madam,

Greetings...|

This is with a deep sense of gratitude, let us share immense pleasure and
pride for a successful execution of Liberal Arts - 2025. We are happy to
share that we coordinated a total of 15 courses this time with ease and
effectiveness. In the same regards, we appreciate your commitment and
cooperation for providing the Man- power, Infrastructure and above all your
moral support during the Liberal Arts -2025.

As you are well aware that Liberal Arts Courses are taught in *Workshop
Mode* and both *Internal and External evaluation* of the subject selected
by the students was carried out effectively during that period (Four Days
=25 to 28, 2025).

However, we have received applications from students regarding inability to
attend the session/ s during specific day/s or Internal Evaluation and
health issues etc. With a view to solve the issues and complete the
evaluation process in a fair and fine way, you may please instruct the
students having issues regarding Attendance, Submission or Evaluation to
contact *Dr. Robert Parmar *as per the details shared below:

*Venue:* Room : 219, First Floor, IIIM Building

Date: 4-4-2025 | Friday      | 1:00 pm to 4:30 pm

Date: 5-4-2025 | Saturday | 10:00 pm to 4:30 pm

Date: 7-4-2025 | Monday   | 1:00 pm to 4:30 pm





Kindly consider the same and do the needful.







With regards,



Yours sincerely,





*Dr. Robert Parmar *

*Mo: 9925466788*

--

subject: MSUD102 online lecture link
snippet: Dear students, Kindly join the online lecture of MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics II) from 02.50 pm onwards on 04th April, Saturday (Tomorrow), 2025 through the following link of Microsoft teams. https
content:
Dear students,

Kindly join the online lecture of MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics II)
from *02.50
pm onwards *on *04th April, Saturday (Tomorrow), 2025* through the
following link of Microsoft teams.

https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_NTVmZmNlNzgtOTJiMy00NDU0LWJmNWEtZDI5MTRhY2I1MDY2%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%223ed35552-5e3c-4b13-916a-3622e7a12052%22%7d

This lecture will cover the *improper integral* topic of unit 5 (Multiple
Integrals and Improper Integrals).

Kindly join the lecture with your name as id number and join it before 5
minutes of the schedule.

Thank you.

-- 
* Dr. Rajendrakumar B. Chauhan*

snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Bankim Patel <bankimpatel.dcs@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, 3 Apr, 2025, 6:31 pm Subject: Fwd: *Important* - NCIIPC-AICTE Pentathon 2025 - Registration
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Bankim Patel <bankimpatel.dcs@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, 3 Apr, 2025, 6:31‚ÄØpm
Subject: Fwd: *Important* - NCIIPC-AICTE Pentathon 2025 - Registration is
now live - Deadline 4th April 2025 by 11.59 PM
To: DEPSTAR <depstar@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <aictenoreply@aicte-india.org>
Date: Thu, 3 Apr, 2025, 6:13‚ÄØpm
Subject: *Important* - NCIIPC-AICTE Pentathon 2025 - Registration is now
live - Deadline 4th April 2025 by 11.59 PM
To: <bankimpatel.dcs@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/Madam,

I hope you are doing well.

This is with reference to cited subject regarding the registration of the
NCIIPC-AICTE Pentathon 2025.

In this regard, we wish to inform you that the registration for the
Hackathon is now open. Please register now at:

* Click here to Register:  * * https://pentathon2025.in/ *
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=A1YIBw4fAhkBUg1aUA9GBUFUDxxXARVyVl1UERYRWBUcVgFPWghPTUxT&ml=BlEBBgkfAhlWAlJN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DPentathon%2B2025%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoTVg1FWBZeC1sDUwAGTA9cGg==&ext=>


To know more about the hackathon, Click here:
https://mic.gov.in/pentathon2025/
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=A1YIBw4fAhkBUg1aUA9GBUFUDxxXARVyVl1UERYRWBUcVgFPWghPTUxT&ml=BlEBBgkfAhlWAlFN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DPentathon%2B2025%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoOWgAfXg1ASlxfTEJWDBJTQV1aDVFSC1Qd&ext=>


* Event Details:  *

* Name of the Event  *

NCIIPC Pentathon CTF

* Homepage URL *

http://mic.gov.in/pentathon2025
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=A1YIBw4fAhkBUg1aUA9GBUFUDxxXARVyVl1UERYRWBUcVgFPWghPTUxT&ml=BlEBBgkfAhlWAlBN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DPentathon%2B2025%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRgJMHQgKUE1WVhQYDVseE1ddFgdGXVpbUVNQDA==&ext=>

* Registration URL *

https://pentathon2025.in
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=A1YIBw4fAhkBUg1aUA9GBUFUDxxXARVyVl1UERYRWBUcVgFPWghPTUxT&ml=BlEBBgkfAhlWAlJN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DPentathon%2B2025%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoTVg1FWBZeC1sDUwAGTA9cGg==&ext=>

* Start Date *

05th April 2025, 12:00 AM (Midnight)

* End Date *

06th April 2025, 11:59 PM (Midnight)

* Duration *

48 Hours

* Rules for the hackathon *

https://pentathon2025.in/rules
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=A1YIBw4fAhkBUg1aUA9GBUFUDxxXARVyVl1UERYRWBUcVgFPWghPTUxT&ml=BlEBBgkfAhlWAldN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DPentathon%2B2025%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoTVg1FWBZeC1sDUwAGTA9cGkdADwYR&ext=>
 (attached as well)

* CTF Timeline   *

* CTF Starts (1st Wave) *

05th April 2025,12:00 AM (Midnight)

* 2nd Wave of Challenges *

05th April 2025, 12:00 PM (Afternoon)

* 3rd Wave of Challenges *

06th April 2025, 12:00 AM (Midnight)

* 4th Wave of Challenges *

06th April 2025, 12:00 PM (Afternoon)

* End of CTF *

06th April 2025, 11:59 PM (Midnight)

* Note: *

   1. The  * team leader along with team members need to
   individually register for the hackathon * . Please circulate the above
   email with your team members to individually register for the hackathon


   2. The  * deadline to submit the registration closes on 4th April 2025
   at 11.59 PM * .


   3. The  * stage 1  * of the NCIIPC-AICTE Pentathon 2025  * starts on 5th
   April 2025 (12:00 AM) till 6th April 2025 (11.59 PM) (48 Hours Non-stop
   hackathon) *


   4. * Flag Sharing Prohibited * : Sharing flags or any solution details
   with other participants or outsiders is strictly prohibited. Participants
   should not collaborate on solving challenges or share answers in any form.


   5. * Respect Towards Participants and Organizers * : All participants
   are expected to treat each other and the organizers with respect and
   professionalism. Any form of harassment, discrimination, or disrespectful
   behavior will not be tolerated.  * No spamming in discord channel.  *


   6. The  * team members or individual participation will be from the
   students of the HEI's (pursuing). * No faculty or mentors will be part
   of the team.


   7. * Challenges Released in Waves * : Challenges will be released in
   waves, and participants are advised to regularly check the notices provided
   on the CTF platform for updates regarding the release schedule and details
   of each wave.


   8. * Unlocking Challenges * : Some challenges may require participants
   to solve specific challenges or a series of challenges to unlock subsequent
   ones. This approach promotes progression and guarantees that participants
   engage with a diverse range of tasks throughout the competition.

For any queries, please use the discord channel or email to us at
pentathon@aicte-india.org
 or call at 011-29581239/1240/1241/1223

PFA:   https://drive.google.com/file/d/18MsDSNkDuRBlDfz9wLwD3NPcrvz3iLAu/view?usp=sharing

* Regards *

* (Organizing Team) *

subject: CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY Students - Don't Miss Out !! Apply for the Wipro-Certified Upskilling Program Today!
snippet: Dear Student of CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY We're excited to offer you the opportunity to join the Wipro Certified Training and Internship Program in partnership with CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY . This program
content:
Dear Student of *CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY *

 We‚Äôre excited to offer you the opportunity to join the *Wipro Certified
Training and Internship Program* in partnership with  *CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY *
       . This program connects you with top global companies like *IBM*,
*Microsoft*, *Deloitte*, and *Oracle* for an internship experience that
will help you build valuable industry skills.

*Program Highlights:*

   - *Duration:* 2-9 months (Fully Online)


*Program Structure:*

   -

   *Month 1:*
   Learn theoretical concepts through interactive sessions led by industry
   experts (3-4 sessions per week).
   -

   *Month 2:*
   Apply knowledge with real-time projects (Minor Project: 7 days, Major
   Project: 21 days).
   -

   *Month 3:*
   Enhance career skills through group discussions, aptitude training, mock
   interviews, resume building, and LinkedIn profile optimization.

*Benefits:*

   - *Lifetime access *to recorded sessions.
   - *Personalized* mentorship.
   - *WIPRO* approved Certifications from Corizo and partner MNCs.
   - Letter of Recommendation *(LOR)*.
   - Statement of Purpose *(SOP)*


*REGISTER NOW:* *To join this program, please complete your application by
following the link below:*

*Form link:* *https://forms.gle/SJQLsKrkVG4a2NoA7
<https://forms.gle/SJQLsKrkVG4a2NoA7>*


*Note: Training fees are Applicable.Use Scholarship Code [WIPTCAR@30] to
receive a 30% discount on the base fee.*

*Get an Education, not just a degree.*

subject: Fwd: Request to send student/s to solve discrepancies related to Liberal Arts- 2025 during 4 to 7 April, 2025 to Room no: 210, IIIM Building
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, 3 Apr, 2025, 5:45 pm Subject: Fwd: Request to send student/s to solve discrepancies
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, 3 Apr, 2025, 5:45‚ÄØpm
Subject: Fwd: Request to send student/s to solve discrepancies related to
Liberal Arts- 2025 during 4 to 7 April, 2025 to Room no: 210, IIIM Building
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Robert Parmar <robertparmar.cs@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, 3 Apr, 2025, 5:31‚ÄØpm
Subject: Request to send student/s to solve discrepancies related to
Liberal Arts- 2025 during 4 to 7 April, 2025 to Room no: 210, IIIM Building
To: Dean CHARUSAT <dean@charusat.ac.in>, Principal <principal@charusat.ac.in>,
HOD Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Bhaskar Pandya <bhaskarpandya.cs@charusat.ac.in>, CS <cs@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir /Madam,

Greetings...|

This is with a deep sense of gratitude, let us share immense pleasure and
pride for a successful execution of Liberal Arts - 2025. We are happy to
share that we coordinated a total of 15 courses this time with ease and
effectiveness. In the same regards, we appreciate your commitment and
cooperation for providing the Man- power, Infrastructure and above all your
moral support during the Liberal Arts -2025.

As you are well aware that Liberal Arts Courses are taught in *Workshop
Mode* and both *Internal and External evaluation* of the subject selected
by the students was carried out effectively during that period (Four Days
=25 to 28, 2025).

However, we have received applications from students regarding inability to
attend the session/ s during specific day/s or Internal Evaluation and
health issues etc. With a view to solve the issues and complete the
evaluation process in a fair and fine way, you may please instruct the
students having issues regarding Attendance, Submission or Evaluation to
contact *Dr. Robert Parmar *as per the details shared below:

*Venue:* Room : 219, First Floor, IIIM Building

Date: 4-4-2025 | Friday      | 1:00 pm to 4:30 pm

Date: 5-4-2025 | Saturday | 10:00 pm to 4:30 pm

Date: 7-4-2025 | Monday   | 1:00 pm to 4:30 pm





Kindly consider the same and do the needful.







With regards,



Yours sincerely,





*Dr. Robert Parmar *

*Mo: 9925466788*

--

subject: Fwd: Request to Share BA English and BLIS Program Information
snippet: Dear all Please share the information in your circle, also guide the students who are looking for a future ready course and programme in the field of Humanities.Contact me in case of inquiry for the BA
content:
Dear all

Please share the information in your circle, also guide the students who
are looking for a future ready course and programme in the field of
Humanities.Contact me in case of inquiry for the B.A. English programme and
Library Science course. Refer to the attached flyers for more details.

Looking forward to your quick and kindly support.

Regards
Ms. Jayshree Mehta

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Kaushik Trivedi <kaushiktrivedi.cs@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Apr 2, 2025, 16:36
Subject: Request to Share BA English and BLIS Program Information
To: Vijay Makwana <vijaymakwana.cs@charusat.ac.in>, kinjal bhatia <
kinjalbhatia.cs@charusat.ac.in>, DR. HIREN PATEL <
hirenpatel.cs@charusat.ac.in>, Bharati Kaknani <
bharatikaknani.cs@charusat.ac.in>, Pranjal Bhatt <
pranjalbhatt.cs@charusat.ac.in>, Celine Davla <celinedavla.cs@charusat.ac.in>,
Priyanka Patel <priyankapatel.cs@charusat.ac.in>, vikas raval <
vikasraval.cs@charusat.ac.in>, Jayshree Mehta <
jayshreemehta.cs@charusat.ac.in>, Pradipsinh Zala <
pradipzala.cs@charusat.ac.in>, Robert Parmar <robertparmar.cs@charusat.ac.in
>
Cc: Bhaskar Pandya <bhaskarpandya.cs@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Faculty Members,

As instructed by Bhaskar Sir during today‚Äôs meeting, we would like to
request your assistance in sharing the details of the BA English and BLIS
programs with the students you have taught in the past or are currently
teaching.

Our current students, past students and network can serve as a bridge to
spread the word about the program within their personal circles and
networks. Their recommendations and word of mouth can be a powerful tool in
encouraging prospective students to apply. If you could kindly encourage
them to share the details of the program with friends, family, or
acquaintances who may be interested, it would greatly contribute to the
programs' growth.

Please make sure to send the provided email along with all the attachments
of BA English and BLIS program to all Google Classrooms, Teams, Email
groups, and WhatsApp groups where you are /have been involved in teaching.
It is important that there is no confusion in completing this task, and the
information should be shared widely.

Once you have shared the email, kindly update Bhaskar Sir and me via email,
including the list of groups to whom you have sent the information. Give
this task a priority and complete it by 12:00 pm tomorrow.

*Your efforts and support in the admission process will be noted and
appreciated!*

With regards,

Kaushik Trivedi

*............................*

Subject: A request to share the word-of-mouth regarding BA English and BLIS
at CHARUSAT University

Dear Students,

I hope this email finds you well.

We are excited to announce that *CHARUSAT* University has launched *BA
English and BLIS programs from the academic year 2025-2026. *
Industry-oriented BA English program is designed to provide students with
an enriching experience in the world of *English literature and language
and Literature.* *If someone in your circle or relation is passionate about
exploring English literature, enhancing language skills, or looking to
build a promising career in this field, this program offers a perfect
opportunity.*

*Who should consider this BA English program?*

If someone you know has recently passed or appeared for the *12th exam in
any stream - Arts, Commerce, or Science* and is eager to embark on an
academic journey through the lens of English studies, we encourage you to
explore the benefits of enrolling in our BA English program to the
potential candidate.

*Career Opportunities:*

A degree in BA English opens up numerous career avenues, such as:

   - Content Writing
   - Journalism & Media
   - Teaching & Education
   - Translation & Interpretation
   - Public Relations & Corporate Communication
   - Publishing & Editing
   - Advertising & Marketing
   - Corporate Training & Development
   - Entrepreneurship
   - Soft Skills Trainer
   - Competitive Exam Coaching
   - IELTS trainers and many more

*Why choose CHARUSAT for your BA English degree?*

At CHARUSAT, under the *Faculty of Humanities*, we are committed to
providing an education that not only develops linguistic proficiency but
also sharpens critical thinking, creativity, and communication skills which
are highly valued in today‚Äôs job market. Our faculty, modern
infrastructure, and vibrant campus environment will ensure that students
receive a well-rounded and rewarding experience.

*Where/How to contact for Admission?*

*If you know any aspirant who is looking for the right institute to pursue
their passion for English, please share this information with them. For
admission enquiries, student aspirants may do the following:*

For admission visit to:

https://admission.charusat.ac.in/Registration.aspx



For admission Enquiry, Scan QR code or Click on the given link and fill in
the details. We will reach out to you.
[image: IMG-20250127-WA0011 (1).jpg]



Link: https://forms.gle/hNkr58XZSKKci35w5

For direct interaction, contact at:

+91 98793 34259


Thank you for your kindness and for spreading the word!

With Regards,

.............................

--

subject: Offline Quiz Arrangement for Absentees
snippet: Dear Students, Those who missed the quiz are required to fill out the attached Excel sheet with your ID number and name. Your quiz will be arranged offline on 04/04/25 from 11:20 AM to 11:30 AM at
content:
Dear Students,

Those who missed the quiz are required to fill out the attached *Excel
sheet* with your *ID number and name*. Your quiz will be arranged *offline*
on 04/04/25* from 11:20 AM to 11:30 AM* at *CSPIT, Room No. 310*.

Please note that *absence from this offline quiz will result in a score of
zero*. Kindly ensure your presence.

subject: Recruitment For Nakshatra Aerospace
snippet: Hello everyone! üöÄ Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics & Communication and Mechanical Department As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
content:
*Hello everyone! üöÄ*

Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics &
Communication and Mechanical Department

As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
development on the Propulsion Systems, Design, Avionics, Recovery and
Material Science

*NOTE* :
DEADLINE FOR REGISTRATION ARE EXTENDED TILL 7th April 2025


*Why Join Us?*

Being part of Nakshatra Aerospace means you‚Äôll engage in hands-on projects,
collaborate with like-minded peers, and prepare for interviews with
industry leaders. Plus, it‚Äôs a fantastic way to enhance your resume!
Don‚Äôt miss out on this incredible opportunity to soar high with Nakshatra
Aerospace! üåå

Looking forward to seeing your applications!

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeqw-dwcGPZxyFV196urPrrAdpQljpJn72pVQy4-0QQjfVExQ/viewform?usp=header


For further Queries you can Contact:

nakshatraaerospaceclub@gmail.com

Hitarth Chauhan(24ME006)
+91 7405312628
Vishwesh Patel(24ME057)
+91 9726798232

subject: Fwd: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025 (NICE-25)-reg.
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Sun, Mar 30, 2025 at 7:08 AM Subject: Fwd: Participation in National Inter-College
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sun, Mar 30, 2025 at 7:08‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition
2025 (NICE-25)-reg.
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Sun, 30 Mar, 2025, 5:05‚ÄØam
Subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025
(NICE-25)-reg.
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/26-Mar/AICTE1/index.html>
------------------------------

Respected Sir/Madam,

Crossword-solving is a powerful cognitive exercise that enhances analytical
thinking, decision-making, memory, concentration, and creativity. It
strengthens problem-solving abilities, fosters a competitive spirit, and
expands vocabulary‚Äîskills essential for academic and professional success.

To further promote this engaging and intellectually stimulating activity in
higher education institutions, AICTE, Extra-C, IIM Mumbai, and IIT Madras
have collaborated under an MoU signed on May 21, 2024. As part of this
initiative, the *National Inter-College Crossword Expedition (NICE-25)* is
being organized.

The competition, scheduled between *May and August 2025*, will follow a
hybrid format‚Äîonline preliminary rounds leading to offline zonal and
national finals. This event provides students with an opportunity to
sharpen their minds while competing on a national platform.

*Attached are the competition guidelines, format, and tentative schedule. *The
MoU can be accessed on the AICTE website. We invite your esteemed
institution to encourage participation in this unique and enriching
challenge https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
.

*Registrations will begin from 30th March
2025 on  https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
. *

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/18cFYJTXo0Yq6zmen456z8H28ukWH2QGc/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=176b1da9e198e0df1317262dc16b4adeb16352b9&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>



*With Warm Regards,**Dr. A*
*mit Dutta, *
*Director,*
*Policy & Academic Planning Bureau*
*All India Council for Technical Education,*
*Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj,
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=7ab9fbde99d56338df0c3db2a58401aab648dea5&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>*

subject: Fwd: Launching PENTATHON 2025 ‚Äì A National-Level Cybersecurity Challenge.
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Fri, Mar 28, 2025 at 2:30 PM Subject: Fwd: Launching PENTATHON 2025 ‚Äì A National-Level
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Mar 28, 2025 at 2:30‚ÄØPM
Subject: Fwd: Launching PENTATHON 2025 ‚Äì A National-Level Cybersecurity
Challenge.
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Fri, Mar 28, 2025 at 2:20‚ÄØPM
Subject: Launching PENTATHON 2025 ‚Äì A National-Level Cybersecurity
Challenge.
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/26-Mar/AICTE2/index.html>
------------------------------

Dear Faculty,

We are pleased to announce the launch of the "NCIIPC-AICTE PENTATHON 2025",
a premier National-level Hackathon on Capture the Flag (CTF) Challenge and
Vulnerability Assessment & Penetration Testing (VAPT). This initiative is
jointly organized by NCIIPC, AICTE, and MIC to identify and nurture the top
cybersecurity talent.

In this regard, we are pleased to inform you the launch of the Pentathon
2025 by the Chairman, AICTE and DG, NCIIPC. We request you to please join
the program online through the below link:

https://aicteindia.webex.com/aicteindia/j.php?MTID=m041db1742c446d1739d836000977d27d
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=90873d9a65d4365dd2be6bdc622058d7f74c12f0&lat=2025&mid=67a1762388d68e8a074f0ad9a7023a8cebd28f16>

Date: 26th March 2025
Time: 3:00 PM

*Stages of PENTATHON 2025*:

   1. * Stage 1*: Online Qualification Round. (*5-6thApril 2025)*

 - A jeopardy-style CTF challenge covering Web Attacks, Network
Exploitation, API Vulnerabilities, OT    SCADA, and more.

   2. * Stage 2*: Physical Grand Finale (*1-3rdMay 2025) (Tentative)*

 - A high-stakes live cybersecurity exercise focused on protecting Critical
Information Infrastructure (CII) from advanced cyber threats.

   3. *Stage 3*: Bootcamp and Training for shortlisted teams. *(June2025)
   (Tentative)*

We request you to please join live for the inaugural ceremony for the
launch of NCIIPC-AICTE Pentathon 2025. We look forward to your
participation in this prestigious event. For any queries, feel free to
reach out at 011-29581240, 1241 or email: pentathon@aicte-india.org
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=7d6f018fde1112603239e954101e90ee3c15c79b&lat=2025&mid=67a1762388d68e8a074f0ad9a7023a8cebd28f16>

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xRJeUZPdxDolW18KhQATIdzytI31EzTZ/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=cca47c88bdd3e7aea486d2655d5769f4c97dfaab&lat=2025&mid=67a1762388d68e8a074f0ad9a7023a8cebd28f16>


*Best regards, *

*PENTATHON 2025**(Organizing Team)*
Share it on Social Media [image: social icon]
<https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fjan-sampark.nic.in%2Fcampaigns%2F2025%2F26-Mar%2FAICTE2%2Findex.html>

subject: New Event Alert: Hands-on Workshop on " Web Development : From Concepts to Code"
snippet: New Event Alert üöÄ Hello, A new Event has been created : Hands-on Workshop on "Web Development : From Concepts to Code". Date: Saturday, April 5, 2025 Time: 09:30 AM Location: 229 SH, First
content:
[image: Logo]
New Event Alert üöÄ

Hello,

A new Event has been created : Hands-on Workshop on "Web Development : From
Concepts to Code".

   - Date: Saturday, April 5, 2025
   - Time: 09:30 AM
   - Location: 229 SH, First Floor, A5 Building, CHARUSAT

Are you ready to dive into the world of web development? Join us for an
immersive hands-on workshop where you'll learn the fundamentals of web
development and turn concepts into real-world applications.

Don't miss out! Click the button below to learn more:

View Event Details

Liberal arts courses help me explore my creative side.


Liberal arts subjects feel irrelevant to my career goals.


Liberal arts courses add diversity to the university curriculum.


The inclusion of liberal arts subjects enhances the overall university  
experience.


I believe liberal arts courses should be optional for students in technical  
fields.


I enjoy participating in activities during liberal arts classes.


Liberal arts courses are exciting and fun.


Liberal arts courses encourage me to express my individuality.


Attending liberal arts classes is a refreshing change from my technical  
subjects.


Liberal arts courses have improved my creative problem-solving skills.


Liberal arts courses enhance my ability to work on team projects.


Liberal arts courses have made me more confident in public speaking.


Skills gained in liberal arts courses can be applied in my daily life.


The knowledge gained in liberal arts courses is relevant to modern  
professional settings.


I find it challenging to see the practical applications of liberal arts  
courses in my career.


Liberal arts education is essential for holistic personal and professional  
growth.


The creative assignments in liberal arts courses are harder than they seem.


Liberal arts courses should include a mix of theory and practical work for  
balanced learning.


Liberal arts courses have helped me appreciate diverse cultures and  
perspectives.


Liberal arts classes encourage collaboration and teamwork.


The teaching methods used in liberal arts courses are innovative and  
engaging.


Liberal arts faculty inspire creativity in their students.


My peers perceive liberal arts courses as less serious compared to  
technical courses.


Liberal arts courses provide a platform for socializing and networking.


Experiences in liberal arts courses build transferable skills that are  
valuable in any career.


Participating in liberal arts activities will enhance my resume or  
portfolio.


The ability to think creatively, gained from liberal arts, will help me  
adapt to diverse challenges.


Liberal arts education contributes to building a well-rounded personality.


More hands-on workshops and guest lectures would make liberal arts courses  
more appealing.


Interdisciplinary projects involving liberal arts and technical students  
would foster collaboration.


Subjects Studied *


HSUS109 Dramatics



HSUS109 Dramatics


HSUS109 Dramatics *


Strongly agree Agree Neither agree nor disagree Disagree Strongly disagree

This course has helped me understand the fundamentals of performing arts.


I can now differentiate between various forms of performing arts, including  
theatre.


I have developed a deeper appreciation for the role of dramatics in  
performing arts.


The course has improved my ability to portray different characters  
convincingly.


I have learned professional acting techniques that enhance my stage  
presence.


My confidence in performing in front of an audience has significantly  
improved.


This course has helped me understand the importance of voice modulation,  
body language, and expressions in acting.


I have gained practical experience in various aspects of theatrical  
performance.


The training sessions have improved my ability to improvise during a  
performance.


I feel more comfortable performing in different types of roles and scenes.


I have gained knowledge of the history and evolution of theatre.


The course has deepened my understanding of theatre's impact on society and  
culture.


Learning about theatre theory has enhanced my ability to analyze and  
critique performances.


I now appreciate the aesthetic aspects of theatre, such as stage design,  
lighting, and direction.


The course has provided me with hands-on experience in monologues,  
dialogues, and group scenes.


I have learned effective rehearsal techniques that have improved my  
performance skills.


The training in dance and voice has helped me enhance my overall stage  
presence.


I have developed a better understanding of theatre production and its  
technical aspects.


Performing before a live audience has boosted my confidence and stage  
awareness.


The structured training in this course has helped me refine my acting and  
performance abilities.

subject: hm
Recruitment For Nakshatra Aerospace
snippet: Hello everyone! üöÄ Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics & Communication and Mechanical Department As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
content:
*Hello everyone! üöÄ*

Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics &
Communication and Mechanical Department

As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
development on the Propulsion Systems, Design, Avionics, Recovery and
Material Science

We're thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for all B.Tech students!
The Nakshatra Aerospace Club is officially recruiting new members, and we
want YOU to be a part of this Stellar journey into the world of Aerospace
innovation!


*Why Join Us?*

Being part of Nakshatra Aerospace means you‚Äôll engage in hands-on projects,
collaborate with like-minded peers, and prepare for interviews with
industry leaders. Plus, it‚Äôs a fantastic way to enhance your resume!
Don‚Äôt miss out on this incredible opportunity to soar high with Nakshatra
Aerospace! üåå

Looking forward to seeing your applications!


https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdpMxTKdA4gNtlLeGDoM0W5D6Ch-tKuZQnDJlMonw97xbJpGQ/viewform

For further Queries you can Contact:

nakshatraaerospaceclub@gmail.com

+91 9726798232

From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Mar 25, 2025 at 4:53‚ÄØPM
Subject: Fwd: 'Getting started with building AI (Artificial Intelligence)
Projects and Agents' online session for the students of Devang Patel
Institute of Advance Technology and Research.
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Bhuvaneshwari from Bolt IoT <trainings@boltiot.com>
Date: Tue, Mar 25, 2025 at 4:52‚ÄØPM
Subject: 'Getting started with building AI (Artificial Intelligence)
Projects and Agents' online session for the students of Devang Patel
Institute of Advance Technology and Research.
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Session on building AI projects and agents, covering essential concepts and
development steps.

Dear Professor Dr.Amit Ganatra,



Last week we organised a session on Artificial Intelligence. We received a
tremendous response from students across India joining us. Thank you for
your support in sharing about this program. In continuation of these AI
sessions, this week we are organising a webinar on the topic of 'Getting
started with building AI (Artificial Intelligence) Projects and Agents'.
There is *NO FEE* for this session, but *seats are limited* and will be
allocated on a *first-come, first-served basis*.



*Also, since AICTE has declared 2025 as the Year of AI *and since institutions
are actively updating their curricula to* include topics in Artificial
Intelligence. *This series of sessions will help students gain essential
insights into key AI concepts.



We request you to *share the invite with your students *by *forwarding this
email *or*  Click here to share over WhatsApp

   - This online event will guide students to 'Get started with AI
   (Artificial Intelligence)'.
   - *Senior Industry Experts will be the speaker.*

subject: Important: Online Quiz Scheduled on March 29th ‚Äì Instructions Inside
snippet: Dear Students, The first online quiz is scheduled for March 29th from 11:20 to 11:30 AM. Please keep the following points in mind: The quiz consists of 5 MCQs and must be completed within 10 minutes.
content:
*Dear Students,*

The first online quiz is scheduled for *March 29th from 11:20 to 11:30 AM*.
Please keep the following points in mind:

   1.

   The quiz consists of *5 MCQs* and must be completed within *10 minutes*.
   2.

   Incorrect *ID inputs* will not be considered and will result in *zero
   marks*.
   3.

   Ensure you are in a *stable network environment*. Any *network or
   technical issues will not be considered*.
   4.

   The *Google Form link* will be sent to you via email on the day of the
   quiz.
   5.

   Login is allowed *only* using your *Charusat email ID*.
   6.

   For any queries, please write an email.

Best regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *
*‡§µ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ß‡•à‡§µ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ü‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ï‡§Æ*

subject: Summer Internship Opportunities ‚Äì 2025 at CROWN Software
snippet: Dear Students, Please apply for the Summer Internship - 2025 in your relevant domain if interested. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: <hr@glexas.com> Date: Mon, 24 Mar, 2025, 9:48 pm
content:
Dear Students,

Please apply for the Summer Internship - 2025 in your relevant domain if
interested.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <hr@glexas.com>
Date: Mon, 24 Mar, 2025, 9:48 pm
Subject: Summer Internship Opportunities ‚Äì 2025
To: Ashwinmakwana Ce <ashwinmakwana.ce@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir / Ma'am,

Greetings!

As part of our ongoing collaboration over the years, we are pleased to
extend *summer internship opportunities* for students once again for 2025.
We truly appreciate the support of your institution in connecting students
with industry exposure, and we look forward to continuing this association.

This year, we are offering a *7-8 week internship program* (from *10-05-2025
to 04-07-2025*) in the following domains:

   1.

   *Flutter Developer* ‚Äì Mobile app development using Flutter, Dart,
   Firebase - 4
   2.

   *Website Developer* ‚Äì Frontend & Backend development (Html, css,
   Javascript) - 4
   3.

   *REST API Developer* ‚Äì API development & integration using PHP, SQL - 3
   4.

   *UI/UX Designer* ‚Äì Wireframing, prototyping, designing, video creation
   using Figma -3
   5.

   *QA & Testing* ‚Äì Manual and automated testing, bug tracking, and
   reporting - 3

Selection Process:

   -

   Shortlisting based on resume screening
   -

   Followed by a technical interview (online/offline)

Mode of Internship:

   -

   Hybrid (online/offline, depending on project requirements)

We would be grateful if you could kindly forward this opportunity to your
students who might be interested. They can apply using the following *Google
Form*:
https://forms.gle/pw7qPqNViLydodnU8

Please let us know if you require any additional information or if there
are any formalities to proceed with this collaboration. Looking forward to
your kind response.

Best regards,
CROWN Software


-- 
regards
Ms. Krishna Patel (Ph.D.)
Assistant Professor
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science And Technology

--

subject: Reminder: HSUS109 DRAMATICS | LIBERAL ARTS 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Hope you are all excited for the HSUS109 Dramatics workshop! The course will be conducted in Workshop Mode from March 25 to March 28, 2025 (9:10 AM ‚Äì 4:30 PM) at CHARUSAT Campus, Changa.
content:
Dear Students,

Hope you are all excited for the *HSUS109 Dramatics* workshop!

The course will be conducted in *Workshop Mode* from *March 25 to March 28,
2025 (9:10 AM ‚Äì 4:30 PM)* at *CHARUSAT Campus, Changa*. Your *Internal and
External Evaluations* will also take place during these four days.

üìç *Venue Details:*


*On Day 1 (09:10 AM ‚Äì 11:10 AM), there will be a General Briefing Session
for all students in the IIIM Building, Room No. 214.*
Attendance is mandatory for all participants. After that and for the
remaining three days, sessions will be conducted in the DEPSTAR building.
Room allocations are as follows:

Room No. 123 ‚Äì Group A (Students of CSPIT EE, IT, EC, ME, CSE)
Room No. 124 ‚Äì Group B (Students of IIIM, PDPIAS and CSPIT CE)

Room No. 125 ‚Äì Group C (Students of DEPSTAR, RPCP, CMPICA)




Please ensure you are seated in your assigned room for each session.

üìå *Important Instructions:*

   -

   *100% Attendance is Compulsory.*
   -

   Carry your *Identity Card* at all times.
   -

   Wear comfortable clothes

For *regular updates*, please join the *Google Classroom* using this
link: click
here <https://classroom.google.com/c/NzUyNDQxMzg3MTE3?cjc=23tria7>

It is *mandatory* to complete all *assignments, tasks, activities, and the
viva* during these four days. Failure to do so may result in a *backlog*.

For any queries, feel free to contact:
üìû *Ms. Celine Davla - 9737517553*

Looking forward to an engaging and exciting workshop!

Regards,

-- 
*Ms. Celine Davla*
*Assistant Professor*
*HSS Department*
*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management*
*CHARUSAT*
*Mo. 9737517553*

--

subject: Re: Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel Merit-cum-Means Scholarship for the First Year Students of Undergraduate Program of DEPSTAR (2024-25)
snippet: Tomorrow is last day. Dear Sir, Please find the "Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel Merit-cum-Means Scholarship" for the First Year Students of Undergraduate
content:
Tomorrow is last day.
>
>
>
>
>
> *Dear Sir,*
>
>
>
> *Please find the "Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai
> Patel Merit-cum-Means Scholarship" for the First Year Students of
> Undergraduate Program of DEPSTAR (2024-25)*
>
>
>
> *You are requested to send the filled form with documents received from
> the eligible students latest by 28th march 2025.*
>
> *CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY*
>
>
>
>  NOTICE
>
>
> *Date: 05/03/2025*
>
>
> Bhupendrabhai Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel
> Merit-cum-Means Scholarship for the First Year Students of Undergraduate
> Program of DEPSTAR (2024-25)
>
>
>
> This is for information to all the concerned students that Bhupendrabhai
> Narshibhai Patel & Kokilaben Bhupendrabhai Patel Merit-cum-Means
> Scholarship will be awarded to Undergraduate program Student of *DEPSTAR *for
> academic year 2024-25, with the following Criteria:
> Eligibility Criteria to get Scholarship for the Academic Year 2024-25:
>
>
>
> v  The Student of F Y B Tech whose 12th Standard result is more than 70
> Percentage & family income is not more than Rs. 7 lacs will be eligible to
> apply
>
> v  To continue to be eligible for availing Scholarship, the Student has
> to secure 7.00 CGPA or above at the end of every Year without backlog.
>
> v  In case, student will not score minimum 7.00 CGPA in consecutive Year,
> then scholarship will be awarded to another eligible student.
>
> v  Students receiving Govt. / Donor / CHARUSAT / any other scholarship or
> admitted under the Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme (TFWS) are not eligible to
> apply.
>
> v  The Scholarship will be awarded to maximum one eligible student of
> DEPSTAR
>
>
>
> *The forms for the scholarship are available and is to be submitted as per
> following details:*
>
>
>
> *Name of Institute*
>
> *Forms to be collected from*
>
> DEPSTAR
>
> Mr. Dharmendra Patel
>
>
>
> *Last Date of Submission of Form: 25.03.2025*
>
>
>
>
>
> **Note: No Form will be accepted after the last date.*
>
> --
> *VISHAL M PATEL*
> *OFFICE EXECUTIVE*
> *CHANDUBHAI S. PATEL INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY.(CSPIT)*
> *CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY*
> *CHARUSAT CAMPUS, CHANGA*

subject: Online Quiz 1 Notification for Engineering Physics - 2 (Experiments 5 to 9)
snippet: Dear First-Year Students, The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the details below: Date: 29/03/2025 Day:
content:
Dear First-Year Students,

The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for
Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the
details below:

*Date:* 29/03/2025

*Day:* Saturday

*Time:* 4:00 PM to 4:30 PM

*Mode:* Online (Google Form)

*Total Marks:* 25 MCQs

*Evaluation Component:* Continuous Assessment

The Google Form link for the quiz will be shared on the day of the exam. I
just wanted to let you know that *no excuses related to internet*
connectivity issues will be entertained. Just so you know, this quiz is
part of your *continuous evaluation*, and failing to attempt it will
significantly impact your overall grades as per NEP.

The components for internal evaluation (25 Marks).

Quiz 1

Quiz 2

Lab Manual

Journal

20%

20%

20%

40%

Ensure your availability and preparedness for the quiz. For any queries,
feel free to reach out to your lab-in-charge for further assistance.

Best regards,
Sanni

subject: "Internship_Career - Students of CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY"
snippet: Dear Student bearing enrollment ID 24dcs053, From CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY. Congratulations! You've been selected for a unique 2-month Training & Internship program to give you valuable industry
content:
*Dear Student bearing enrollment ID 24dcs053, From CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY.*

*Congratulations! You've been selected* for a unique *2-month Training &
Internship program* to give you valuable industry experience. *LaunchEd
Global* is offering this opportunity, with *certifications* *verified by
WIPRO Dice ID* and aligned with *AICTE* standards.

*Fill out the Google Form to Apply to this program:*
                    *https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9*
<https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9>

*Here‚Äôs what you can expect:*

*1. Comprehensive Training:*

   - *Live Expert Sessions:* Evening classes (6:30 PM - 8:00 PM) via Zoom,
   guided by industry professionals.
   - *Skill Development:* Learn from foundational to advanced concepts,
   perfect for all levels.
   - *Practical AI:* Build applications, explore Generative AI, and master
   prompt engineering with minimal coding.
   - *Flexible Learning:* Access recorded sessions on our LMS for 6 months
   after the program starts.

*2. Hands-On Internship Experience:*

   - *Individual Projects:* Complete 10+ focused projects, applying what
   you learn.
   - *Team Collaboration:* Work on a major capstone project in a group of
   3-4, with clear roles and responsibilities.
   - *Career Preparation:* Receive expert guidance on resume building and
   practice your interview skills with mock interviews.
   - *Industry Insights:* Learn from leaders at prominent global companies
   through masterclasses.

*Valuable Certifications:*

   - *Course Certificate:* Earn a certificate from IIT-KHARAGPUR(Kshitij)
   - *Internship Certificate:* Receive a certificate from our partner
   companies.
   - *Verified Credibility:* Both certificates are verified by WIPRO Dice
   ID.
   - Ãâ*Career Support:* Join our community for placement assistance and
   connections with leading companies.

*Om Jena*
Senior Internship Counsellor, LaunchEd Global

Subject: Announcing Ideation Challenge Season 2!üí°

We are inviting you and your students to register for Ideation Challenge
Season 2 - Registration Started
<https://lntecc.us13.list-manage.com/track/click?u=b2db948b51a888d49b1622c22&id=7137ea1c4b&e=fb71f6949c>

Dear DEVANG PATEL INSTITUTE OF ADVANCE TECHNOLOGY AND RESEARCH Principal,

We are excited to announce the launch of *Ideation Challenge Season 2*, a
competition designed to inspire and empower the next generation of
innovators in the *energy sector*. We invite you to encourage your students
to participate and showcase their creativity in tackling real-world
challenges.

This year‚Äôs challenge focuses on areas like *AI-powered energy optimization*,
*smart grid technologies*, and *sustainable solutions* for a greener
future. It‚Äôs an excellent opportunity for students to apply their
knowledge, collaborate with experts, and contribute to the evolution of the
energy landscape.
*Why should your students Participate?*

   - *Prizes and Recognition: *Compete for a total prize pool of *‚Çπ2,50,000*,
   with the* winner taking home ‚Çπ1,00,000* in cash prizes.
   - *Real-World Impact*: Students will work on addressing global energy
   challenges and help shape the future of the industry.
   - *Collaborate with Industry Experts*: Students will gain exposure to
   professionals and mentors who can guide them in realizing their innovative
   ideas.
   - *Internship opportunity:* The *top 5 teams* will receive *paid
   internships* through the *L&T Elevate program*.

<https://lntecc.us13.list-manage.com/track/click?u=b2db948b51a888d49b1622c22&id=469a706f98&e=fb71f6949c>
*How to Participate?*

   1. *Form a Team*: Teams should consist of 3 students, along with one
   faculty mentor.
   2. *Select a Theme*: Students can choose from a range of exciting themes
   in the competition.
   3. *Submit Their Idea*: Solutions must be uploaded via the Ideation
   dashboard by 25th March.

<https://lntecc.us13.list-manage.com/track/click?u=b2db948b51a888d49b1622c22&id=714bc1f537&e=fb71f6949c>
Click here to register
<https://lntecc.us13.list-manage.com/track/click?u=b2db948b51a888d49b1622c22&id=d6de228970&e=fb71f6949c>

Accommodation and travel expenses will be provided for the teams selected
for the grand finale!

We believe this competition will provide your students with an incredible
learning experience and help them build valuable skills for their future
careers.

We look forward to seeing your students' innovative ideas. Together, let‚Äôs
shape the future of energy!

*If you have any queries, please reach out to des_innovation@lntecc.com
<des_innovation@lntecc.com> for prompt assistance!*

Best regards,
*L&T Digital Energy Solutions*

subject: Fwd: Math for AI Club Activity: Math Magic Behind GANs
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Spoorthy V <spoorthy.aiml@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Mar 20, 2025 at 2:01 PM Subject: Math for AI Club Activity: Math Magic Behind GANs To: <22aiml
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Spoorthy V <spoorthy.aiml@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Mar 20, 2025 at 2:01‚ÄØPM
Subject: Math for AI Club Activity: Math Magic Behind GANs
To: <22aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <23aiml@charusat.edu.in>, Head CSE <
hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, <24aiml@charusat.edu.in>, Head CE CHARUSAT <
hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>,
DEPSTAR_CE <depstar_ce@charusat.ac.in>, Depstar_CSE <
depstar_cse@charusat.ac.in>, DEPSTAR IT <depstar_it@charusat.ac.in>, HOD
AIML <hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: AIML <aiml@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

I hope this email finds you well.

Math for AI club under the Department of Artificial Intelligence & Machine
Learning, CSPIT, CHARUSAT is organizing an *Expert Talk* on the *"Math
Magic Behind GANs"* on March 21, 2025.

Discover the fascinating mathematical concepts that power *Generative
Adversarial Networks (GANs)*, one of the most revolutionary AI techniques
used in image synthesis, deep learning, and beyond.

This event is open to all students of the institute who are eager to
explore the intersection of *Mathematics and AI*. No prior GAN experience
is needed‚Äîjust bring your curiosity!

Join us for an interactive session that will deepen your understanding and
spark new insights.


*Session Details:*

   - *Date:* March 21, 2025
   - *Time:* 10:10 AM to 11:15 AM
   - *Venue:* Will be updated at the earliest.
   - *Last Date of Registration:*  21/03/2025 (09:00 PM)


*Registration Link:* https://tinyurl.com/8usp657c (Seats are limited)


Feel free to contact us for any queries on

*Pooja Mehta (22AIML020) - 6351857705 (Student Coordinator)*

*Kesha Desai (22AIML008) - 7573017335 **(Student Coordinator)*

*Spoorthy V. - 8310726037 **(Faculty Coordinator)*


We look forward to seeing you there!


*Please refer to the attached brochure for details. *

-- 
Thanks and regards,

*Dr. Spoorthy. V*,
Assistant Professor,
Department of AI-ML,
CSPIT, CHARUSAT Campus,
Highway, Off, Nadiad - Petlad Rd,
Changa, Gujarat 388421

subject: "CHARUSAT Students Get Certified: Phase-2 Launch-ED Global Internship"
snippet: Dear Student, We are excited to invite you to apply for the Launch-ED Global Internship Program, a unique opportunity for students eager to gain hands-on experience in the tech industry through expert
content:
Dear Student,

We are excited to invite you to apply for the Launch-ED Global Internship
Program, a unique opportunity for students eager to gain hands-on
experience in the tech industry through expert training and mentorship.

*Program Overview:*

   -

   *Month 1: Expert Training*
   - Attend live sessions led by industry professionals with over 10 years
      of experience.
      - Learn valuable skills in low-code/no-code tools, AI, and prompt
      engineering.
      - Receive personalized mentorship and hands-on training.
   -

   *Month 2: Real-World Projects*
   - Work on individual mini-projects with mentor support.
      - Collaborate on a capstone group project addressing real-world
      challenges.

*Program Benefits:*

   - Certification from leading MNCs.
   - Networking and professional mentorship.
   - Training in cutting-edge technologies, including Generative AI and
   low-code/no-code tools.

*How to Apply:*

   - Submit your application via this registration form.
   *REGISTRATION FORM* <https://forms.gle/fbz2jzGmzNycTt5eA>

   - Shortlisted candidates will be contacted by our HR team.

Spaces are limited, so apply soon!

Give Wings to your Startup Ideas

Presenting ASPIRE 400K, a start up competition that brings the mentors, the
investors and the entrepreneurs/innovators on one platform. It's as simple
as it gets -

* choose the category, participate, and win *

exciting prize money in each category. Additionally, the jury (which are
mentors and investors from various industries) are available to connect and
build with. Participants also get access to partners across categories who
they can work with to help the ideas grow.


Who knows, this might be the easiest connection you get to take your
journey to next level, irrespective of where you stand in the trajectory.


*Ideation Stage*

Cash Prize worth 50k

1-1 Mentorship

Startup Toolkit

Certificate of Recognition

*Dear Sir,*


*Please find the "* *Late Kamlaben Ambalal bin Becharbhai, Bakrol and Mrs.
Pushpaben Dinesh Patel Merit Cum Means Scholarship **for 1st Year Students
of B.Tech Program DEPSTAR for the *

*academic year (2024-25).*



*You are requested to send the filled form with documents received from the
eligible students latest by 5th April 2025.*


*CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY*



*Date: 19/03/2025   *

*NOTICE*


*Subject: - Late Kamlaben Ambalal bin Becharbhai, Bakrol and Mrs. Pushpaben
Dinesh Patel Merit Cum Means Scholarship for 1st * *Year Students of B.Tech
Program DEPSTAR **for **the academic year (2024-25).*



This is for information to all the concerned students that, Late Kamlaben
Ambalal bin Becharbhai, Bakrol and Mrs. Pushpaben Dinesh Patel Merit Cum
Means Scholarship will be awarded to the students of 1st year of B.Tech
(DEPSTAR) program for academic year 2024-25, with the following Criteria:



*Eligibility Criteria to get Scholarship for the Academic Year 2024-25:*

v Students of *1st year* who have secured *60 percentage* or above in the 12
th standard.

v Students whose family income is not more than `4.5 lacs.

v To continue to be eligible for availing Scholarship, the Student has to
secure 7.00 CGPA or above at the end of every year without backlog.

v In case, student will not score minimum 7.00 CGPA in consecutive year,
then scholarship will be awarded to another eligible student, selected by
the Donor and recommended by CHARUSAT.

v Only Two students shall be selected for the scholarship each Year.

v Students receiving any other scholarship (e.g. MYSY) and Students
admitted under Tuition Fees waiver Scheme (TFWS) are not eligible to apply.

v The Scholarship is meant to provide maximum support to two students,
selected by Donor based on merit-cum-means, and complying above conditions.





*The forms for the scholarship are available and is to be submitted as per
following details:*



*Name of Institute*

*Forms to be collected from*

*Room No.*

DEPSTAR

Mr. Dharmendra Patel

DEPSTAR Building

*Last Date of Submission of Form:   01.04.2025*



**Note: No Form will be accepted after the last date.*

*CHANDUBHAI S. PATEL INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY.(CSPIT)*
*CHAROTAR UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY*
*CHARUSAT CAMPUS, CHANGA*

content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in>

Voice
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

We are thrilled to invite all the students of CHARUSAT to participate in
the upcoming event *GUSTAKHI: Where Words and Actions Dare to Defy*, a
vibrant platform for fearless storytellers, bold visionaries, and defiant
poets to express their creativity and challenge norms jointly organised by
Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management (IIIM), Faculty of Humanities
(FoH) and Women‚Äôs Development Cell (WDC-IIIM).

*üìÖ Date:* March 21, 2025

*üïí Time:* 10:00 AM onward

*üìç Venue:* IIIM, CHARUSAT Campus

Join us for four exciting events that celebrate artistic expression,
critical thinking, and bold ideas:
*1Ô∏è‚É£ Expert Talk:* *When We Cross the Laxman Rekha: Girls, Women, and
Boundaries to Freedom*

üéôÔ∏è Speaker: *Dr. Sonali Pattnaik* ‚Äì Award-winning Poet, Author, and Visual
Artist

üîó Register Here : https://forms.gle/CnDiYSumWmCV14FN6
*2Ô∏è‚É£ Panel Discussion:* *The Power of Dissent in Society*

üó£Ô∏è Engage in dynamic conversations exploring:

   - The role of rebellious narratives in shaping society
   - Challenges faced by women who speak against norms
   - Crab mentality ‚Äì Are women their own enemies?
   üîó Register Here : https://forms.gle/cxn9e3Tdp73RKwSQ8

*3Ô∏è‚É£ INK and Outrage:* *Your Writing Reflects Who You Are*

‚úçÔ∏è Showcase your creativity in *Poetry*, *Story Writing*, *Comic Creation*,
and more.
Theme: *Freedom*, *Identity*, *Womanhood*, *Self-Love*, and *All Gender
Neutral*
üîó Register Here: https://forms.gle/Z3UQ6JENtppGQRFh8
*4Ô∏è‚É£ Open Mic:* *Bebaak Batein*

üé§ Step into the spotlight with *Unfiltered Stories*, *Poetry*, and *Artistic
Performances* on bold themes.
üîó Register Here: https://forms.gle/Tz7JfZn75sZTqGxZ6

*üìù Registration Deadline:* March 20, 2025

Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to showcase your talent and voice your thoughts
on bold and impactful themes. We encourage all CHARUSAT students to
participate and make GUSTAKHI 2025 a memorable event!

We look forward to an exciting and inspiring event!

For further details, feel free to contact :

*Event Coordinators:* Ms. Margi Mehta (8866486076)| Ms. Pranjal Bhatt
(9429296329)

*Event Convenors:* Dr. Binit Patel | Dr. Bhaskar Pandya
Thanking you in anticipation of your positive response,

With regards,


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

subject: Re:
snippet: CSE-DEPSTAR CSUC101-Digital Electronics Page No: Date: EXPERIMENT NO. 7 AIM: Design, implement and verify the operation of the circuit using i. Multiplexer and ii. decoder for given Boolean expressions
content:
CSE-DEPSTAR CSUC101-Digital Electronics

Page No:

Date:

EXPERIMENT NO. 7

AIM: Design, implement and verify the operation of the circuit using i.
Multiplexer and ii.
decoder for given Boolean expressions.
SIMULATION SOFTWARE: https://www.digitalelectronicsdeeds.com/downloads.html
APPARATUS: 8 X 1 MUX, 3 to 8 Decoder, OR Gate ICs, Switches, LED,
connecting wires.
THEORY:
(I) Implementation of Function using Multiplexer
Combinational logic circuits can be designed using Multiplexers (MUX).
Standard ICs like 74152
(8:1 MUX), 74150 (16:1 MUX) etc are available in market. Combinational
logic design using
Multiplexer provide many advantages like reduction of IC package count,
simplified logic design,
no requirement of logic expression simplification in the circuit.
Example: Implement the following Boolean function using 8 √ó 1 MUX
F (A, B, C, D) = Œ£m (0, 1, 3, 4, 8, 9, 15)

PROCEDURE:
i). Make connections as per logic circuit diagram.
ii). Apply proper input condition and observe the output information of led
on/off.
iii). Apply all possible combinations of input and verify correctness of
circuit output as per truth
tables.
SCREENSHOTS: (Keep your enrolment number in DEEDs as label which can be
seen in
every screenshot)

CSE-DEPSTAR CSUC101-Digital Electronics

Page No:

(II) Implementation of Function using Decoder
A decoder takes n-input lines and has 2n output lines. These output lines
can provide the minterms
of input variables. Since any Boolean function can be expressed as a sum of
minterms, a decoder
that can generate these minterms along with external OR gates that form
their logical sums, can be
used to form a circuit of any boolean function.
Example, Implement the logic of a full adder, using 3 to 8 decoders and OR
gates.
S(x,y,z) = Œ£m(1,2,4,7)
C(x,y,z)=Œ£m(3,5,6,7)

PROCEDURE:
i). Make connections as per logic circuit diagram.
ii). Apply proper input condition and observe the output information of led
on/off.
iii). Apply all possible combinations of input and verify correctness of
circuit output as per truth
tables.
SCREENSHOTS: (Keep your enrolment number in DEEDs as label which can be
seen in
every screenshot)

subject: Important Notice: Kit distribution | DRAMATICS
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings! Please note that the kit distribution for your liberal arts workshop on DRAMATICS is scheduled on Tuesday, 18th March 2025(Today). You need to collect the kits from Indukaka
content:
Dear Students,



Greetings!



*Please note that the kit distribution for your liberal arts workshop on
DRAMATICS is scheduled on Tuesday, 18th March 2025(Today).* You need to
collect the kits from Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management between
1:15 PM to 4:15 PM.


Please note the following instructions for the courses:



1.       100% Attendance is Compulsory.

2.       It is required that you carry your own Identity Card.

3.       Details of the schedule/venue of the course will be there in your
Kit.

4.    Check the SOP, kit letter, Schedule and Syllabus in the kit


Contact the Institute / Department Coordinators or your Mentor in case you
have any queries.



We hope you will have a wonderful learning experience.



Thank you.



Regards,


-- 
*Ms. Celine Davla*
*Assistant Professor*
*HSS Department*
*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management*
*CHARUSAT*
*Mo. 9737517553*

--

subject: Fwd: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making Competition Details
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: DHRUVI MAHALE <22cs036@charusat.edu.in> Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:07 PM Subject: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: DHRUVI MAHALE <22cs036@charusat.edu.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:07‚ÄØPM
Subject: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making
Competition Details
To: <coordinator.nss@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: <pinalhansora.cse@charusat.ac.in>, <22cs051@charusat.edu.in>


Respected Sir,

I hope this email finds you well.

We, the *CSE NSS Unit*, are organizing a *Traffic Awareness Program* on *20th
March 2025* to spread awareness about road safety and responsible driving
among students. As part of this initiative, we are hosting a *Poster Making
Competition* on *18th March 2025*.

üìå *Competition Details:*

   - Open to all students of *Charusat University*
   - Teams of *2 or 3 members* can participate
   - Only *20 teams* will be selected on a *first-come, first-serve* basis
   - The best posters will be showcased at the *Traffic Awareness Program*
   - *Participants must bring their own laptops for designing the poster  *

We request you to kindly forward this information to all departments so
that interested students can participate. They can register by filling out
the form linked below:

üìç *Registration Link: *https://forms.gle/nFMfduwfUAyHPfzX6

Attached is the *poster for the event* for further reference.
[image: image.png]

For any queries, students can contact:
üìû  *9328068864 **, *99790 99218

We appreciate your support in spreading the word about this initiative.
Looking forward to your kind cooperation.

Best Regards,
Dhruvi mahale



-- 
Thanks & Regards
--

--

subject: Fwd: PrepInsta Joins AICTE‚Äôs NEAT 4.0 Initiative ‚Äì Empowering Students for Better Careers
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 7:11 AM Subject: Fwd: PrepInsta Joins AICTE's NEAT 4.0 Initiative
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 7:11‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: PrepInsta Joins AICTE‚Äôs NEAT 4.0 Initiative ‚Äì Empowering
Students for Better Careers
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Sat, 15 Mar, 2025, 1:34‚ÄØam
Subject: PrepInsta Joins AICTE‚Äôs NEAT 4.0 Initiative ‚Äì Empowering Students
for Better Careers
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/11-Mar/AICTE/index.html>
------------------------------

Dear All,

We are excited to share that PrepInsta, a leading placement preparation
platform, is now a part of AICTE‚Äôs NEAT 4.0 (National Educational Alliance
for Technology) initiative. This collaboration marks a significant step in
transforming technical education and enhancing employability for students
across India, particularly those from economically and socially weaker
sections.

How PrepInsta Supports NEAT 4.0:
Industry-Relevant Courses: Coding (C, C++, Java, Python, DSA), Aptitude
Training, Soft Skills, AI, ML, Cybersecurity & more.
Expert-Led Training: Learn from the top 1% of professionals from Amazon,
Google, Flipkart, Microsoft, etc.
Comprehensive Learning Support: Assessments, analytics, doubt-solving, and
mentorship sessions.
Internship & Placement Assistance:Helping students get dream opportunities.
Analytics Dashboard & Assessment Tool: Helping College management to track
student performances & to conduct customised assessments

Through this initiative, students can now access PrepInsta courses via Neat
4.0 portal and equip themselves with the skills needed to thrive in today‚Äôs
competitive job market.

We encourage you to explore PrepInsta platform:
PrepInsta Prime Website: https://prepinstaprime.com/
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=924cb5ca3289e177fde4684261828b67efad432c&lat=2025&mid=9b3a30be21151817a9a1d54ec0d865dc61f0418b>

PrepInsta Prime Trailer: https://bit.ly/prime-demo-videos
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=fbacf61883e83cb88971252ed9fc3a4ad5f8dffd&lat=2025&mid=9b3a30be21151817a9a1d54ec0d865dc61f0418b>

Neat Portal Link:
https://neat.aicte-india.org/course-details/NEAT20221935_PROD_1
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=934fada078ad2cf8229c854b149f6313146462a0&lat=2025&mid=9b3a30be21151817a9a1d54ec0d865dc61f0418b>

PrepInsta.com: https://prepinsta.com/
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=ff7d557bda0e3028fd517b10f80e3abdbaf1b920&lat=2025&mid=9b3a30be21151817a9a1d54ec0d865dc61f0418b>


For more details, please find the attached brochure. Feel free to visit
https://prepinstaprime.com/college or connect us on 7982326054.

PFA:-
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1aPN8RAGO0xs8naDSzhJTbJW51V0auW_w/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=112998132956236016256&rtpof=true&sd=true
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=e37715f3f632932283a676f5c55b392ef5c10140&lat=2025&mid=9b3a30be21151817a9a1d54ec0d865dc61f0418b>


*Best Regards,*
*All India Council for Technical Education*
*Nelson Mandela road, Vasantkunj, New Delhi-110070
<https://www.google.com/maps/search/Nelson+Mandela+road,+Vasantkunj,+New+Delhi-110070?entry=gmail&source=g>*

gauravkumar.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, Head EC CHARUSAT <hod.ec@charusat.ac.in>,
<head.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, Amit Nayak <amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>, Dr
Dweepna Garg <dweepnagarg.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Parth Goel <
parthgoel.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Chirag Patel <chiragpatel.dce@charusat.ac.in>



*Dear All, *


We're excited to announce the upcoming batch of the AWS Academy's *"Cloud
Practitioner Foundational"* course, scheduled for March 2025!


Please find the attached brochure


*Benefits on enrollment *



   - 50% AWS exam voucher will be provided to students
   - Full access to all modules of AWS LMS and Hands-on lab.
   - Exam preparation material with Mock exam




*Benefits of AWS Certification*


There are numerous advantages to becoming AWS certified. Amazon Web
Services certifications‚Ä¶



   - Validate your skills and knowledge in the preeminent cloud computing
   platform.
   - are consistently listed among the top-paying info-tech certifications
   worldwide.
   - Garner more interviews for aspiring cloud specialists and higher wages
   once hired.
   - Are recognized industry-wide as reliable and well-designed tech
   credentials.
   - Demonstrate credibility and dedication to your cloud computing career
   path.
   - Provide access to a network of like-minded peers and AWS
    thought-leaders.
   - Require recertification which ensures that your AWS skills remain
   current.


Interested students are requested to register themselves using the
following link:

*Registration for Cloud Practitioner Foundational**: *Click Here!!
<https://forms.gle/EAo4zLYKoBKGmc7N9>

Registration is open till next week (22 March 2023)

*Respective faculty members are requested to circulate this to students
in your respective Institute / Branch.*


For any Query contact

Prof. Sanket Suthar (CSPIT-IT)

sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in <sandippatel.it@charusat.ac.in>

Dr. Parth Shah (CSPIT-IT)

parthshah.ce@charusat.ac.in

--

subject: A COURSE ON LIBERAL ARTS | HSUS109 DRAMATICS | MARCH 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings! You must be aware that your curriculum offers a 2 Credit Compulsory Course on Liberal Arts. We thank you for selecting HSUS109 Dramatics. Please note that the course will be
content:
Dear Students,



Greetings!



You must be aware that your curriculum offers a 2 Credit Compulsory Course
on Liberal Arts. We thank you for selecting HSUS109 Dramatics.



Please note that the course will be taught in the Workshop Mode (9:10 am to
4:30 pm) during 25th to 28th March 2025 at CHARUSAT Campus, Changa. *Your
Internal as well as External Evaluation will also be carried out during
these 4 days only. *


*The venue for your 4 days workshop will be informed shortly.*

*For regular updates please join the google classroom using this link.
(Click here for the link
<https://classroom.google.com/c/NzUyNDQxMzg3MTE3?cjc=23tria7>)*



It is compulsory for you to attend the course and complete all assignments,
tasks, activities given and appear in the Viva (Internal and External)
during those 4 days only.



*If you fail to attend, complete the tasks, activities and
assignments, you may fail in the second semester and get a backlog.*



Please note the following instructions for the courses:



1.      Students are required to collect a Course Kit from Indukaka
Ipcowala Institute of Management on *Monday- March 24, 2025. *

2.       100% Attendance is Compulsory.

3.       It is required that you carry your own Identity Card.

4.       The details regarding schedule and venue will be informed through
email shortly.



Please find the Standard Operating Procedure(SOP) attached herewith for
your reference and understanding.


Feel free to contact the course coordinator in case of any queries.

Ms. Celine Davla - 9737517553



Happy Learning!



Regards,


-- 
*Ms. Celine Davla*
*Assistant Professor*
*HSS Department*
*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management*
*CHARUSAT*
*Mo. 9737517553*

--

subject: Fwd: Invitation to Circulate ‚Äì 1st DAAIG Workshop on Modern LLMs and Applications
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Wed, 12 Mar, 2025, 1:34 pm Subject: Fwd: Invitation to Circulate ‚Äì 1st DAAIG Workshop on
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, 12 Mar, 2025, 1:34‚ÄØpm
Subject: Fwd: Invitation to Circulate ‚Äì 1st DAAIG Workshop on Modern LLMs
and Applications
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dhiraj Golhar <202121010@daiict.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Mar 12, 2025 at 1:25‚ÄØPM
Subject: Invitation to Circulate ‚Äì 1st DAAIG Workshop on Modern LLMs and
Applications
To:
Cc: 2022 21004 <202221004@daiict.ac.in>, Sourish Dasgupta <
sourish_dasgupta@daiict.ac.in>


Dear Sir,

I hope you are doing well.

We are pleased to announce the *1st DAAIG Workshop on Modern LLMs and
Applications*, which will be held on *March 22-23, 2025*. This workshop
will bring together researchers, practitioners, and industry experts to
discuss the latest advancements in large language models (LLMs) and their
diverse applications.

We kindly request that you circulate this information within your
institution so that interested faculty, researchers, and students can
participate. Registration details and further information can be found on
the attached poster. For more information, please visit our website:
https://daaig.daiict.ac.in/.

We appreciate your support in spreading the word, and please feel free to
reach out if you need any further details.

Best regards,
Dhiraj Golhar
Convener DAAIG
DAIICT, Gandhinagar, Gujarat

https://daiig.daiict.ac.in

--
