subject: Fwd: Run for Women empowerment
snippet: Dear All!! I hope this message finds you well. As part of our Women's Day celebrations, we are excited to announce that we are organizing a marathon for all CHARUSAT family members. This event aims
content:
Dear All!!

I hope this message finds you well. As part of our Women‚Äôs Day
celebrations, we are excited to announce that we are organizing a marathon
for all CHARUSAT family members. This event aims to promote health,
celebrate women‚Äôs empowerment, and foster community spirit.

 Here are the details:

   -  *Date* : 8th March 2025 (i.e. Saturday)


   -  *Location*: CHARUSAT University to Changa Village


This is a great opportunity to engage with the communityy and inspire each
other. Your participation will contribute to a meaningful celebration of
Women‚Äôs day. We will give an exciting gift to the winner and a
participation certificate to both category participants.


Together, we can ensure a memorable experience for everyone involved.


Registration is compulsory on the below link till  27th FFebruary 2025  :


https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdslHQ8VLgz4hP0iC5oWK0tWZrQJShTAp-T0R1QF8sdvbh9Mw/viewform?usp=sf_link

Looking forward to your positive response!

*Regards,*
*WDC Convener*

--

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

*[image: Inline image 1]                    *

--

subject: Fwd: Space Talk Series, CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:36 PM Subject: Space Talk Series, CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT To: Charusat
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:36‚ÄØPM
Subject: Space Talk Series, CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir / Madam,

Greetings!!



To inculcate the culture of scientific research and to motivate students to
explore the opportunities in space science, we are excited to announce a *Space
Talk Series. *This series is customized to offer numerous benefits for
students, including:


¬∑  Awareness of Space Technology

¬∑  Showcasing various ongoing projects related to Space by ISRO

¬∑  Career Opportunities in Space Applications

The first talk in the series is organized by V. T. Patel Department of
Electronics and Communication Engineering, CSPIT, CHARUSAT and it will
focus on the topic titled *"**Indian Planetary Missions: Through the Eyes
of a Scientist"*

We are delighted to have *Dr Arpit Patel, Scientist-E, **Physical Research
Laboratory*, Ahmedabad, as a distinguished speaker. Dr. Arpit has
contributed to numerous payloads in Indian Space Missions such as *Mars
Orbiter Mission (Mangalyaan), Chandrayan -3, Aditya L1 *and many more.

Event Details:

¬∑  *Date:* Wednesday, February 19, 2025

¬∑  *Time:* 10:30 am onwards

¬∑  *Location:* Seminar Hall, 2nd floor, A6 Building

We look forward to your active participation in this *Space Talk Series*.
The registration link is as follows:

https://forms.gle/sqitonXPC2Jgxo4YA

For any query, kindly contact *Dr. Killol Pandya, M: 7600004093*,
*killolpandya.ec@charusat.ac.in
<killolpandya.ec@charusat.ac.in>*,

Regards,

Trushit Upadhyaya



-- 

Dr. Trushit Upadhyaya

Professor & I/c Principal

Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology

Faculty of Technology & Engineering

Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT)

CHARUSAT Campus, Changa, 388421

Petlad, Anand, Gujarat, India.

M: 7874840344

https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Gzsxo-oAAAAJ&hl=en

subject: Fwd: Regarding EOE Lab.
snippet: Dear Students, Civil portion will be completed in lab of MEUD101 EOE Lab by the end of this week so from 24 February 2025 to the end of the semester, Mechanical faculties will conduct 2 hours to
content:
Dear Students,

Civil portion will be completed in lab of MEUD101 EOE Lab by the end of
this week so *from 24 February 2025 to the end of the semester*, Mechanical
faculties will conduct 2 hours to complete EG portion of the EOE laboratory
in EG lab location (323/326/119). So, follow it accordingly.
--
Radhika Madam is requested to forward FY-Depstar students.
---

Regards,



*Dr. Sagar Chokshi,*

Associate Professor,
Department of Mechanical Engineering,

Faculty of Technology & Engineering,

Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology,
Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT),

snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:40 PM Subject: Fwd: Register for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì Hackathon
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:40‚ÄØPM
Subject: Fwd: Register for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì Hackathon for Solving
Real-World Challenges with AI & Data
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIEC IIT Gandhinagar <iiec@iitgn.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 2:37‚ÄØPM
Subject: Register for Hack the Future 2025 ‚Äì Hackathon for Solving
Real-World Challenges with AI & Data
To:


Dear Innovator,


Greetings from the IIT Gandhinagar Innovation and Entrepreneurship Center
(IIEC)!


We are thrilled to invite you to *Hack the Future 2025: Innovating
Intelligent Data Insights*, a national-level hackathon organized by IIEC,
IIT Gandhinagar, in collaboration with the *Ministry of Statistics and
Programme Implementation (MoSPI), Government of India*.


This *36-hour immersive challenge*, scheduled for *March 21‚Äì23, 2025*, at
IIEC, IIT Gandhinagar, will bring together developers, designers,
innovators, and students to leverage *AI and data science* in addressing
critical socio-economic and development challenges using publicly available
data.



*Why Participate?*

‚úÖ *Solve Real-World Problems:* Tackle challenges curated by MoSPI,
Government of India, and contribute to meaningful solutions.
üèÜ *Win Exciting Prizes:*

   - *1st Place:* ‚Çπ2,50,000
   - *2nd Place:* ‚Çπ1,50,000
   - *3rd Place:* ‚Çπ1,00,000
   - *2 Special Mentions:* ‚Çπ35,000 each
   üöÄ *Incubation & Piloting Opportunities:* Selected projects may be
   incubated at IIEC, IIT Gandhinagar, and piloted in collaboration with MoSPI.
   üöÄ *Network & Learn:* Connect with industry experts, policymakers, and
   fellow innovators to expand your horizons.


*Key Dates*

üìÖ *Application Window:* February 7‚Äì28, 2025
üì¢ *Shortlisted Participants Announced:* March 5, 2025
üí° *Hackathon & Pitching Event:* March 21‚Äì23, 2025


If you are passionate about *AI, data science, and innovation*, this is
your opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with like-minded
individuals, and create a lasting impact.


*Take the First Step*

üîó *Apply Now <https://form.jotform.com/250342766778468>*
üì© *For inquiries:* iiec@iitgn.ac.in | *Visit Us
<https://chat.deepseek.com/a/chat/s/127f9456-4fc6-47ab-bf6e-760519fe586c>*


We can‚Äôt wait to see your groundbreaking ideas at *Hack the Future 2025*!



Warm regards,
*Team IIEC*


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

*[image: Inline image 1]                    *

--

subject: Fwd: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Pichhwai Art Workshop - An Invitation for participation
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in> Date: Sat, Feb 15, 2025 at 4:50 PM Subject: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Pichhwai Art Workshop - An Invitation for
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Feb 15, 2025 at 4:50‚ÄØPM
Subject: CHARUSAT - IIIM and FoH - Pichhwai Art Workshop - An Invitation
for participation
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear CHARUSAT Family Members,



"The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things but
their inward significance.‚Äù ‚Äì Aristotle



We are delighted to inform you that the Faculty of Humanities, in
collaboration with Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management, CHARUSAT is
hosting a unique and enriching Pichhwai Art Workshop, scheduled for March
1, 2025. The workshop will be held in the afternoon slot, providing an
excellent opportunity to explore and engage with this traditional form of
Indian art. *Further, this workshop also aims at promoting Indian arts and
culture proliferated under NEP 2020*.



The ancient painting technique known as Pichhwai art, which originated in
Nathdwara, Rajasthan, some 400 years ago, is intricately linked to the
area's religious legacy. The background of Lord Shrinathji, a venerated
embodiment of Lord Shri Krishna, has long been decorated with these
paintings, which originated at the Nathdwara temple. The themes mostly
centre on events from Lord Shri Krishna's early childhood, which depict his
favourite festivals, pastimes, and seasonal festivities.In addition to
their traditional function as sacred temple hangings, Pichhwai paintings
have become more and more popular as home decor, interiors for museums, and
art galleries. Beyond paintings, the motifs and intricate designs are now
replicated on textiles, cushion covers, and carpets, preserving the
artistic legacy in contemporary decor.



We have invited upcoming and enthusiastic artists, Shri Mahesh Rabari and
Ms. Muskan Mehta. The artists conducting the Pichhwai Art Workshop are
highly skilled practitioners dedicated to preserving and promoting this
traditional art form. They have mastered the intricate techniques and
symbolism of Pichhwai Art, bringing its rich heritage to life.



*Workshop details are:*



¬∑  *Date: * March 1, 2025

¬∑  *Day: * Saturday

¬∑  *Time: * 1 pm to 4 pm

¬∑  *Venue:  *Centre Square, IIIM

¬∑  *Registration Link and QR Code: https://forms.gle/1jkaKWWLF7Wb4kCy7
<https://forms.gle/1jkaKWWLF7Wb4kCy7>*


[image: adobe-express-qr-code (4).png]



*Last date for the registration: February 21, 2024*


Contact Ms. Jayshree Mehta +91 76001 47568 for details.



Kindly find the event poster and captivating creations by the artists.



Thanks and Regards,





Binit Patel
Bhaskar Pandya


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

*[image: Inline image 1]                    *
ACCREDITED WITH ‚ÄúA+‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC, GOI

--

subject: CHARUSAT | FoH | Story Narrating Competition
snippet: Foundation Day 2025 Story Narrating Competition 2025 Jointly organized by Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management [IIIM] & Faculty of Humanities [FoH] "Unleash Your Imagination, Let Your
content:
[Foundation Day 2025]
[https://mailer.charusat.org.in/index.php/campaigns/ba137rl8rs736/track-url/ls409tohbwc79/20986db598676eb1ed549684c002d31f5728889c]


STORY NARRATING COMPETITION 2025

 Jointly organized by 

INDUKAKA IPCOWALA INSTITUTE OF MANAGEMENT [IIIM]
&
FACULTY OF HUMANITIES [FOH]

"Unleash Your Imagination, Let Your Story Shine!"

"Storytelling is an age-old art that captivates audiences, stimulates
imagination, and preserves cultural heritage. Join us in this exciting
event where stories come to life, imagination knows no bounds, and
voices create unforgettable experiences!" 

üåü ABOUT THE EVENT

STORY NARRATING COMPETITION 2025, organized under the theme
INDIAN KNOWLEDGE SYSTEM, is here to celebrate creativity, culture, and
storytelling!

üìÖ DATE & TIME: February 21, 2025 | 10:30 AM onwards 

üé≠ REGISTRATION DETAILS

 	* REGISTER BY: February 20, 2025
 	* STORY THEME: Folk Tales, Inspirational Stories, Mythological
Tales, or Fictional Narratives

Register Now
[https://mailer.charusat.org.in/index.php/campaigns/ba137rl8rs736/track-url/ls409tohbwc79/deffdbff2458022a5a6fc21a81761850f8a7161d]


üèÜ AWARDS & CERTIFICATIONS

 	* üèÖ WINNER & RUNNER-UP: Trophy
 	* üìú ALL PARTICIPANTS: Participation Certificate
 	* EVENT CONVENORS: Dr. Binit Patel | Dr. Bhaskar Pandya
 	* EVENT COORDINATOR: Dr. Kinjal Bhatia
 	* CONTACT INFORMATION: +91 9033395935
[https://mailer.charusat.org.in/index.php/campaigns/ba137rl8rs736/track-url/ls409tohbwc79/309b22b6c6cc4f64be972de0ba0d4daab6df6da8]

üì¢ GENERAL RULES

 	* The competition is open to all registered students. Participants
must confirm their registration before the event.
 	* The narration must be in English.
 	* Each participant will have a 3 to 5-minute time slot for their
narration. Exceeding the limit may result in a penalty.
 	* Minimal use of handheld props is allowed, but the focus should
remain on narration. Visual presentations are not permitted.
 	* The storytelling should be engaging, expressive, and creative.
Unique presentation styles are encouraged.
 	* Participants must narrate their stories from memory. Reading
directly from a script is not allowed.

üîπ JUDGING CRITERIA

 	* üìñ Content & Creativity
 	* üé§ Expression & Voice Modulation
 	* üíÉ Body Language & Presentation
 	* ‚è≥ Time Management
 	* üåü Overall Impact

üîπ ADDITIONAL GUILDELINES

 	* DRESS CODE: Participants should dress appropriately for their
narration. Costumes are optional but should not overpower the
storytelling.
 	* PUNCTUALITY: Participants must arrive at least 30 minutes before
their scheduled slot.

üé§ We can't wait to hear your stories! See you there! üé≠

-------------------------

With best Regards,
MR. KRUTEN PATEL
Executive Officer - Corporate Communications

subject: MSUD102-Reading Material, Assignment, and Practice Examples for Unit 2 & Unit 5
snippet: Dear Students, I have attached the reading material for Unit 2 and Unit 5, along with assignment questions and practice examples for both units. Once you complete Unit 1 and Unit 4, the assignment
content:
Dear Students,

I have attached the reading material for *Unit 2 and Unit 5*, along with
assignment questions and practice examples for both units.

Once you complete *Unit 1 and Unit 4*, the assignment evaluation will
begin. Therefore, please ensure that you write your assignments regularly.

If you have any queries or concerns, feel free to meet me in *Room 309,
CSPIT*, or communicate via email. I will be happy to assist you.

Best regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *

subject: Fwd: CHARUSAT - Indian Knowledge System - Story Narrating Competition - Invitation for students to participate
snippet: Dear Students, Interested students are encouraged to participate. regards, ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in> Date: Fri, Feb 14, 2025 at 3:51 PM
content:
Dear Students,

Interested students are encouraged to participate.

regards,

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Feb 14, 2025 at 3:51‚ÄØPM
Subject: CHARUSAT - Indian Knowledge System - Story Narrating Competition -
Invitation for students to participate
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

We are thrilled to invite all the students of CHARUSAT to participate in
the upcoming *Storytelling Competition*, an event designed to celebrate the
power of storytelling and creativity. This is their chance to bring stories
to life through compelling narration, expressive delivery, and engaging
presentation.

Whether they have a story to tell or wish to experience the magic of
storytelling, this competition is an excellent platform to showcase talent
and captivate the audience.

üìÖ *Date:* February 21, 2025 (Friday)

üìç *Venue:* Will be communicated to registered students

All the details regarding rules, judging criteria, and registration are
provided in the *attached brochure*. Kindly go through it, share it with
your students and inform the interested students to register by February
20, 2025.

Students should not miss this wonderful opportunity to refine their
storytelling skills and gain recognition for their talent.

We look forward to an exciting and inspiring event!

For any queries, feel free to reach out to *Dr. Kinjal Bhatia (+91
9033395935). *

Thanking you in anticipation of your positive response,

With regards,

Binit Patel
Bhaskar Pandya


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

*[image: Inline image 1]                    *
ACCREDITED WITH ‚ÄúA+‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC, GOI

--

subject: Online lecture link of MSUD102
snippet: Dear students, Kindly join the online lecture of MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics II) from 10.00 am onwards on 15th February, Saturday through the following link. https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-
content:
Dear students,

Kindly join the online lecture of MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics II) from
10.00 am onwards on 15th February, Saturday through the following link.

https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_ZjJmZGFmYmEtZjk0OS00NWVmLThjMGYtMmQyNjQ2NWNjYTBm%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%223ed35552-5e3c-4b13-916a-3622e7a12052%22%7d

This lecture will cover the last topic,  some real world problems of first
order ODE, of unit 1 as discussed in our regular theory classes.

Kindly join the lecture with your name as id number and join it before 5
minutes of the schedule.

Thank you.

-- 
* Dr. Rajendrakumar B. Chauhan*

* M.Sc., M.Phil., Ph.D. (Mathematics)*


* Assistant Professor Department of Mathematical Sciences, P. D. Patel
Institute of Applied Sciences,*

* Charotar University of Science & Technology, Changa, Gujarat, India.*

*E-mail: rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in
<rajendrachauhan.maths@charusat.ac.in>*

snippet: Thanks for filling out Topic Selection_Case Study Presentation (Video) _CSUC101 Here's what was received. Topic Selection_Case Study Presentation (Video) _CSUC101 his form is created to for
content:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out Topic Selection_Case Study Presentation (Video)  
_CSUC101
Here's what was received.


Topic Selection_Case Study Presentation (Video) _CSUC101

his form is created to for students of 2nd sem CSE_DEPSTAR to submit topic  
of Case Study Presentation.



Students need to first verify whether the topic is not already taken in the  
adjacent spreadsheet.



Then Student can enter topic of interest in this form and check its  
approval status in the adjacent spreadsheet. Kindly start preparing on the  
topic only after teacher gives approval. In case of topic rejected you need  
to submit topic again.



Note: Presentation needs to be recorded and uploaded on YouTube. Student  
need to submit link of YouTube video of Presentation on Presentation  
Assignment created in Microsoft Teams. Kindly ensure that the video link in  
either in public or unlisted view, do not keep it in private mode.



Requirements:



Your face must be visible while giving a presentation
There must be a minimum 20 presentation slides
The presentation must be a minimum of 10 minutes

24DCS053

subject: Fwd: Interactive and hands-on self-defense training session for female students and staff members of CHARUSAT, under EOC
snippet: Dear All, Girls students are encouraged to register and participate. regards, ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: mittal desai <mittaldesai.mca@charusat.ac.in> Date: Tue, Feb 11, 2025 at
content:
Dear All,

Girls students are encouraged to register and participate.

regards,

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: mittal desai <mittaldesai.mca@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Feb 11, 2025 at 10:17‚ÄØAM
Subject: Interactive and hands-on self-defense training session for female
students and staff members of CHARUSAT, under EOC
To: Mukesh Pal <mukeshpal.mba@charusat.ac.in>, Dr. Neeraj Jain <
neerajjain.as@charusat.ac.in>, Asifiqbal Thakor <
asifiqbalthakor.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Binal Joshi <
binaljoshi.nur@charusat.ac.in>, Geeta Marmat <geetamarmat.mba@charusat.ac.in>,
Dattatraya Ganpatrao Subhedar <dattatraya.me@charusat.ac.in>, Dhaval Bhoi <
dhavalbhoi.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Harshad Khade <
harshadkhade.cips@charusat.ac.in>, Hardik Jayswal <
hardikjayswal.it@charusat.ac.in>, Ashwin Makwana <
ashwinmakwana.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Hemant Yadav <
hemantyadav.it@charusat.ac.in>, Gaurang Patel <
gaurangpatel.dcs@charusat.ac.in>, Janki Thakker <
jankithakker.bt@charusat.ac.in>, Jivanadhar Joshi <
jivanjoshi.ee@charusat.ac.in>, kanan gamit <kanangamit.ph@charusat.ac.in>,
Kanchal Dave <kanchaldave.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Neeta Chudasama <
neetachudasama.dce@charusat.ac.in>, Nilay Solanki <
nilaysolanki.ph@charusat.ac.in>, Poonam Thanki <
poonamthanki.ec@charusat.ac.in>, Rajendra Solanki <
rajendrasolanki.adm@charusat.ac.in>, Rajnik Katriya <
rajnikkatriya.it@charusat.ac.in>, srushti gajjar <
srushtigajjar.cse@charusat.ac.in>, Dr. Kirti Makwana <
kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in>, Sumam Sunny <sumamsunny.phy@charusat.ac.in>,
Vipul Vyas <vipulvyas.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Head CE CHARUSAT <
hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Convener Equal Opportunity Cell CHARUSAT <convener.eoc@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear all,*

*In today‚Äôs world, personal safety and self-defense skills are essential
for everyone, especially for girls and women. *

*With rising concerns about safety and personal security, it is imperative
to equip young women with the skills and knowledge to protect themselves in
various situations.*

*CMPICA is organizing Interactive and hands-on self-defense training
session for female students and staff members of CHARUSAT, under EOC on 6th
March, 2025, 10:00AM to 12:00PM by **Sensei Chetan Fumakiya, Pratibha
Academy, Under the Project of Pratibha Self Defense Foundation.*

*All the interested female students and staff members are requested to
register using below link on or before 25/2/25:*
https://forms.gle/FHRA2WXU6t7zX2YZ6

*** The venue will be communicated soon.*

*****EOC Department Coordinators are requested to encourage students to
participate and please forward this mail to students of your department.*

Dr. Mittal Desai,
Assistant Professor, MCA Department, CMPICA.
Officer on Special Duty - Charusat Innovation Venture Fund (CIVF)

snippet: All registered participants of this event are kindly requested to fill out the provided sheet below. This will help us get an accurate count of students and make necessary arrangements for refreshments
content:
All registered participants of this event are kindly requested to fill out
the provided sheet below. This will help us get an accurate count of
students and make necessary arrangements for refreshments. Your cooperation
is greatly appreciated!

Additionally, please note that there are no restrictions on the format of
the poster presentation. You may submit it in either hard copy or soft
copy, whichever is more convenient for you.

 EOC activity
<https://drive.google.com/open?id=1jTlX8m_l3FHbzsCZb4ABvKZArdcL8IVwPQllC_feJcU>

subject: Fwd: EOC Activity by CSPIT[CE] CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE LIVES OF SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE.
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: PRIYA PEDHADIYA <23ce115@charusat.edu.in> Date: Tue, Feb 4, 2025 at 11:57 PM Subject: EOC Activity by CSPIT[CE] CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: PRIYA PEDHADIYA <23ce115@charusat.edu.in>
Date: Tue, Feb 4, 2025 at 11:57‚ÄØPM
Subject: EOC Activity by CSPIT[CE] CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE
LIVES OF SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE.
To: <22depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <23depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>,
<24depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: <23ce022@charusat.edu.in>


Dear All,
U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering, CSPIT organizes the
following Event in step towards helping people having disabilities or
Physically Challenged.

Title of the Event:* " CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE LIVES OF
SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE "*

*Guidelines:*
1.    Students may submit their creative working project ideas on a drawing
sheet of paper/PPT/PDF.
*Submission Link:* https://forms.gle/GUHRx6sLvhYPatmx7
These can be further modified on the day of presentation [15/02/2025].

2.    Last Extended Date of Entry Submission: 8th February, 2025 [Ideas
through online shared google form]. Each student has to make a separate
entry using the shared google form link.

3.    Students may use a pen, pencil, sketch pen or any other tools
[Computer Software/Hardware] to depict their ideas on the day of
presentation [Date: 15/02/2025, Venue: MAC LAB (601), A7 Building].
Participants must remain present in MAC LAB (601) [A7 Building] from 09:15
am to 12:00 pm on 15/02/2025, Saturday to present their project ideas.
Students may use presentations and poster to demonstrate their project
ideas.

4.    Students may show Project Implementation

5.    Students may submit their ideas in a group of a maximum 3 students.

6.    You need to submit your poster presentation in hard copy, it's size
should be A3.

7.    Best of the THREE Innovative Ideas will be awarded prize money &
certificate (First prize 1500 Rs/-, Second Prize 1000 Rs/-, Third Prize 500
Rs/-). Others will receive a certificate of participation.

*NOTE : *
Individual entries are also allowed .
For group entries you are free to form a group from any department and any
institute.
Make sure the maximum number of members of the group should not exceed 3 .

For any further query you may please contact student coordinators
( 23CE115 - Priya Pedhadiya (6354914979 and 23CE022 - Devam Ghodasara
(94264 31542) ).






-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Dear All,
U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering, CSPIT organizes the
following Event in step towards helping people having disabilities or
Physically Challenged.

SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE "*

sheet of paper/PPT/PDF.

through online shared google form]. Each student has to make a separate
entry using the shared google form link.

[Computer Software/Hardware] to depict their ideas on the *day of
presentation [Date: 15/02/2025, Venue: MAC LAB (601), A7 Building*].

Subject: MOOC Certification in Entrepreneurship
To: Sir/Madam <principal.dptr@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/Madam,

Recently, Turnip signed an MoU with AICTE regarding our *16-Day
Entrepreneurship Awareness Program*. Turnip was one of the 22 companies
selected as online education partners.
[image: Turnip signs MoU with AICTE]

With this course, scholars can *master fundamental startup concepts in a
simple and practical manner*. It can be conducted as a MOOC certification,
or any value added activity.

* Register via the Official Course Page *
<http://url5505.turnip.co.in/ls/click?upn=u001.3zvY44KeqgXrGb8wCP618VPaUVVizkWV3-2Bae7lmqk2FA1GglId78OJqbJuBqa0KAHJzYcZdZDqqhXtI7y16DxA-3D-3DpJRr_Ga7Lx8pu544RJnPoLnvD8W4pFiMiH0OCAfIBq4xgpeiOyQmkoVWiAR49-2F-2FLVLNcBdm6eC6N62lPSOc3Utx00GUaoIQ77h15zNMA9q-2FiQCraE-2BNKNgL02l0r0gNwj14O5-2Fh-2BBjloEqdIY0ANL4Bey0d7rD4oVGq0BxcBb-2FN4m2XyzapG2KKLkhQye-2FMZFbAezf84S0jtmQNtVAoO0sZ6t0HnkjKoMjPM6mk-2B9TkIAjP9XVIxqrI9lo2tImBu3vAiYvfU9MB31YUKUtGrJvhIbCdhkyq5qGwLPj9Ypd9Ume0ERfwMMv1Z-2F7FvNSN26q0dh7DNaYFzEx37WOUPJgEyR9CxzZ-2FpHXn1GtJsNOwZggW0-3D>

*Course features*

‚úÖ  Duration: 16 days (online, self-paced)
‚úÖ  Reduced fee (28th Feb): *‚Çπ295/-* (incl. quiz and certificate)
‚úÖ  *Upgraded AICTE Evaluated Certificate* with quiz score, institute name
and designation
‚úÖ  Includes course ebook and 100+ startup resources
‚úÖ  Starts immediately after registration and email verification

*Course lessons*

   - Key entrepreneurial traits
   - Why start a startup?
   - How to find startup ideas?
   - Validating startup ideas
   - Total Addressable Market (TAM)
   - Minimum Viable Product (MVP)
   - The Sales Funnel
   - AIDA Model
   - Digital Marketing Funnel
   - Go-to-market (GTM)
   - Product-Market Fit (PMF)
   - Team building
   - Fund raising
   - Forming a company in India
   - Bonus lesson and startup resources

*Course author*

The course is created by *Dr. Rahul Kapoor*, Founder and Director of Turnip
Innovations. He has a successful startup exit within B2B SaaS. He is a
Professor of Entrepreneurship and runs a Section 8 non-profit company as an
incubation center at IMI Kolkata.

*Please share the program details with all students, faculty and innovation
stakeholders*.

Thanks and regards,

Yukta Gupta | Marketing Manager
turnip.co.in

subject: "Internship_Career -UG Students of CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY "
snippet: Dear Student bearing Enrollment ID 24dcs053 from CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY. Congratulations on being shortlisted for the internship program! [IMPORTANT] LaunchEd Global in Collaboration IIT KHARAGPUR (
content:
*Dear Student bearing Enrollment ID 24dcs053** from CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY*.
*Congratulations on being shortlisted for the internship program!*
*[IMPORTANT]*

*LaunchEd Global* in Collaboration   *IIT KHARAGPUR (Kshitij) is* Organizing
a *2-month training & internship program with certifications from WIPRO
Dice ID, IBM, CISCO, META, and AICTE-approved.  *Gain *industry-leading
skills* and *real-world experience* to advance your career!

*Fill out the Google Form today to reserve your place in the program:*

*https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9 <https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9>*

*Join Our Official WhatsApp Group For More Information: *
*https://chat.whatsapp.com/HQlb0D2oAFl2Dfp4q9e3wR*
<https://chat.whatsapp.com/HQlb0D2oAFl2Dfp4q9e3wR>

*Here is an outline of the program's structure.*
*1. Training Outline*

   - *Live Mentoring with Industry Experts:* Evening classes (6:30 PM -
   8:00 PM) are conducted live on the Zoom platform to fit your schedule. Get
   guidance at every step.
- *From Basics to Advanced:* Perfect for beginners and those looking to
   refine advanced skills, starting from scratch.
- *AI-Powered Development Made Easy*: Build applications with minimal
   coding, create innovative solutions using Generative AI, and easily design
   effective AI prompts.
- *LMS Access for Flexibility: *Recorded live sessions will be uploaded to
   the Learning Management System (LMS) and available for 6 months from the
   batch start date. Login credentials will be shared after registration,
   ensuring uninterrupted learning at your own pace.

*2. Internship Conduct*

   - *10+ Minor Project**: *The minor project is an individual project,
   where students will work on projects related to each topic they are
   learning.
   - *Major Project (CAPSTONE):* The major project is a group project, and
   you will work in a group of 3-4 interns, with specific responsibilities
   assigned to each intern. The company will provide you with all the required
   data and materials for the project.
   - *Resume Building*: Get expert guidance to craft a standout resume that
   gets noticed.
   - *Mock Interviews*: Receive feedback from industry experts to sharpen
   your interview skills.
   - *Masterclasses*: Learn from top leaders in global companies through
   exclusive sessions.

*Certifications Provided*

   - *Course Certificate*: Receive a prestigious certificate from
   IIT-KHARAGPUR (Kshitij)
   - *Internship Certificate*: Earn a certificate from our partnered MNCs &
   StartUps.
   - *Verified by WIPRO Dice ID*: Both the Certificates will be verified by
   WIPRO Dice ID
   - *100% Placement Assistance: *Join Our Growth Community for Direct
   Placement Support with Top Companies.

content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Bina Patel <binapatel.maths@charusat.ac.in>

Mathematics-II (Course Code: MSUD102)

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Bina Patel <binapatel.maths@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Jan 10, 2025 at 1:30‚ÄØPM
Subject: Course Information and Evaluation Details for Engineering
Mathematics-II (Course Code: MSUD102)
To: <24depstarstudents@charusat.edu.in>, <24cspitstudents@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head Maths <head.maths@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

I hope you are doing well. I am Dr. Bina Patel, the subject
coordinator for *Engineering
Mathematics-II (Course Code: MSUD102)*. I would like to share with you the
course evaluation structure and important dates.
*Course Evaluation Structure*

The total marks for the course are *100*, divided as follows:

   -

   *50 Marks ‚Äì Internal Examination*
   - *20 Marks* for mid-term exams
      - *10 Marks* for two online quizzes (*5 marks each*)
      - *10 Marks* for assignments
      - *10 Marks* for class tests
   -

   *50 Marks ‚Äì External Examination *

*Important Dates (Tentative)*

   1. *First Quiz:* 10th March 2025
   2. *Second Quiz:* 1st May 2025
   3. *Class Test:* Last week of April 2025

I am attaching the following materials to help you prepare for the course:

   - Reading materials for *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Assignment examples for  *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Practice examples   *Unit 1* and *Unit 4*
   - Complete classwork examples

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to contact me via email.

Enjoy your mini vacation, and I look forward to seeing you in class!

Best regards,

*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

subject: Fwd: Fw: Online SSIP Sensitization Session for Students - Session Details for Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)
snippet: Dear CSIC Members, kindly inform the students to join on this link by today at 1:50 PM for Sensitization Program. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Nikhil Sharma(GoG-Education Dept.) <
content:
*Dear CSIC Members,*
*kindly inform the students to join on this link by today at 1:50 PM for
Sensitization Program.*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Nikhil Sharma(GoG-Education Dept.) <ssippmuc@gujarat.gov.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2025 at 11:20‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fw: Online SSIP Sensitization Session for Students - Session
Details for Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)
To: Kaminisolanki.mca@Charusat.ac.in <Kaminisolanki.mca@charusat.ac.in>





------------------------------
*From:* Nikhil Sharma(GoG-Education Dept.)
*Sent:* Tuesday, January 21, 2025 6:12 PM
*To:* pranavdesai.mba@charusat.ac.in; jaiminundavia.mca@charusat.ac.in
*Cc:* ssipgujarat@gmail.com; janaki.joshi@in.gt.com; provost@charusat.ac.in
*Subject:* Online SSIP Sensitization Session for Students - Session Details
for Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)


Dear SSIP Grantee,

Thank you for providing your preferred dates for the online SSIP
Sensitization session. We appreciate your prompt response.

We are pleased to inform you that we have allocated a session based on your
preferences. Here are the session details:

- Session Name: Innovation, Startups & SSIP 2.0 for Students
- Date: 3rd February 2025
- Time: 02: 00 PM Onwards
-  Link to Join the Session:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_NDZhZDBkYTctOGI2My00ZjExLTg3NjAtOTA3NjJjNzI1MzZi%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%2205b5fe2e-db2c-48e5-bfd8-778b75cb0f8e%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%225a944030-a39c-4aa6-ba4b-b718834fd228%22%7d


Meeting ID: 439 865 590 833

Passcode: ou9Vn9L5

Important Points to Note:

1. To facilitate a smooth session, students can be assembled in an
auditorium or classroom, and the online session will be projected for their
viewing.
2. Alternatively, links can be provided to students to join the session
directly.
3. Please note that this session is considered an "SSIP Sensitization
Session" event for your institution. Therefore, you are required to upload
event details, including pictures and attendance sheets, on the SSIP MIS
portal.
4. We encourage you to announce an IDEA competition immediately after the
session to encourage students to submit their innovative ideas. This will
enable us to fund a good number of Proof of Concepts (POCs) under this
policy.
5.  All the faculties are requested to join the session for better
understanding about the policy.

If you have any queries or concerns, please feel free to reach out to us.

Thank you again for your cooperation.

Regards,

SSIP -2.0, State PMU

subject: Fwd: US University Graduate Education Fair - @CHARUSAT on 4th FEB 2025
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Head CDPC CHARUSAT <head.cdpc@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2025 at 11:04 AM Subject: US University Graduate Education Fair - @CHARUSAT on 4th FEB
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Head CDPC CHARUSAT <head.cdpc@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2025 at 11:04‚ÄØAM
Subject: US University Graduate Education Fair - @CHARUSAT on 4th FEB 2025
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>



<https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ui=2&ik=5952a72cec&attid=0.1&permmsgid=msg-a:r-4577378780472427793&view=att&disp=safe&realattid=f_m6okuwz10&zw>Dear
All,
Greetings from Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC)!!

We invite you to explore the U.S. University Education Fair at our Campus. This
in-person fair is your chance to interact with 15+ reputed and accredited
U.S. Universities, offering a wide array of graduate programs (Master‚Äôs,
Ph.D. programs).

*Fair details: *

*Date : Tuesday, February 04, 2025*

*Time :  10.00 - 12.30 noon*

*Venue : Center Square , **IIIM BUILDING, Charusat University campus,
Changa*


Registration Required:

https://forms.gle/AvMb5rh1WNjKVhq9A


Fairs are an opportunity for you to connect with U.S. higher education
institutions to learn more about study options in the United States.

*Meet the Officials from 14 U.S. Universities :*

   - Governors State University
   - Lewis University
   - Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences [ MCPHS ]
   - Northeastern University
   - San Jose State University
   - The Catholic University of America
   - University of Louisville, College of Business
   - University of Massachusetts Lowell
   - University of Nebraska Lincoln
   - University of Southern California Marshall School of Business
   - University of Wisconsin Milwaukee
   - Wayne State University
   - Worcester Polytechnic Institute
   - ETS INDIA Testing Body [ TOEFL / GRE ]
   - Indo American Education Society


*STUDENT - TO DO LIST BEFORE THE FAIR:*


   1. Research participating Institutes before arriving at the fair event.
   2. Make a list of priority Institutes that you would like to visit
   followed by secondary interests.
   3. Visit booths in that order to ensure you have enough time!
   4. Create a list of questions you would like to ask university
   representatives that are not easily found on the Institute websites.
   5. After visiting a fair booth, write a few notes about your discussion.
   This will help you to remember individual conversations before visiting the
   next booth.
   6. You may also reach out to the Indo American Education Society for any
   guidance & information related to Higher Education in the US.
   7. Visit Institutes not already on your personal interest list time
   permitting. You might be surprised to identify new institutes that are not
   on your radar!

Highlights of the fair:

   -

   Chat one-to-one with U.S. university representatives and get your
   questions answered on programs, application processes and financial aid at
   these universities.
   -

   Collect the latest brochures and course descriptions of universities at
   your convenience during the fair.
   -

   Interact with Indo American Education Society advisers, A Trusted Non
   Profit advising center that provides accurate, current, comprehensive and
   unbiased information on the U.S. university application process.
   -

   Meet with testing organizations and discuss the latest updates on
   testing.



*Registration is done through the below link:*

https://forms.gle/AvMb5rh1WNjKVhq9A


[image: CHARUSAT_USA_Uni_Fair.jpg]


*Prof. Ashwin Makwana, *
Head, *Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC)*, CHARUSAT
Charotar University of Science & Technology, AT: Changa,
Ta:Petlad, Dist:Anand, Gujarat.
02697-265213/265123, (M)9408151969


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

Mobile:+91-9586861680

*[image: Inline image 1]                    *
ACCREDITED WITH ‚ÄúA+‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC, GOI

--

subject: Fwd: Invitation for- CSIC_FMD- Connect-Create- Collaborate
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal CIPS <principal.cips@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2025 at 6:29 AM Subject: Invitation for- CSIC_FMD- Connect-Create- Collaborate To:
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal CIPS <principal.cips@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2025 at 6:29‚ÄØAM
Subject: Invitation for- CSIC_FMD- Connect-Create- Collaborate
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Charusat Family Members,
Greetings for the day
Innovation in health sciences is crucial for improving patient outcomes,
advancing medical treatments, and ultimately saving lives. Through the
development of new technologies, therapies, and approaches, we can make
significant strides in combating diseases, enhancing healthcare delivery,
and promoting overall well-being.

The Idea Pitching Show will provide a platform for these innovators to
share their visions and ideas with a diverse audience of healthcare
professionals, researchers, investors, and community members. It will be an
opportunity to witness firsthand the cutting-edge advancements that can
transform the future of healthcare.

Your presence at this event would be invaluable and highly appreciated as
we evaluate the potential of these innovative ideas. Moreover, your
participation would show that you are committed to supporting the growth
and development of the health sciences field.

Event: Connect, Create, & Collaborate

Date: 20th February 2025 (detailed schedule will be announced soon)

Venue: MTIN-Auditorium

Regards

Prof Hemant Kumar, PhD
Professor and Principal BDIPS,
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT), Off.
Nadiad-Petlad Highway, Changa-388421, Anand, Gujarat, India


-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

subject: Opportunity to Join Blockchain Discussion on Bharat Blockchain Network
snippet: Dear Students, I hope you are doing well. We are excited to invite you to participate in an engaging Blockchain Discussion hosted on the Bharat Blockchain Network Discord Community. This is a great
content:
Dear Students,

I hope you are doing well.

We are excited to invite you to participate in an engaging *Blockchain
Discussion* hosted on the *Bharat Blockchain Network Discord Community*.
This is a great opportunity for blockchain enthusiasts to expand their
knowledge, interact with like-minded individuals, and showcase their
expertise.
*Discussion Details:*

   - *Format:* A structured discussion (not a formal debate) on a relevant
   blockchain topic.
   - *Topic:* Will be shared upon confirmation of participation.
   - *Preparation Time:* 3 days after topic announcement.
   - *Team Requirement:* 2 teams of at least 4 members each.
   - *Prizes:* Exciting rewards for outstanding contributions!

*Why Participate?*

   - Gain insights into the latest blockchain trends.
   - Engage in meaningful discussions with industry professionals.
   - Enhance your knowledge and critical thinking skills in blockchain
   technology.
   - A chance to win prizes for demonstrating exceptional understanding and
   ideas.

*How to Confirm Your Participation?*

To confirm your participation, please *reply to this email* with your team
details, including:

   - *Team Member Names*
   - *ID Numbers*
   - *Contact Numbers*

We look forward to your participation and an insightful discussion!

Best Regards,

*Shrey Lakhtaria**Dhairya Kanabar*
*Campus Ambassador, IDS/BBN*

-- 


Shrey Lakhtaria

Computer Science Engineering, CSPIT.

<https://github.com/shreylakhtaria>
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/shrey-lakhataria/>
<https://www.instagram.com/shrey7120/>

subject: Invitation to Workshop Series: Introduction to Quantum Computing: Fundamentals and Applications
snippet: Dear Students, We are pleased to invite you to an exciting workshop series on "Introduction to Quantum Computing: Fundamentals and Applications" organized by the Department of Computer
content:
Dear Students,

We are pleased to invite you to an exciting *workshop series on
"Introduction to Quantum Computing: Fundamentals and Applications"* organized
by the *Department of Computer Science & Engineering, **Devang Patel
Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), Charotar** University
of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT).*
*Workshop Details:*

üìÖ *Date:* 7th February 2025
‚è∞ *Time:* 12:10 PM ‚Äì 02:00 PM
üë®‚Äçüè´ *Speaker:* Dr. Nilesh Dubey, Assistant Professor, Department of
Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR, CHARUSAT
*Objective:*

This workshop aims to provide undergraduate students with a *comprehensive
introduction to quantum computing*, covering its fundamental principles and
real-world applications.

üìå *Register now* and don‚Äôt miss out on this knowledge-packed session!

https://forms.gle/nff8JdvX13CDkpLFA
*Agenda:**Module 1: Introduction to Quantum Computing*

üîπ What is Quantum Computing?
üîπ History and Evolution
üîπ Classical vs. Quantum Computing
üîπ Importance and Impact
*Module 2: Quantum Mechanics Basics*

üîπ Wave-Particle Duality
üîπ Superposition
üîπ Entanglement
üîπ Measurement and Observation
*Module 3: Quantum Computing Concepts*

üîπ Qubits and Quantum Gates
üîπ Quantum Circuits and Algorithms
*Module 4: Quantum Computing Applications*

üîπ Cryptography and Security
üîπ Optimization and Simulation
üîπ Machine Learning and AI

This is a great opportunity to *gain insights into the future of computing
and explore potential research and career opportunities in this field.*

Looking forward to your participation!
[image: Endowment.png]

--
*Dipak Ramoliya** /Assistant Professor,*
Department of Computer Science & Engineering, DEPSTAR,
Charotar University of Science & Technology(CHARUSAT)- Changa,
Email: dipakramoliya.ce@charusat.ac.in,
Mo. +91 99987 71587


*            Accredited Grade ‚ÄúA+‚Äù by NAAC, GOI*

--

Dear Dr. Amit Nayak

Greetings from IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation, IIT Indore !!

We are excited to invite you and your esteemed institution/organization to
participate in the DISHA (Developing Innovations for Successful Harnessing
and Adoption) program, spearheaded by the
<https://drishticps.iiti.ac.in/company-overview/>IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation
<https://drishticps.iiti.ac.in/company-overview/>. This program is an
exceptional opportunity for faculty and student-led startups to bring
groundbreaking innovations to life, transforming ideas into commercially
viable solutions.

About DISHA:
The DISHA program aims to identify, fund, and mentor deep-tech innovations,
facilitating their journey toward commercialization. It focuses on
Cyber-Physical
Systems (CPS) in critical areas such as Digital Healthcare, Intelligent
Manufacturing, and related domains, emphasizing System Modelling,
Simulation, and Visualization.

Who Can Apply:

   -

   Open to faculty, researchers, and students from higher education
   institutes across India who wish to commercialize their technology
by creating
   spinoff startups.
   -

   Faculty, researchers, and students with market-ready products or
   technologies aimed at commercialization.
   -

   Startups already incorporated as Private Limited/LLP by eligible faculty
   and/or researchers and/or students.
   -

   Existing Startups having strong academic link/willing to collaborate
   with academics for technology upgradation/willing to take IP developed
   in academia to the market through their startup.

Program Highlights:

   -

   Financial support of up to INR ‚Çπ50L initially, with additional funding based
   on progress up to INR ‚Çπ50L.
   -

   Comprehensive mentorship in technology and business development.
   -

   Assistance with IP filing, startup registration, and commercialization
   strategies.
   -

   Host institutions will receive grants from the IITI DRISHTI CPS
   Foundation to support startups and research initiatives at their respective
   institutions.
   -

   Access to entrepreneurial resources, including tools and credits for
   early-stage development.

Why Participate?
This initiative provides a unique platform to:

   -

   Bridge the gap between academia and industry.
   -

   Accelerate innovation to market-ready solutions.
   -

   Establish a network with experts, investors, and peers.

We firmly believe your institution‚Äôs or organization‚Äôs expertise and
innovative projects can significantly contribute to and benefit from this
initiative.

For more details on eligibility and application procedures, please refer to
the program guidelines attached here.

The application deadline is 9th February 2025, and we encourage you to
submit your proposals at your earliest convenience.

Link for Application: *Click Here
<https://drishticps.iiti.ac.in/technology-development/disha/>*

We look forward to your participation in shaping the future of innovation
and fostering impactful collaborations.

Note:

   1.

   Guidelines, FAQs and Program Brochure are attached for your reference in
   this email.


*Regards,*

Rekha Ganeshkar

IITI DRISHTI CPS Foundation


*E:* *tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in <tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in>*

*M:*  +919303854671

*W:* drishticps.iiti.ac.in

Simrol, Indore, 453552, Madhya Pradesh

-- 

*Dr. Kirti Makwana*

subject: "Internship_Career -UG Students of CHARUSAT "
snippet: Dear Student bearing Enrollment ID 24dcs053 from CHARUSAT. Congratulations on being shortlisted for the internship program! [IMPORTANT] LaunchEd Global in Collaboration IIT KHARAGPUR (Kshitij) is
content:
*Dear Student bearing Enrollment ID 24dcs053** from **CHARUSAT**.*
*Congratulations on being shortlisted for the internship program!*
*[IMPORTANT]*

*LaunchEd Global* in Collaboration   *IIT KHARAGPUR (Kshitij) is* Organizing
a *2-month training & internship program with certifications from WIPRO
Dice ID, IBM, CISCO, META, and AICTE-approved.  *Gain *industry-leading
skills* and *real-world experience* to advance your career!

*Fill out the Google Form today to reserve your place in the program:*

*https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9 <https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9>*

*Join Our Official WhatsApp Group For More Information: *
*https://chat.whatsapp.com/HQlb0D2oAFl2Dfp4q9e3wR*
<https://chat.whatsapp.com/HQlb0D2oAFl2Dfp4q9e3wR>

*Here is an outline of the program's structure.*
*1. Training Outline*

   - *Live Mentoring with Industry Experts:* Evening classes (6:30 PM -
   8:00 PM) are conducted live on the Zoom platform to fit your schedule. Get
   guidance at every step.
- *From Basics to Advanced:* Perfect for beginners and those looking to
   refine advanced skills, starting from scratch.
- *AI-Powered Development Made Easy*: Build applications with minimal
   coding, create innovative solutions using Generative AI, and easily design
   effective AI prompts.
- *LMS Access for Flexibility: *Recorded live sessions will be uploaded to
   the Learning Management System (LMS) and available for 6 months from the
   batch start date. Login credentials will be shared after registration,
   ensuring uninterrupted learning at your own pace.

*2. Internship Conduct*

   - *10+ Minor Project**: *The minor project is an individual project,
   where students will work on projects related to each topic they are
   learning.
   - *Major Project (CAPSTONE):* The major project is a group project, and
   you will work in a group of 3-4 interns, with specific responsibilities
   assigned to each intern. The company will provide you with all the required
   data and materials for the project.
   - *Resume Building*: Get expert guidance to craft a standout resume that
   gets noticed.
   - *Mock Interviews*: Receive feedback from industry experts to sharpen
   your interview skills.
   - *Masterclasses*: Learn from top leaders in global companies through
   exclusive sessions.

*Certifications Provided*

   - *Course Certificate*: Receive a prestigious certificate from
   IIT-KHARAGPUR (Kshitij)
   - *Internship Certificate*: Earn a certificate from our partnered MNCs &
   StartUps.
   - *Verified by WIPRO Dice ID*: Both the Certificates will be verified by
   WIPRO Dice ID
   - *100% Placement Assistance: *Join Our Growth Community for Direct
   Placement Support with Top Companies.

subject: Industrial Training & Academic Internship Internship Program Organized For CHARUSAT University Students
snippet: Dear Students of CHARUSAT ( 1st yr ) [ IMPORTANT] Salutations! We are in collaboration with IITs and are organizing a 2 Months Training + Internship program with certifications from CISCO, META[
content:
*Dear Students of CHARUSAT*
*( 1st yr )*
*[ IMPORTANT]*

*Salutations!*

We are in collaboration with *IITs  *and are organizing a 2 Months Training
+ Internship program with certifications from *CISCO, META[FACEBOOK], IBM* &
various other MNCs' s in technical and non-technical domains. We are
enrolling *SHORTLISTED STUDENTS *in the program for Charusat

*Note: If any of your batchmates are missed or haven't received
the notification, recipients are allowed to send this mail to them.*
*Registrations closing in 12 Hours.*

*https://forms.gle/og9XrYBWH4VBmFnXA* <https://forms.gle/og9XrYBWH4VBmFnXA>

*Students must submit their application. After getting shortlisted, you
will be getting a response from our HR Team:*




*FIND THE BELOW ATTACHMENTS FOR REFERENCE:*
*First month:* IIT training has been designed in the form of Live lectures
along with live mentorship from industry professionals. (Login credentials
will be provided to students after registration)

*Second month:* Internship with live mentorship for projects from
professionals. The LIVE INDUSTRY PROJECT will give students experience in
solving real-world problems.

*Project 1:-* 10 individual projects assigned to each intern which they
have to complete with their mentor.

*Project 2:-*  Capstone Project: It's a group project assigned to a group
of 15 interns. For each intern particular work will be assigned to them
they have to work on it.
(Essential data and materials required for the project will be provided by
the company side itself)

*Two types of Classes, we are providing:*

*1. Blended Program:* You will receive recorded sessions, whatever doubts
you have you can clear it in live doubt-clearing sessions which will be
organized every weekend.

*2. Mentor-led:* You will be having live Zoom classes at 6:30 PM  for 2 to
3 days a week. You will receive your recorded sessions as well
LMS(Learning Management System) portal which you will have admittance to
for 6 months.


*After Completion of the program, the student shall receive a:*
‚úÖ *Program completion certificate* issued by IITs.
‚úÖ *Certificates verified* through *Wipro* Dice ID.
‚úÖ Co-Branded *Internship certificate from Top MNCs.*
‚úÖ *100 percent Placement Assistance.*
‚úÖ Admittance to a *growing community*.
‚úÖ Program Offering with *Low-Code and No-Code Tools. *
‚úÖ *100 percent Outcome Driven Result.*
‚úÖ The curriculum includes *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering.*
‚úÖ *Exclusive Masterclasses* with *Founders and CXOs of Top Global
Companies.*
‚úÖ *Personalized Instructors* for proper guidance.

*[THIS NOTIFICATION FOR THE ENROLLMENT OF  FEB-MARCH, MARCH-APRIL &
APRIL-MAY BATCHES FOR STUDENTS WHO HAVEN'T BEEN ABLE TO ACCEPT THE
SCHOLARSHIP SLOT FOR THE SAME.]*

subject: Fwd: Regarding first year result - KYA
snippet: Dear Students, The results have been declared. If you are not satisfied with your grades in any subject, you can apply for Know Your Answer Sheet (KYA) within 3 working days, with the last date to
content:
Dear Students,

The results have been declared. If you are not satisfied with your grades
in any subject, you can apply for *Know Your Answer Sheet (KYA) *within 3
working days, with the last date to apply being *February 3.*

Please note that KYA is only applicable for the Theory University Exam and
not for internal or practical exams.

You can apply for KYA through e-Governance, either on campus or from
outside the campus. *The fee for KYA is ‚Çπ500 per subject*. After applying
for KYA, you will receive a call as well as an email from the exam section
to inform you of the date on which you need to visit with your parents to
review your answer sheet.

Students who wish to apply for KYA and have a backlog must meet me by
tomorrow. Additionally, *Supplementary Exam 1* will be conducted 15 days
after the result declaration.

--

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIT Guwahati Online <iitg.daksh.gurukul@masaischool.com>
Date: Tue, Jan 28, 2025 at 6:39‚ÄØAM
Subject: Your action is needed here | Opportunity for your students
To: <provost@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear Educator,*

Greetings from the *IIT Guwahati, Daksh Gurukul *team.

We are thrilled to inform you that the first phase of the Entrance Test for
the* Credit-Linked program in Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning *has
started. We seek your continued support in informing your students about
this significant opportunity. *This test is open to students regardless of
their degree (tech or non-tech) or year of study.*

*Selection Process:*

   - *Top-performing students* will be offered enrollment into the program.
   - A *waiting list* will be maintained for qualified candidates, who will
   be notified if seats become available.

*Test Details:*

   - *Date:* 2nd February 2025 (Sunday)
   - *Mode:* Online
   - *Registration Deadline:* 30th January 2025
   - *Registration Link: * *https://bit.ly/IITGuwahatiFirstAI
   <https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiFirstAI/1/01000194aa74f12d-0d488bf3-bce1-48d5-b714-a06037606af4-000000/QN1H9jBTd0P3EuBxCHb2hlcnhl8=410>*

 *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiFirstAI/2/01000194aa74f12d-0d488bf3-bce1-48d5-b714-a06037606af4-000000/UVu5p1u-LD8ltLUWEOwVoFQEUF8=410>*

*Why the Entrance Test is Important:*
The entrance test assesses fundamental knowledge and *Logical Reasoning*,
providing a fair evaluation for students from all backgrounds. It serves as
an essential step for gaining admission to this highly competitive program,
which includes *hands-on learning*, real-world projects, and personalized
mentorship from *IIT Guwahati *professors and industry experts.

*Curriculum Overview:*
The program provides a comprehensive curriculum that covers all the
essential concepts of *AI and ML with an industry-aligned curriculum.*.

*Key Benefits of the Program:*

   - Earn a prestigious *Certificate from IIT Guwahati *
   - Access to *exclusive career opportunities* and mentorship for tech
   career
   - Build an impressive *portfolio* that demonstrates practical skills

We kindly ask for your support in encouraging your students to register for
the entrance test and take the first step toward a successful career. You
can easily share this information by forwarding this email to your students
or* click here to share on Whatsapp
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fapi.whatsapp.com%2Fsend%2F%3Ftext=New%2BOpportunity%2BFrom%2BIIT%253A%250A%250AFirst%2BPan-India%2BEntrance%2BTest%2Bfor%2BIIT%2BGuwahati%2527s%2BCredit-Linked%2BAI%2B%2528Artificial%2BIntelligence%2529%2B%2526%2BML%2B%2528Machine%2BLearning%2529%2BProgram.%2B%250A%250AThe%2Btest%2Bis%2Bscheduled%2Bfor%2B%252A2nd%2BFeb%2B2025%2B%2528Sunday%2529%252A%2Band%2Bwill%2Bbe%2Bconducted%2B%252Aonline%252A.%2B%250A%250A%252A%252ARegistration%2Bcloses%2Btoday%253A%252A%2Bhttps%253A%252F%252Fbit.ly%252FIITGuwahatiFirstAI%2B%250A%250AThe%2Btest%2Bevaluates%2B%252Abasic%2Bfoundation%252C%2Breasoning%252C%2Band%2Blogical%2Bskills%252C%2Bmaking%2Bit%2Baccessible%2Bto%2Bstudents%2Bfrom%2B%252A%252Aany%2Bdegree%2Bor%2Bacademic%2Byear%252A%252A.%2BTop%2Bperformers%2Bwill%2Bsecure%2Badmission%2Bto%2Bthe%2Bprogram%252C%2Bwith%2Ba%2B%252A%252Awaiting%2Blist%252A%2Bfor%2Bqualified%2Bcandidates.%250A%250ADon%25E2%2580%2599t%2Bmiss%2Bthis%2Bopportunity%2Bthat%2Bequips%2Bstudents%2Bwith%2B%252Acutting-edge%2Bskills%2Bin%2BAI%252A%25E2%2580%2594register%2Bnow%2521%26type=custom_url%26app_absent=0/1/01000194aa74f12d-0d488bf3-bce1-48d5-b714-a06037606af4-000000/1wWJd7ydJ4jtW4kAq8iHTEVCkFc=410>*


*Thanks,  Team AI & ML  - Daksh Gurukul, IIT Guwahati*

content:

Space Tutor

*Dr R.V. Upadhyay,*

Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)

<registrar@charusat.ac.in> | w: www.charusat.ac.in



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Amogh Shet <amogh@agnirva.com>
Date: Tue, Jan 28, 2025 at 8:00‚ÄØAM
Subject: Internship Opportunity with Agnirva Space - ISRO Registered Space
Tutor
To: Agnirva Space <space@agnirva.com>


Dear Sir/Madam,

We trust this message finds you well. We are delighted to present a unique
educational advancement for your students through The Agnirva Space
Internship Program
<https://www.agnirva.com/challenge-page/the-agnirva-space-internship-program>
(Free
and Online), Recognized by AICTE and provided by Agnirva.com - an ISRO
Registered
Space Tutor, inaugurated by IN-SPACe.

Please encourage your students to join this free online program
<https://www.agnirva.com/challenge-page/the-agnirva-space-internship-program>.
~ 55,000+ students from esteemed institutions like BITS Pilani, IIM
Bangalore, ISB Hyderabad, IIT Kharagpur, IIT Delhi, IIT Bhu, Delhi
University, LPU, VIT Vellore and 500+ other institutions have already
enrolled. We believe this program can significantly benefit your students
as well.

The Agnirva Space Internship Program
<https://www.agnirva.com/challenge-page/the-agnirva-space-internship-program>
not
only equips students with advanced knowledge in space sciences but also
prepares them for significant future roles across various industries
influenced by space technology. This program offers comprehensive space
content that culminates in a well-deserved certificate.

[image: Aicte Recognised - Agnirva Space Internship Program.jpg]

Regards,

Team Agnirva.com

--

who have enrolled may change their profile and provide the following
information.*

[image: image.png]

 There are some compulsory steps to follow. Please take care of the
following steps while enrollment/registration.

¬∑        During enrolment say *‚ÄúYES‚Äù *to SWAYM Local Chapter as shown below.

¬∑        During enrolment select college name *‚ÄúCharotar University of
Science And Technology‚Äù* correctly as shown in the image below.

¬∑        *Choose Mentor* from your course *once instructed*.

¬∑        Take care of submitting *assignments* before deadline.

¬∑        *Register for exam* before deadline as mentioned on the website.

-- 
*Regards,*

*Nirav Bhatt*

23ce115@charusat.edu.in>


Dear All,



U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering, CSPIT organizes the
following Event in step towards helping people having disabilities or
Physically Challenged.



*Title of the Event:* " CREATIVE PROJECT IDEAS FOR IMPROVING THE LIVES OF
SPECIALLY ABLED PEOPLE "



Guidelines:



1.    Students may submit their creative working project ideas on
a drawing sheet of paper/PPT/PDF.


Submission Link: https://forms.gle/GUHRx6sLvhYPatmx7


These can be further modified on the day of presentation [*15/02/2025*].

2.    Last *Extended Date* of Entry Submission: *8th** February, 2025* [Ideas
through online shared google form]. Each student has to make a separate
entry using the shared google form link.

3.    Students may use a pen, pencil, sketch pen or any other tools
[Computer Software/Hardware] to depict their ideas on the day of
presentation [Date: 15/02/2025, Venue: MAC LAB (601), A7 Building].
Participants must remain present in MAC LAB (601) [A7 Building] from 09:15
am to 12:00 pm on 15/02/2025, Saturday to present their project ideas.
Students may use presentations and poster to demonstrate
their project ideas.

4.    Students may show Project Implementation

5.    Students may submit their ideas in a group of a maximum 3 students.

6.    Best of the THREE Innovative Ideas will be awarded prize money &
certificate *(First prize 1500 Rs/-, Second Prize 1000 Rs/-, Third Prize
500 Rs/-)*. Others will receive a certificate of participation.

subject: Fwd: Stalls of Overseas Study Consultants at RPCP
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal RPCP CHARUSAT <principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Jan 23, 2025, 4:36 PM Subject: Stalls of Overseas Study Consultants at RPCP To:
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal RPCP CHARUSAT <principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Jan 23, 2025, 4:36 PM
Subject: Stalls of Overseas Study Consultants at RPCP
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

We are excited to invite you to explore opportunities for higher studies
abroad at our upcoming event Avalanche 2025 at RPCP. A variety of esteemed
organizations will be showcasing their programs, offering valuable insights
into the best international study options.

*Date:*24-25 Jan 2025
*Time:* 10:00 am onwards
*Venue:* RPCP Building

Come and meet representatives to learn about scholarships, application
procedures, and explore a wide range of courses and programs designed to
help you further your academic and professional career.


*Stalls to Visit:*

   1.

   *Disha Consultant*: Specializing in university selection, visa guidance,
   and financing for studies in the US, Canada, and Germany. With 22 years of
   experience, let them guide you to your academic dreams.
   2.

   *Apomind*: Offering GPAT/NIPER coaching with a gamified learning
   platform for an engaging and effective study experience.
   3.

   *Pharmavision*: Experts in pharmacist career counseling with over 15
   years of experience helping students navigate their future careers in
   pharmacy.
   4.

   *Kanan International*: The trusted immigration consultancy with over 24
   years of experience, providing coaching for IELTS, TOEFL, GRE, and SAT,
   along with study abroad guidance.
   5.

   *Apex Education*: Leading IELTS institute with personalized assistance
   for your international study plans.
   6.

   *Aussizz Group*: A leader in education and migration consultancy,
   offering visa services and top-tier coaching for IELTS and PTE preparation.
   7.

   *Aspire Square*: Experts in study abroad consulting for destinations
   like Australia, Canada, the UK, the USA, and New Zealand, plus DMIT tests
   and immigration services.
   8.

   *Future Link*: A Canada-based consultancy helping students with visa
   assistance and coaching for global study opportunities, with 60,000+
   success stories.
   9.

   *D-Vivid*: Simplifying the study abroad process with experienced
   advisors ready to guide you to success.

Don‚Äôt miss this chance to take the next step in your education journey. We
look forward to your presence!

A kind request to forward to the students.
-- 
*Dr. Manan Raval*
*Principal - Ramanbhai Patel College of Pharmacy*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology*
*CHARUSAT Campus,*
*Changa - 388421, Ta: Petlad, Di: Anand*
*Ext. No. - (02697) 265141*
*E-mail - principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in <principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in>*

--

subject: Fwd: Alert Regarding Fraudulent Job Appointment Scams Using AICTE and MOE Identities-Regarding
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Jan 23, 2025, 4:40 PM Subject: Fwd: Alert Regarding Fraudulent Job Appointment Scams
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal DEPSTAR <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Jan 23, 2025, 4:40 PM
Subject: Fwd: Alert Regarding Fraudulent Job Appointment Scams Using AICTE
and MOE Identities-Regarding
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <aictenoreply@aicte-india.org>
Date: Thu, Jan 23, 2025 at 4:29‚ÄØPM
Subject: Alert Regarding Fraudulent Job Appointment Scams Using AICTE and
MOE Identities-Regarding
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


To,
The Vice Chancellors Of Technical Universities
Directors/Principals of AICTE-Approved Institutions

Subject: Alert Regarding Fraudulent Job Appointment Scams Using AICTE and
MOE Identities.

It has come to the attention of the All India Council for Technical
Education (AICTE) that fraudulent activities are being conducted wherein
fake job appointment letters and related communications are issued in the
name of AICTE and Ministry of Education (MOE) officers. These
communications are sent from counterfeit email addresses resembling
official domains, misleading individuals into believing they have been
offered employment opportunities. It is for your information that the All
India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) uses only its own domain
as  aicte-india.org
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=A1kBBgkfAhlSB1VN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DAlert%2BRegarding%2BFraudulent%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRgJMHQQKUBdUFAtYAFxQTV1BBUk=&ext=>
 for any communication.
Key points of Concern:
1. Nature Of Fraud: Fraudsters are impersonating AICTE and MOE officials
and issuing fraudulent job offers,
2. Tactics Used: Use Of fake email addresses and forged documents to appear
legitimate.
3, Impact: Such scams tarnish the reputation Of AICTE and MOE while
exploiting unsuspecting individuals.
Actions to be Taken by Institutions:
1.  Raise Awareness: Inform all students, faculty, and staff about this
fraudulent activity and advise them to be cautious when dealing with
unsolicited job offers.
2.  Verification Protocol: Encourage individuals to verify the authenticity
of any job-related communication purportedly from AICTE or MOE by
contacting official channels.
3.  Report Suspicious Activity: Direct any instances of fraudulent
communication to the AICTE or the Cyber Crime Division immediately,
4.  Publish Notifications: Kindly display this circular on notice boards
and circulate it widely among your institution's community.
5. In view of the above, once again all the institutions are requested to
respond/ provide data to communication received only from the domain @
aicte-india.org
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=A1kBBgkfAhlSB1VN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DAlert%2BRegarding%2BFraudulent%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRgJMHQQKUBdUFAtYAFxQTV1BBUk=&ext=>
 or @ go v.in
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=A1kBBgkfAhlSB1RN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DAlert%2BRegarding%2BFraudulent%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRgJMHQIMRU1YV00=&ext=>
.

Reporting Cyber Fraud:
Institutions and individuals are requested to report such incidents to the
local Cyber Crime Cell and the Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT.ln)
at the earliest.
Your proactive action is crucial in combating this menace and ensuring the
safety and security of our academic community. Please remain vigilant and
help us safeguard the integrity Of our esteemed organizations.

Thank you for your immediate attention and action.

PFA:-  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JJMTGQIgTVB5ASOhpSUlw-5PBqsIQio2/view?usp=sharing
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=A1kBBgkfAhlSB1tN&sl=cx1ySm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DAlert%2BRegarding%2BFraudulent%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRktZHUoHQQpHXExRC1pWD1cdAQlfGlNcDwZNXU4DfSgsZyFieFc2b3IAd2J/DkhmZA0RGwRldEEQf2BaDQNOR19dFA==&ext=dXNwPXNoYXJpbmc=>


* With regards *
*  Dr. Prashant Kharat  *
*  Dy. Director & CISO    *
*  All India Council for Technical Education *
*  Nelson Mandela road, Vasantkunj, New Delhi-110070
<https://www.google.com/maps/search/Nelson+Mandela+road,+Vasantkunj,+New+Delhi-110070?entry=gmail&source=g>
*

--
Click Here
<http://elink.aicte-india.org/vtrack?clientid=183745&ul=BlQGB0RTThURWg1SUBJXCBtVBkJAFgdAdVZdAhEXSgBGGQMCHQ9dTUweCA==&ml=A1kBBgkfAhlSBlZN&sl=cx1kSm0wTjYuZx9UVQtYDxtQClFHB0tbW1FcAk0NSwZOBw==&pp=0&ga=utm_source%3DNetcore%26utm_campaign%3DAlert%2BRegarding%2BFraudulent%26utm_medium%3DEmail%26utm_content%3D&fl=WRVFRgJMHQAPWg1aFwNfB0FUTltdBg9TG1pHBEwDUAJGUj0IXQJaUFMHXB8=&ext=cD1zbXVuc3ViJm1pZD0yOCZ1aWQ9W1VOSVFJRF0md3ZpZD0wMDE=>
to unsubscribe from this newsletter.

Subject: Fwd: New opportunity | Kindly share with your students
To: Depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IIT Guwahati <syed.fahad@masaischool.com>
Date: Thu, Jan 23, 2025 at 8:15‚ÄØAM
Subject: New opportunity | Kindly share with your students
To: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>


*Respected Educator,*

I am delighted to share an incredible opportunity for your students to join
the *AI (Artificial Intelligence) & ML (Machine Learning) Credit-Linked
Program*, offered by Daksh Gurukul - *IIT Guwahati*. This program is
tailored to equip learners with cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence and
Machine Learning skills, mentored by IIT Guwahati professors and industry
leaders from top organizations.

The program begins with the *First PAN-India Entrance Test on 26th January
2025.* We kindly request you to encourage students to register for this
pioneering opportunity today.

*Test Details:*

Date: 26th Jan 2025 (Sunday)
Mode: Online
Registration Link: *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiFirstAI/1/01000194910c8a3c-8378edff-58aa-4345-bc80-1a78143c84ea-000000/b-aUUUJhY1zZ9JSIMX_h2GGUqj4=410>*

 *Click here to register
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FIITGuwahatiFirstAI/2/01000194910c8a3c-8378edff-58aa-4345-bc80-1a78143c84ea-000000/nCxny5EzYcRhVGvdWj_xTf0UMPs=410>*

*What Makes This Initiative Stand Out?*
The entrance test is open to students from* all educational backgrounds*
and evaluates basic foundation, reasoning, and logical skills. It ensures a
fair and transparent selection process for all applicants.

   - *Credit-Linked Advantage:* Students earn academic credits,
   distinguishing this program from standard certification courses.
   - *Industry-Aligned Curriculum:* Designed to meet the latest demands in
   AI-driven industries.
   - *Guided by Experts:* Training sessions led by experienced faculty and
   industry professionals.

We kindly request your support in sharing this opportunity with your
students. Please encourage them to register and take the first step toward
an impactful career in Artificial Intelligence. *You can easily share this
information by forwarding this email or clicking here to share via
WhatsApp.
<https://xbjt7q5k.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fwa.me%2F%3Ftext=New%2520Opportunity%253A%250A%250AFirst%2520Pan-India%2520Entrance%2520Test%2520for%2520IIT%2520Guwahati's%2520Credit-Linked%2520AI%2520(Artificial%2520Intelligence)%2520%2526%2520ML%2520(Machine%2520Learning)%2520Program.%2520%250A%250AThe%2520test%2520is%2520scheduled%2520for%2520*26th%2520January%25202025%2520(Sunday)*%2520and%2520will%2520be%2520conducted%2520*online*.%2520%250A%250A**Registration%2520closes%2520today%253A*%2520https%253A%252F%252Fbit.ly%252FIITGuwahatiFirstAI%2520%250A%250AThe%2520test%2520evaluates%2520*basic%2520foundation%252C%2520reasoning%252C%2520and%2520logical%2520skills%252C%2520making%2520it%2520accessible%2520to%2520students%2520from%2520**any%2520degree%2520or%2520academic%2520year**.%2520Top%2520performers%2520will%2520secure%2520admission%2520to%2520the%2520program%252C%2520with%2520a%2520**waiting%2520list*%2520for%2520qualified%2520candidates.%250A%250ADon%25E2%2580%2599t%2520miss%2520this%2520opportunity%2520that%2520equips%2520students%2520with%2520*cutting-edge%2520skills%2520in%2520AI*%25E2%2580%2594register%2520now%2521/1/01000194910c8a3c-8378edff-58aa-4345-bc80-1a78143c84ea-000000/ll2uJ4JtaWsaOLYhU7PcFeOkz0k=410>*


*Best regards, ~Team IIT Guwahati (Daksh Gurukul),  Credit-Linked AI & ML
Program*
